commentary.comment: Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the bottom left corner, but Nick Pope was alert and made an astonishing save!

Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) unleashes a sweet first-timer from the edge of the box to the left side of the goal. The goalkeeper stops the shot with a quick save. The referee blows his whistle, Bournemouth are awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Ashley Westwood takes aim and his effort deflects off Chris Wood (Burnley) to beat the goalkeeper. 1:0.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Substitution. Lys Mousset did his best and is replaced by Callum Wilson (Bournemouth).
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Emerson Hyndman and he is replaced by Dan Gosling (Bournemouth).
Substitution. Chris Wood is replaced by Sam Vokes (Burnley).
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Tyrone Mings will be replaced by Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth).

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender. Burnley force a corner. They send men into the box.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the top right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
It is time for a substitution. Nahki Wells (Burnley) is on for Johann Gudmundsson.

CLOSE! Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the left post! The ball goes out of play and Burnley will have a goal kick.
Goal - 1:2! Jermain Defoe laid the ball off to Callum Wilson (Bournemouth), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Substitution. Aaron Lennon makes his way off the pitch and Dwight McNeil (Burnley) comes on as his replacement.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Ben Foster is alert and denies him.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Chris Brunt (West Brom) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
What was Craig Dawson (West Brom) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Ben Foster was forced into action to thwart Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) is free in the box and Patrick van Aanholt finds him with a pass, but his powerful shot skims just past the right post. Good chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Brom.

What a huge chance for Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and West Brom will have a goal kick.
Grzegorz Krychowiak goes off the pitch and Nacer Chadli (West Brom) comes on.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Roy Hodgson decides to make a substitution. James McArthur will be replaced by Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace).
Goal! Patrick van Aanholt plays a pass to the feet of Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace), and he shoots inside the right post from inside the box. It's 1:0.
It is time for a substitution. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) is on for Jose Rondon.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jay Rodriguez as he is replaced by Daniel Sturridge (West Brom).
Goal! Andros Townsend slips in Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) for a one-on-one with the keeper, and he simply dinks the ball over him into the net.
Kieran Gibbs (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Jonathan Moss and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Roy Hodgson has decided to substitute Patrick van Aanholt and he is replaced by Pape Souare (Crystal Palace).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) is coming onto the pitch as Andros Townsend cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Jonathan Moss is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Christopher Schindler (Huddersfield) reacted quickly inside the box and got on the end of the resulting corner. He hit a low drive towards the middle, but the goalkeeper pulled off a great reflex save.
What a big chance! Tom Ince (Huddersfield) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal) meets a fine cross on the edge of the box from the resulting corner kick and shoots. His shot flies just wide of the left post.
It's a goal! Aaron Ramsey plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
David Wagner has decided to substitute Tom Ince and he is replaced by Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield).
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
The game has come to an end for Sead Kolasinac. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nacho Monreal (Arsenal).
The manager makes a subsitution with Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal) coming on for Alex Iwobi.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philip Billing (Huddersfield) comes onto the pitch for Steve Mounie.

Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Jonas Lossl was alert and the score remains the same.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) was close to scoring after he unleashed a powerful shot which went a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Dean Whitehead (Huddersfield) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jonathan Hogg walks off.
Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!

Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would probably have ended up in the bottom left corner, but David Ospina pulls off a decent save to thwart him.
Michael Oliver shows the yellow card to Mathias Jorgensen (Huddersfield) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Mathew Ryan, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.

A superb goal from great team play! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.

Liverpool force their opponents to concede a corner. Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Goal! Andrew Robertson is the provider and Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) is the executioner, dispatching the cross into the right of the goal from close in with his head. 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Great team effort! Mohamed Salah is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot which bounces in off the inside of the right post to make the score 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Glenn Murray (Brighton) is coming onto the pitch as Jurgen Locadia cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Chris Hughton has decided to make a change. Pascal Gross (Brighton) replaces Beram Kayal.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the roof of the net. Mathew Ryan is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Liverpool force a corner. They send men into the box.
That will be all from Shane Duffy who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Connor Goldson (Brighton).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Sadio Mane and he is replaced by Adam Lallana (Liverpool).
It is time for a substitution. Danny Ings (Liverpool) is on for Roberto Firmino.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Benjamin Woodburn (Liverpool) replacing Mohamed Salah.
Goal! Andrew Robertson (Liverpool) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 4:0.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Today's referee Lee Mason rightly decides to book Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) for his harsh tackle.
A substitution has been made. Christian Kabasele goes off and Adrian Mariappa (Watford) comes on.

It's a goal! Juan Manuel Mata plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Marcus Rashford (Manchester United). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.

Sergio Romero makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom right corner by Richarlison (Watford) after a cross from the side. The linesman makes the right call and Watford will have a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Ashley Young (Manchester United) gets a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Luke Shaw (Manchester United) comes onto the pitch so that Ashley Young can be given a rest.
Javier Gracia Carlos has decided to substitute Gerard Deulofeu and he is replaced by Troy Deeney (Watford).
The referee shows the yellow card to Scott McTominay (Manchester United).
A substitution has been made. Andre Gray is replaced by Nathaniel Chalobah (Watford).
Here is a change. Daley Blind is going off and Jose Mourinho gives the last tactical orders to Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Paul Pogba (Manchester United) for Michael Carrick.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Luke Shaw (Manchester United).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) meets a precise pass with a nice touch on the edge of the box and produces a shot to the middle of the goal. What an excellent save by the goalkeeper!
Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) bends the ball in from the edge of the box which worries the keeper, but it eventually sails just wide of the left post.
Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 1:0.
Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) tricks his way to the edge of the box where he shoots at goal. The keeper scrambles to cover the effort, but it goes just wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
It will be a substitution. Joselu (Newcastle Utd) is ready to enter the pitch as Dwight Gayle walks off.
A great touch by Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) as he meets a cross inside the box. He produces a snap shot towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper dives to punch the ball away. World class save!

Goal! Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. Jonjo Shelvey assisted in the goal. 2:0.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea).

Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) scores after a cross from the free kick. He controls the ball with a precise first touch and hits the net! His low effort from inside the box went into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Matt Ritchie walks off the pitch and Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) comes on as a substitute.
Antonio Conte has decided to substitute Olivier Giroud and he is replaced by Alvaro Morata (Chelsea).
Willian (Chelsea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ross Barkley.
A substitution has been made. Eden Hazard is replaced by Pedro (Chelsea).
Mohamed Diame comes off the pitch to be replaced by Massadio Haidara (Newcastle Utd).
Martin Atkinson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Jack Stephens (Southampton) sees his header crash off the crossbar after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Fabian Delph.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) fires a rebound from close range only onto the right post.

John Stones (Manchester City) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top of the net. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. Manchester City force their opponents to concede a corner.
Substitution. Nathan Redmond did his best and is replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Charlie Austin and he is replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
The foul by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.

Dusan Tadic (Southampton) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
Substitution. Bernardo Silva makes way for Brahim Diaz (Manchester City).
Mark Hughes prepares a substitution. Ryan Bertrand is replaced by Sam McQueen (Southampton).
It's time for a substitution. Phil Foden (Manchester City) comes on in place of Ilkay Gundogan.
Caution goes to Cedric Soares (Southampton).
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) picks up a yellow card.
GOAL! Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Alex McCarthy, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 0:1.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Ederson (Manchester City) is penalised.
The first half has started.
Joe Allen is being substituted because of an injury. Paul Lambert sends Darren Fletcher (Stoke City) on the pitch.
Goal Andy King (Swansea)! Andy King (Swansea) was put through by Andre Ayew and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Close! Wayne Routledge (Swansea) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
GOAL - 1:1! Xherdan Shaqiri found Papa Ndiaye (Stoke City) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Lukasz Fabianski off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Mike van der Hoorn (Swansea) for his blatant foul.

It's in the back of the net! Peter Crouch (Stoke City) rises high inside the six-yard box to meet a cross by Lasse Sorensen from the free kick. He heads home into the middle of the goal, making the score 1:2.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) sends the resulting free kick a whisker wide of the left post!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Anthony Taylor starts the second half.

The referee blows his whistle after Martin Olsson (Swansea) does a good impression of a basketball player and handles the ball. Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Stoke!

Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the bottom left corner. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Lukasz Fabianski to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
Peter Crouch (Stoke City) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The substitution has been made. Tammy Abraham (Swansea) has replaced Martin Olsson.
Carlos Carvalhal decides to make a substitution. Andy King will be replaced by Leon Britton (Swansea).
Moritz Bauer (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. A free kick is awarded to Swansea.
A substitution has been made. Nathan Dyer is replaced by Sam Clucas (Swansea).
Andre Ayew (Swansea) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.

Sam Clucas (Swansea) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Jack Butland is alert and denies him with a nice save. The linesman makes the right call and Swansea will have a corner.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Lasse Sorensen will be replaced by Stephen Ireland (Stoke City).
A goal, which was scored by Badou Ndiaye (Stoke City), was disallowed due to offside.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
GOAL! Riyad Mahrez curls the free kick into the box. Jamie Vardy (Leicester) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Hugo Lloris and into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) goes on a mazy run, perfectly slipping past the opposition's defence. He aims well and places a precise effort behind the goalkeeper! Wonderful goal! Total football.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) picks up the rebound and shoots from distance. His incredible effort beats the goalkeeper and goes into the net. What a finish!
Lucas (Tottenham) was close to scoring after he unleashed a powerful shot which went a whisker wide of the right post.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Demarai Gray (Leicester) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the roof of the net, but Hugo Lloris pulls off a brilliant save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Leicester.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the top right corner.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Christian Fuchs (Leicester) scores an unfortunate own goal after deflecting the ball into his own net!
Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) picks up a caution.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Hamza Choudhury (Leicester) comes onto the pitch for Danny Simpson.

A superb goal from great team play! Erik Lamela (Tottenham) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Claude Puel decides to make a substitution. Demarai Gray will be replaced by Fousseni Diabate (Leicester).
Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Hugo Lloris makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner.
Great touch by Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Goal! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the roof of the net.
The substitution is prepared. Dele Alli (Tottenham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lucas.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) struck from medium range. He buried the ball inside the right post.
Mauricio Pochettino prepares a substitution. Erik Lamela is replaced by Davinson Sanchez (Tottenham).
Hamza Choudhury (Leicester) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Substitution. Moussa Sissoko will be replaced by Heung-Min Son (Tottenham).
It is time for a substitution. Harvey Barnes (Leicester) is on for Kelechi Iheanacho.
The yellow card is received by Adrien Silva (Leicester).
Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Mark Noble (West Ham) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom right corner. However, Jordan Pickford anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
Ramiro Mori (Everton) has tested the patience of referee Graham Scott and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
David William Moyes is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Arthur Masuaku suffers an injury and Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) comes on.
A defender mistimes his tackle on the edge on the box and let's in Joao Mario (West Ham). It's a decent effort but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
What a wasted opportunity by Oumar Niasse (Everton)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Adrian makes a decent save to thwart him.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Samuel Allardyce decided to make a change. Ramiro Mori is replaced by Davy Klaassen (Everton).
Here comes a substitution. Cenk Tosun is given a rest as he is replaced by Theo Walcott (Everton).
Goal! Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a shot from the edge of the box into the middle of the net, leaving Jordan Pickford beaten. The score is 2:0.
A goal, which was scored by Marko Arnautovic (West Ham), was disallowed due to offside.

Oumar Niasse (Everton) beats the defender inside the box and lashes a shot towards the roof of the net, but Adrian makes a brilliant reflex save to deny him. Goalkeeping at its best! The ball goes out of play. Everton are awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Oumar Niasse (Everton) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:1.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) makes himself some space on the edge of the penalty area and pulls the trigger. His accurate effort goes off the post into the top right corner and the score changes to 3:1.
A substitution has been made. Tom Davies is replaced by Yannick Bolasie (Everton).
Theo Walcott (Everton) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Oumar Niasse (Everton) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Adrian leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball goes out of play. Everton are awarded a corner kick.
The referee signals a substitution. Pedro Obiang (West Ham) is brought on as a substitute for Manuel Lanzini.
David William Moyes has decided to make a change. James Collins (West Ham) replaces Aaron Cresswell.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Scott McTominay (Manchester United) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and West Ham will have a goal kick.

Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) with a wonderful solo effort. He blasted from long range, but the shot towards the right side of the goal was thwarted by Adrian. The ball is out of play. Manchester Utd win a corner kick.
Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Luke Shaw (Manchester United) sends a rebound towards the bottom left corner, but Adrian reacts quickly and punches his promising attempt onto the post. Superb goalkeeping!
Joao Mario (West Ham) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
What a great touch by Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the centre of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
The game has come to an end for Arthur Masuaku. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Andrew Carroll (West Ham).
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) replacing Jesse Lingard.
The game has begun to heat up. Paul Pogba (Manchester United) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
It's a yellow card for Mark Noble (West Ham).
Substitution. Ashley Young (Manchester United) replaces Alexis Sanchez.
Jose Mourinho has decided to make a change. Eric Bailly (Manchester United) replaces Antonio Valencia.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Leroy Sane feeds the ball through to Danilo (Manchester City), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!
Goal! Davy Propper puts a cross into the box and finds Leonardo Ulloa (Brighton), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the roof of the net. He makes it 1:1.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) missed a big chance! He produces a stunning volley from inside the box, but his effort goes not far wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Brighton will have a goal kick.
What an amazing save by Mathew Ryan! Leroy Sane (Manchester City) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails.
Goal - 2:1! Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) receives a precise pass inside the box from Leroy Sane and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to Shane Duffy (Brighton) for his blatant foul.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Fernandinho (Manchester City) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the middle of the goal, but Mathew Ryan shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.

Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Claudio Bravo, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

The defence just can't clear the ball and a rebound eventually falls to Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) deep inside the box, but his well-hit shot flies just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Manchester City will have a goal kick.
What a goal! Leroy Sane plays it to Fernandinho (Manchester City), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Mathew Ryan into the bottom left corner. 3:1.
Chris Hughton prepares a substitution. Pascal Gross is replaced by Beram Kayal (Brighton).
Substitution. Jurgen Locadia (Brighton) has come on for Leonardo Ulloa.
Here's the change. Oleksandr Zinchenko leaves the pitch and Benjamin Mendy (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.
Chris Hughton has decided to make a change. Solomon March (Brighton) replaces Jose Izquierdo.
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the middle of the goal, but Mathew Ryan was alert and made an amazing save!
Brahim Diaz (Manchester City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Gabriel Jesus.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Lukas Nmecha (Manchester City) replacing Yaya Toure.
Danilo (Manchester City) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the crossbar!
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) tries to beat the goalkeeper from a set piece from some 17 metres out. He's very close, but his effort only bounces off the right post!
Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) meets a splendid cross on the edge of the 6-yard box and sends the ball towards the left post, forcing Hugo Lloris into a superb diving save to keep it out.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) is put clear inside the box by a lofted pass. He only has the keeper to beat, but Martin Dubravka comes out bravely to save at his feet. Great goalkeeping skills!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Heung-Min Son tees up Harry Kane (Tottenham) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the top right corner. 1:0.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Dele Alli (Tottenham).
The game has come to an end for Kenedy. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd).

Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms over the bar.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Joselu (Newcastle Utd) comes onto the pitch so that Dwight Gayle can be given a rest.
Mauricio Pochettino prepares a substitution. Heung-Min Son is replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
The foul by Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Neil Swarbrick.
Problems for Mauricio Pochettino as Kieran Trippier is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) replaces him.
Victor Wanyama is being substituted because of an injury. Mauricio Pochettino sends Danny Rose (Tottenham) on the pitch.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Erik Lamela (Tottenham) is given a yellow card.

Danny Rose (Tottenham) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Martin Dubravka to get hold of the ball.
DeAndre Yedlin (Newcastle Utd) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
The match has reached half-time.
Lee Mason blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) slots the ball inside the back of the net and alters the score!
The manager makes a subsitution with Alex Pritchard (Huddersfield) coming on for Rajiv van La Parra.
Antonio Conte decides to make a substitution. Davide Zappacosta will be replaced by Olivier Giroud (Chelsea).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Eden Hazard (Chelsea) for Pedro.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) smartly headed the ball past the goalkeeper.
David Wagner has decided to make a change. Florent Hadergjonaj (Huddersfield) replaces Chris Lowe.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.

A close-range header from Andreas Christensen (Chelsea) went to the left side of the goal. Jonas Lossl makes sure the score remains the same as he pulls off an exquisite save and deflects the ball onto the post.
It's time for a substitution. Scott Malone (Huddersfield) comes on in place of Tom Smith.
The booking goes to Jonas Lossl (Huddersfield).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Petr Cech makes a great save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal. Leicester force a corner. They send men into the box.
Goal! Fousseni Diabate shows great vision to find Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
The game is interrupted by the referee. He pulls out a red card and sends Konstantinos Mavropanos (Arsenal) off.
Substitution. Danny Welbeck makes his way off the pitch and Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) comes on as his replacement.

Eldin Jakupovic can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner. Arsenal force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) hammers a powerful first-time shot from close range, sending the ball towards the middle of the target, but the goalkeeper stops it with a miraculous save.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 1:1.
Substitution. Fousseni Diabate did his best and is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Graham Scott blows his whistle for a foul. Leicester have been awarded a penalty kick!
Rob Holding (Arsenal) is penalised.
Goal! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) directs his penalty into the top left corner and past Petr Cech.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Danny Simpson (Leicester) receives a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Danny Simpson as he is replaced by Aleksandar Dragovic (Leicester).
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Alex Iwobi is replaced by Edward Nketiah (Arsenal).
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Here's the change. Kelechi Iheanacho leaves the pitch and Harvey Barnes (Leicester) comes on as a substitute.
What an outstanding solo effort by Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.

Excellent touch by Charlie Austin (Southampton)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) runs onto a lofted ball into the box, but hits a weak shot towards the middle of the goal that is easily dealt with by Lukasz Fabianski.
Michael Oliver has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Jordan Ayew (Swansea) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the top right corner, but Alex McCarthy easily deals with the threat. Good work from Swansea as they win a corner.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Martin Olsson will be replaced by Tammy Abraham (Swansea).
Mark Hughes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Shane Long (Southampton) replacing Nathan Redmond.
Jan Bednarek is substituted due to injury. Mark Hughes gives a chance to Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton).

Charlie Austin (Southampton) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Lukasz Fabianski anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target.
The goalkeeper makes a superb save, but the ball rebounds off him out to Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton), who slots the ball into the bottom right corner.
Kyle Naughton goes off the pitch and Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) comes on.
Here is a change. Andy King is going off and Carlos Carvalhal gives the last tactical orders to Thomas Carroll (Swansea).
The manager makes a subsitution with Sam McQueen (Southampton) coming on for Dusan Tadic.
Shane Long (Southampton) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) gets a yellow card.
Michael Oliver is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Sean Dyche is forced to make a change. Ashley Barnes is unable to continue due to injury, Sam Vokes (Burnley) comes on.
The referee shows the yellow card to James Tarkowski (Burnley).
Goal! Hector Bellerin puts a cross into the box and finds Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Nice touch by Sam Vokes (Burnley) as he latched on to an accurate cross and attempted to direct the ball with a fine header towards the net, but the goalkeeper reacted quickly to keep it out.
Brilliant finish! Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Jack Wilshere, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 3:0.
CLOSE! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the left post!
Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes into the roof of the net and past the goalkeeper.
Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Aaron Lennon as he is replaced by Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Burnley).
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Jack Wilshere will be replaced by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal).
Alexandre Lacazette will be replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect strike that goes inside the left post.
Arsene Wenger has decided to substitute Calum Chambers and he is replaced by Per Mertesacker (Arsenal).
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) controls a nice low pass and shoots from just outside the box, but it's a poor effort that flies into the stands. Wasted opportunity!
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) cracks a splendid volley from just outside the box that brushes the left post. It was an incredible shot and the goalkeeper was really lucky not to concede a goal.
Substitution. Johann Gudmundsson did his best and is replaced by Nahki Wells (Burnley).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) receives a precise pass inside the box and drills a promising first-time blast towards the middle of the goal. His effort is blocked by Thibaut Courtois who dives to keep the ball out. What a save!

Thibaut Courtois receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Sadio Mane (Liverpool), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the left side of the goal. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Liverpool will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

It's a goal! Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Victor Moses and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Loris Karius was helpless.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) was quite harsh and Anthony Taylor didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. A free kick to Chelsea.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Substitution. Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Nathaniel Clyne walks off.
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. Andrew Robertson will be replaced by Dominic Solanke (Liverpool).
This is a yellow card! Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) watches the ball all the way and fires a first-time shot goalwards from inside the box, but the effort flies just wide of the right post.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Antonio Conte has decided to make a change. Willian (Chelsea) replaces Eden Hazard.
Substitution. James Milner will be replaced by Alberto Moreno (Liverpool).
Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) replacing Victor Moses.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Cesc Fabregas as he is replaced by Pedro (Chelsea).
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Dominic Solanke (Liverpool), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Florent Hadergjonaj (Huddersfield) clutches his head in despair after blowing a huge opportunity! He receives the ball after the free kick and takes good first touch to unleash a low shot from close range, but Ederson makes a nice save.
That was close by Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.

Alex Pritchard (Huddersfield) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the left side of the goal, but Ederson is equal to it and makes an easy save. The ball is out of play. Huddersfield win a corner kick.
Chris Lowe (Huddersfield) finds space inside the box to shoot after collecting a short pass, but it's a wasted effort as it flies well wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Benjamin Mendy (Manchester City) in, Fabian Delph out.
David Wagner prepares a substitution. Steve Mounie is replaced by Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield).
The booking goes to Tom Smith (Huddersfield).
Substitution. Kevin De Bruyne will be replaced by Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) replaces John Stones.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Chris Lowe (Huddersfield).
Today's match ends for Chris Lowe who will be replaced by Scott Malone (Huddersfield).
David Wagner has decided to substitute Alex Pritchard and he is replaced by Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield).
Benjamin Mendy (Manchester City) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.
Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and smashes a glorious looking effort towards the top right corner, but Jordan Pickford thwarts him with a great two-handed save.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card. Charlie Austin (Southampton) is penalised for holding. Jonathan Moss signals a set piece.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Samuel Allardyce has made a change at the break. Ramiro Mori (Everton) has come on in place of Yannick Bolasie.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Mario Lemina is replaced by Nathan Redmond (Southampton).
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Nathan Redmond (Southampton) jumps for a cross and plants a crashing header low into the middle of the net. Even though the goalkeeper was standing near, he couldn't make a save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nikola Vlasic leaves the pitch and Oumar Niasse (Everton) comes on.
We are about to witness a subsitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) for Dusan Tadic.
Maya Yoshida (Southampton) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
The manager makes a subsitution with Shane Long (Southampton) coming on for Charlie Austin.
Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
The substitution is prepared. Davy Klaassen (Everton) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Phil Jagielka.
Maya Yoshida (Southampton) is awarded a second yellow by Jonathan Moss and subsequently dismisses him with a red one.
Jordan Pickford pulls off a great save to deny Nathan Redmond (Southampton), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Wesley Hoedt (Southampton) receives a yellow card!

Leighton Baines (Everton) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top right corner only for Alex McCarthy to dive and make a save. Everton have been awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Idrissa Gueye passes the ball to Tom Davies (Everton) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Alex McCarthy couldn't do anything about it. 1:1.
Tom Davies (Everton) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Shane Long (Southampton) gets a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Nathan Dyer (Swansea) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the middle of the goal, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Asmir Begovic. What a save!
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) doesn't hesitate to shoot inside the box after a neat pass from Ryan Fraser. It's a good effort but just misses the left post.
Martin Olsson (Swansea) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Kevin Friend's book.
Goal! Andrew Surman sets up Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) for a shot on the edge of the box. He doesn't hit the cleanest of shots, but the ball somehow finds its way into the right side of the goal. 1:0.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.

Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) latched on to an accurate pass just outside the box and immediately lashed the ball towards the top left corner. His effort was thwarted by Lukasz Fabianski, who pulled off a stunning save. The referee points to the corner flag and Bournemouth will take a corner.
Mike van der Hoorn (Swansea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Kevin Friend ignores the protests.
Substitution. Tammy Abraham (Swansea) on for Nathan Dyer.
Thomas Carroll (Swansea) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Asmir Begovic scrambling, but it flies just over the bar.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Alfie Mawson (Swansea) is given a yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Andy King (Swansea) is ready to enter the pitch as Mike van der Hoorn walks off.
Here comes a substitution. Sung-Yong Ki is given a rest as he is replaced by Luciano Narsingh (Swansea).
Eddie Howe prepares a substitution. Marc Pugh is replaced by Dan Gosling (Bournemouth).
Andy King (Swansea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Kevin Friend didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a great save to deny Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal. Bournemouth get a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Joshua King walks off the pitch to be replaced by Lys Mousset (Bournemouth).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tyrone Mings (Bournemouth) is coming onto the pitch as Callum Wilson cannot continue after picking up an injury.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Ben Hamer pulls off a great save to deny Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) is angry with himself. The ball breaks to him but he hits the crossbar!
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Marko Arnautovic finds Joao Mario (West Ham) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Chris Kavanagh had an easy-decision to make.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Claude Puel makes a switch. Aleksandar Dragovic (Leicester) is coming on in place of Iborra at the start of the second period.
The referee gives a yellow card to Aaron Cresswell (West Ham).
A substitution has been made. Hamza Choudhury is replaced by Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester).
Claude Puel prepares a substitution. Fousseni Diabate is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).

Harry Maguire (Leicester) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Adrian scrambling, but it flies just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and West Ham will have a goal kick.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Aleksandar Dragovic (Leicester) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Mark Noble (West Ham) fires in a first-time projectile from about 25 metres. Ben Hamer stretches but the ball is out of his reach and ends up inside the bottom left corner.
The substitution is prepared. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Manuel Lanzini.
Marko Arnautovic just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) replaces him.
Adrian stretches to his right and makes a brilliant save! Adrien Silva (Leicester) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Patrice Evra (West Ham) on for Arthur Masuaku.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Goal! Roberto Pereyra (Watford) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Abdoulaye Doucoure, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Lovely run from Andre Gray (Watford). He finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, lines up a shot, but the keeper boldly launches himself to intercept the ball.
Martin Dubravka pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Troy Deeney (Watford) fired on target from the rebound. His effort from inside the box was directed low to the middle of the goal.

A neat pass is well received by Andre Gray (Watford), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Goal! Roberto Pereyra puts the ball on the head of Andre Gray (Watford), who has the easy task to score into an empty net. 2:0.
Roger East blows his whistle after Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Watford.

Troy Deeney (Watford) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot into the bottom left corner. Martin Dubravka anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.

Troy Deeney (Watford) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Martin Dubravka pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going low into the middle of the target.
Roger East shows a yellow card to Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) for a tough tackle.
Roger East has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
A substitution has been made. Jacob Murphy goes off and Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
Goal! Javier Manquillo puts a cross into the box and finds Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:1.
Javier Gracia Carlos has decided to make a change. Gerard Deulofeu (Watford) replaces Roberto Pereyra.
Roger East shows the yellow card to Christian Kabasele (Watford) for a heavy challenge.
That will be all from Troy Deeney who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Adrian Mariappa (Watford).
Rafael Benitez prepares a substitution. Javier Manquillo is replaced by DeAndre Yedlin (Newcastle Utd).
Jose Holebas (Watford) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The corner kick falls to Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd), who does his best to finish. The snap shot, however, only marks the left post!
Substitution. Andre Gray leaves the pitch and is replaced by Richarlison (Watford).
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd) replacing Mohamed Diame.

This shall not pass! Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender. Newcastle will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went straight towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save. The ball goes out of play and Tottenham have been awarded a corner kick.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Ben Foster inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the middle of the target, but was denied by a great save. The referee signals a corner kick to Tottenham.

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender. West Brom will take a corner kick.
Mike Jones has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Ahmed Hegazy (West Brom) receives a yellow card. Tottenham will look to take advantage of a free kick in a promising position in the middle of the field.
Allan Nyom (West Brom) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Danny Rose (Tottenham) is the one who receives a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) comes on in place of Dele Alli.
Darren Moore has decided to substitute Jose Rondon and he is replaced by Daniel Sturridge (West Brom).
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to make a change. Lucas (Tottenham) replaces Erik Lamela.
James McClean (West Brom) is punished with the yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Nacer Chadli (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Jay Rodriguez.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) earns the yellow card.
Mauricio Pochettino decides to make a substitution. Jan Vertonghen will be replaced by Fernando Llorente (Tottenham).
A substitution has been made. James McClean goes off and Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) comes on.
The ball from the corner slips through the box to Jake Livermore (West Brom) and he produces a low drive into the middle of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Roy Hodgson is forced to make a change. Joel Ward is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace).
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Moritz Bauer (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Martin Atkinson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Here is a change. Yohan Cabaye is going off and Roy Hodgson gives the last tactical orders to Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace).
Glen Johnson (Stoke City) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The referee signals a substitution. Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Peter Crouch.

Goal! Ruben Loftus-Cheek displays great vision and sends a pass to James McArthur (Crystal Palace), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:1.
Substitution. Glen Johnson makes his way off the pitch and Tyrese Campbell (Stoke City) comes on as his replacement.

Jack Butland doesn't have to worry about this one. Andros Townsend plays a pass into the feet of Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
Papa Ndiaye (Stoke City) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Erik Pieters (Stoke City) for his blatant foul.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 1:2.
Substitution. Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Andros Townsend walks off.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
A goal, which was scored by Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United), was disallowed due to offside.

Glenn Murray (Brighton) receives an accurate pass and finds some space for a shot. The keeper is prepared and denies his long-range effort towards the left post. Brilliant save! The ball goes out for a corner. Brighton can continue in their attacking effort.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by Glenn Murray (Brighton). Craig Pawson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Paul Pogba (Manchester United) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Mathew Ryan pulls off a brilliant save.
Pascal Gross (Brighton) leaps to meet an excellent cross and steers a fantastic header past the goalkeeper, inside the right post.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Pascal Gross (Brighton) for a tough tackle. Manchester Utd are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
The substitution is prepared. Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marouane Fellaini.
Jose Mourinho decides to make a substitution. Matteo Darmian will be replaced by Luke Shaw (Manchester United).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcos Rojo trots off the pitch and is replaced by Scott McTominay (Manchester United).
Chris Hughton has decided to make a change. Beram Kayal (Brighton) replaces Pascal Gross.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Solomon March (Brighton) comes onto the pitch for Jose Izquierdo.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leonardo Ulloa (Brighton) will replace Glenn Murray.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Orestis Karnezis makes a huge mistake and Dele Alli (Tottenham) has an easy task to put the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Hugo Lloris pulls off a great save to deny Andre Gray (Watford) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Richarlison (Watford) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Hugo Lloris guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Neat link-up play between Will Hughes (Watford) and Abdoulaye Doucoure, but Hugo Lloris reads the game well and the move breaks down.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Kieran Trippier puts the ball on a plate for Harry Kane (Tottenham), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 2:0.
Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch after Mousa Dembele signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Javier Gracia Carlos has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gerard Deulofeu (Watford) replacing Kiko.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Troy Deeney (Watford) is coming onto the pitch as Andre Gray cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) shows good timing as he latches on to a perfect lofted pass into the box. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and glances off the right-hand post.
Richarlison (Watford) darts into the box and immediately fires a first-time effort. He produces a poor shot which goes well over the crossbar.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Gerard Deulofeu (Watford) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Harry Kane (Tottenham) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The substitution has been made. Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) has replaced Heung-Min Son.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dele Alli leaves the pitch and Erik Lamela (Tottenham) comes on.
Javier Gracia Carlos decides to make a substitution. Will Hughes will be replaced by Andre Carrillo (Watford).
Chance! Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Harry Kane, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.
Andre Carrillo (Watford) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.
Andre Carrillo (Watford) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to place a shot inside the right post, but Hugo Lloris makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) beautifully controls a cross from the wing inside the box, but he fails to test the keeper and sends his shot miles past the left post.

Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) makes a nice run to meet a lofted pass from the side and steers it goalwards from the edge of the penalty area. One of the defenders does a great job to keep the score the same by deflecting the ball onto the post.
Goal! Paul Pogba (Manchester United) slots the ball into an unguarded net from close range after a shot rebounds off a defender. 1:0.

What a chance that is! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Granit Xhaka (Arsenal). Kevin Friend doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Manchester Utd are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
David de Gea makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) after a cross from the side.
Ashley Young (Manchester United) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Romelu Lukaku has picked up an injury and is replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
A substitution has been made. Reiss Nelson goes off and Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) comes on.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Ander Herrera is replaced by Anthony Martial (Manchester United).
The game has come to an end for Jesse Lingard. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Sead Kolasinac limps off the pitch to be replaced by Nacho Monreal (Arsenal).
Here comes a substitution. Joseph Willock (Arsenal) is brought on as a substitute for Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header only flies onto the right post and away off it!
A goal, which was scored by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United), was disallowed due to offside.
Goal! Ashley Young gets to the by-line and sends in a lofted ball. Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) climbs highest and powers a close-range header inside the right post. 2:1.
Kevin Friend is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
It's in the back of the net! Leroy Sane (Manchester City) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Adrian. He makes it 0:1.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) latches on to a pass inside the box and strikes the ball to the middle of the goal, but one of the defending players makes a goal-line clearance.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. A slightly disorientated Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) puts the ball into his own net.

Leroy Sane (Manchester City) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Adrian. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Manchester City.
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) is punished with the yellow card.
Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) shoots from the free kick just outside the box and curls the ball inside the right post. What a brilliant goal that is!
Great save! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the right side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Adrian.
The match has reached half-time.
Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Goal! Raheem Sterling shows great vision to find Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom right corner. 1:3.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Danilo (Manchester City) coming on for Kyle Walker.
Goal - 1:4! Raheem Sterling laid the ball off to Fernandinho (Manchester City), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
David William Moyes has decided to make a change. Joao Mario (West Ham) replaces Edimilson Fernandes.
The referee signals a substitution. Chicharito (West Ham) is brought on as a substitute for Manuel Lanzini.
Substitution. Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) in, Patrice Evra out.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Yaya Toure (Manchester City) replacing Ilkay Gundogan.
Substitution. Lukas Nmecha (Manchester City) replaces Gabriel Jesus.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Eden Hazard finds Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball into the top left corner. 0:1.
The yellow card goes to Andre Ayew (Swansea).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Victor Moses (Chelsea) is given a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Andy King goes off the pitch and Nathan Dyer (Swansea) comes on.
Carlos Carvalhal decides to make a substitution. Connor Roberts will be replaced by Thomas Carroll (Swansea).
Victor Moses (Chelsea) latches onto a rebound in the box and fires a shot a whisker wide of the right post. That was a promising chance and maybe he should have done better!
What a chance that is! Andre Ayew (Swansea) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eden Hazard departs the field of play to be replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Pedro (Chelsea) replacing Cesc Fabregas.
Substitution. Martin Olsson walks off the pitch and Wayne Routledge (Swansea) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Olivier Giroud is replaced by Alvaro Morata (Chelsea).
Thomas Carroll (Swansea) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jack Cork (Burnley) gets on the end of a good cross and shoots, but his attempt is inadvertently blocked by one of his own teammates.
Kevin Long (Burnley) misses a great chance. He gets to the rebound inside the box and sees his shot smash against the left post!
Dale Stephens (Brighton) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for Mathew Ryan to dive and make a save. Good work from Burnley as they win a corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Sean Dyche is forced to make a change. Chris Wood is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Sam Vokes (Burnley).
The substitution has been made. Glenn Murray (Brighton) has replaced Leonardo Ulloa.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Glenn Murray (Brighton).
Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Burnley) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Aaron Lennon.
That will be all from Ashley Westwood who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jeff Hendrick (Burnley).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jose Izquierdo will be replaced by Solomon March (Brighton).
Problems for Chris Hughton as Bruno Saltor is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Ezequiel Schelotto (Brighton) replaces him.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) latches on to a pass inside the box and strikes the ball to the middle of the goal, but one of the defending players makes a goal-line clearance.
Goal! James McArthur tees up Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the top right corner. 1:0.

Well-positioned Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Ben Hamer reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop! The ball is out of play and Crystal Palace manage to earn a corner.
Wilfried Zaha feeds the ball through to James McArthur (Crystal Palace), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 2:0!
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Michael Dean starts the second half.
Substitution. Kelechi Iheanacho walks off the pitch and Fousseni Diabate (Leicester) comes on as a substitute.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Claude Puel gives a chance to Adrien Silva (Leicester) and Hamza Choudhury is off.
Here comes a substitution. Aleksandar Dragovic (Leicester) is brought on as a substitute for Wilfred Ndidi.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace).
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) is told to leave the pitch after the referee stops play and shows him a red card! His manager doesn't look happy.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Adrien Silva (Leicester) is given a yellow card.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace). Mamadou Sakho plays a fantastic through ball and finds Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 3:0.
James McArthur will be replaced by Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace).
Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) picks up a rebound, prepares for a shot and sends the ball home.
Here is a change. Ruben Loftus-Cheek is going off and Roy Hodgson gives the last tactical orders to Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace).
The referee signals a substitution. Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) is brought on as a substitute for Andros Townsend.
Harry Maguire (Leicester) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Michael Dean signals. PENALTY! Wonderful opportunity to score for Crystal Palace.
Goal! Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Ben Hamer into middle of the goal.
That's it for today, Michael Dean has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Cenk Tosun (Everton) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom left corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
The whistle blows and Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) is booked for an infringement.
Substitution. Collin Quaner makes way for Philip Billing (Huddersfield).
David Wagner has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Scott Malone (Huddersfield) replacing Jonathan Hogg.
Substitution. Tom Davies (Everton) replaces Wayne Rooney.
Today's match ends for Cenk Tosun who will be replaced by Oumar Niasse (Everton).
David Wagner has decided to make a change. Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) replaces Rajiv van La Parra.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to substitute Nikola Vlasic and he is replaced by Ramiro Mori (Everton).
Goal! Great play by Leighton Baines releases Idrissa Gueye (Everton) in space on the edge of the box. He spots the keeper off his line and coolly puts the ball into bottom right corner. 0:2.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! Matt Phillips (West Brom) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Jake Livermore inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
Kenedy (Newcastle Utd) storms into the box to get on the end of a pass, but smashes his shot straight onto the right post. Unlucky!
David Coote shows a yellow card to Jake Livermore (West Brom) for his blatant foul.
Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) blows an opportunity from close range as he heads a rebound onto to the crossbar!
Allan Nyom (West Brom) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and David Coote starts the second half.
Substitution. Paul Dummett makes way for Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd).
Rafael Benitez has decided to make a change. Islam Slimani (Newcastle Utd) replaces Dwight Gayle.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) was quite harsh and David Coote didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
