Substitution. Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) in, Jay Rodriguez out.
Rafael Benitez has decided to substitute Ayoze Perez and he is replaced by Joselu (Newcastle Utd).
James McClean (West Brom) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Joselu (Newcastle Utd) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes narrowly wide of the left post! What a huge opportunity!
Here comes a substitution. James McClean is given a rest as he is replaced by Jonny Evans (West Brom).
Jose Rondon comes off the pitch to be replaced by Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Today's referee Anthony Taylor rightly decides to book Lewis Cook (Bournemouth) for his harsh tackle.
Goal - 1:0! Mario Lemina tees up Dusan Tadic (Southampton) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Asmir Begovic.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and drills a good shot to the middle of the goal. Asmir Begovic shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop the effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
A pass into the box finds Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom left corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Alex McCarthy denies him.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Joshua King (Bournemouth) and he blasts it inside the right post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Anthony Taylor has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) is yellow-carded.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jan Bednarek (Southampton). Anthony Taylor doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Goal! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Asmir Begovic had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:1.
Mark Hughes decides to make a substitution. Nathan Redmond will be replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) comes onto the pitch for Callum Wilson.
A substitution has been made. Lys Mousset is replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).

Charlie Austin (Southampton) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Asmir Begovic made a crucial save!
That's the end of the game for Charlie Austin, who is replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton).
Eddie Howe has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) replacing Dan Gosling.
It is time for a substitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is on for Dusan Tadic.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is cautioned by the referee.
The game is interrupted. Alex McCarthy (Southampton) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.

A pass travels right across the box to Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper in the bottom right corner, but Alex McCarthy denies him with a decent save.
The booking goes to Cedric Soares (Southampton).
Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the top right corner, but the effort is smothered by the keeper. Bournemouth get a corner.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Anthony Taylor ignores the protests.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) plants his close-range header just wide of the left post after a cross into the box.

Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Jack Butland to get hold of the ball.
The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Mohamed Salah (Liverpool), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Peter Crouch (Stoke City) was quite harsh and Andre Marriner didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Danny Ings (Liverpool) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Mame Diouf (Stoke City) for his blatant foul.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Problems for Paul Lambert as Bruno Martins Indi is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) replaces him.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Trent Alexander-Arnold is replaced by James Milner (Liverpool).
It is time for a substitution. Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) is on for Danny Ings.
That's the end of the game for Peter Crouch, who is replaced by Darren Fletcher (Stoke City).
Virgil van Dijk (Liverpool) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
That's it for today, Andre Marriner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Phil Jagielka (Everton) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Robert Madley starts the second half.

What a huge chance for Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.

Yannick Bolasie sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Theo Walcott (Everton) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the top of the net. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.
Problems for Samuel Allardyce as Morgan Schneiderlin is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Tom Davies (Everton) replaces him.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) replaces Yannick Bolasie.
Islam Slimani will be replaced by Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd).

Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his strike flies just a few inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.
Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the roof of the net, but Jordan Pickford is prepared and leaps to thwart him.
Michael Keane (Everton) has tested the patience of referee Robert Madley and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) fails to convert a close-range free kick as he sends the ball narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Matt Ritchie makes way for Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd).
A substitution has been made. Jonjo Shelvey is replaced by Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Oumar Niasse (Everton) comes onto the pitch for Cenk Tosun.
Idrissa Gueye (Everton) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Kenedy (Newcastle Utd) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Goal! David Silva (Manchester City) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 5:0.
It's a goal! Fabian Delph plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Raheem Sterling (Manchester City). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the bottom left corner. Lukasz Fabianski is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save.
Martin Olsson (Swansea) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the top left corner of the net.
What a miss! The corner finds Alfie Mawson (Swansea) unmarked in the box with the goal at his mercy, but somehow he mistimes his header and sends it just over the bar.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) fails to score from the penalty. He aimed his shot towards the bottom left corner, but it was too weak to go past Lukasz Fabianski who made a reflex save and deflected the ball onto the post.
Goal! The rebound fell to Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) and he fired home from close range. The score is 4:0.
That's the end of the game for Sung-Yong Ki, who is replaced by Sam Clucas (Swansea).
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Yaya Toure (Manchester City) replaces Kevin De Bruyne.
Carlos Carvalhal is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Federico Fernandez suffers an injury and Kyle Bartley (Swansea) comes on.
Substitution. Raheem Sterling walks off the pitch and Phil Foden (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Aymeric Laporte (Manchester City) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the right post!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Benjamin Mendy (Manchester City) comes onto the pitch so that Fabian Delph can be given a rest.
A substitution has been made. Martin Olsson is replaced by Tammy Abraham (Swansea).
Danilo (Manchester City) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Lukasz Fabianski, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Goal! Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Yaya Toure and easily beat the keeper with a header into the top left corner from close range. 5:0.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) finds space in the box and tries a looping header at goal from the corner, but the ball goes just wide of the left post. Unlucky!
CHANCE! Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
What a chance that is! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Hector Bellerin smashes in a cross, but Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) finds it almost impossible to control and sends his header high over the bar from close in.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Arsene Wenger is forced to make a change. Mohamed Elneny is unable to continue due to injury, Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal) comes on.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Lee Mason starts the second half.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham).

The ball hits the back of the net! Granit Xhaka delivers the corner, Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) finds himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes an unstoppable shot which goes into the bottom left corner and past the helpless goalkeeper. 1:0.
Edimilson Fernandes will be replaced by Manuel Lanzini (West Ham).
David William Moyes decides to make a substitution. Joao Mario will be replaced by Chicharito (West Ham).
Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal) picks up a yellow card.
Goal - 1:1! Manuel Lanzini laid the ball off to Marko Arnautovic (West Ham), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The game has come to an end for Alex Iwobi. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal).

Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Joe Hart was alert and the score remained the same. Now Arsenal have a corner.
Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the right side of the goal, but Joe Hart is equal to it and makes an easy save. Arsenal have a corner.

Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes inside the right post. He makes it 2:1 with this magnificent strike.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang plays it to Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Joe Hart. 3:1.
It is time for a substitution. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is on for Arthur Masuaku.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Marko Arnautovic (West Ham).

Chris Hughton has decided to substitute Pascal Gross and he is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Brighton).
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Substitution. Ruben Loftus-Cheek will be replaced by Jairo Riedewald (Crystal Palace).

Wayne Hennessey makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Dale Stephens (Brighton) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of inside the left post. Corner kick. Brighton will have an opportunity.
Gaetan Bong will be replaced by Solomon March (Brighton).
Wayne Hennessey (Crystal Palace) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Biram Kayal (Brighton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Daryl Janmaat (Watford) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Booking. Roberto Pereyra (Watford) receives a caution from the referee.
Mathias Jorgensen (Huddersfield) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
The end of the first half.
Referee Craig Pawson blows his whistle to start the second half.
The game has come to an end for Kiko. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Richarlison (Watford).
David Wagner has decided to make a change. Tom Ince (Huddersfield) replaces Collin Quaner.
Steve Mounie will be replaced by Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield).
The yellow card is received by Alex Pritchard (Huddersfield).
The referee signals a substitution. Philip Billing (Huddersfield) is brought on as a substitute for Rajiv van La Parra.
Here is a change. Troy Deeney is going off and Javier Gracia Carlos gives the last tactical orders to Andre Gray (Watford).
Here comes a substitution. Will Hughes is given a rest as he is replaced by Jerome Sinclair (Watford).
It's in! Tom Ince (Huddersfield) changes the scoreline.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) gathers a nice lofted pass deep inside the box and attempts to put the ball inside the right post, but his shot is deflected away by one of the defending players.

Federico Fernandez (Swansea) rose high to meet a perfectly taken corner kick and attempted to steer a fine header from inside the box towards the right side of the goal. Nobody knows what would have happened if one of the defending players hadn’t pulled off a brilliant intervention to block the effort.
Thomas Carroll (Swansea) latches onto a rebound in the box and fires a shot just over the bar. That was a promising chance and maybe he should have done better!
What a sweet touch by Andre Ayew (Swansea) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Jordan Pickford to hold.
Michael Keane (Everton) wastes a golden opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. He pounced on a rebound but headed the ball just wide of the right post.
Kyle Naughton (Swansea) attempts to head the ball away after a cross into the penalty area, but instead he accidentally sends it inside the left post of his own goal. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Lee Mason has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
We are about to witness a substitution. Nathan Dyer (Swansea) is replacing Luciano Narsingh.

Thomas Carroll (Swansea) was quickest to pounce on the rebound inside the box after a misunderstanding by the defending players. He heads it precisely to the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper is alert and pulls off a great save.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) has tested the patience of referee Lee Mason and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Sung-Yong Ki will be replaced by Tammy Abraham (Swansea).
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Beni Baningime (Everton) replaces Idrissa Gueye.
Nathan Dyer (Swansea) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
OFF THE BAR! Seamus Coleman (Everton) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball crashes against the crossbar.
The game has come to an end for Yannick Bolasie. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Ramiro Mori (Everton).
Wayne Rooney (Everton) takes the free kick and unleashes a strong shot from mid-range. Unfortunately for him, the ball curls inches over the crossbar. What a squandered chance!
Here comes a substitution. Nikola Vlasic (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Wayne Rooney.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Beni Baningime (Everton) for his blatant foul.
Lee Mason is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Ryan Bertrand, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.

Shane Long (Southampton) skips past challenges and takes a shot to the top left corner, but Thibaut Courtois makes a brilliant save to thwart him. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Southampton.
Willian (Chelsea) was in a good shooting position just outside the box and unleashed a first-time shot towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper made a decent save to thwart his effort.
James Ward-Prowse floats a lovely ball in from the free kick to Jan Bednarek (Southampton), and he slots the ball inside the right post to increase the score to 2:0.
Here is a change. Alvaro Morata is going off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical orders to Olivier Giroud (Chelsea).
It's time for a substitution. Pedro (Chelsea) comes on in place of Davide Zappacosta.
This is a yellow card! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

It's in the back of the net! Marcos Alonso sends a superb cross into the box. Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the left post, leaving Alex McCarthy beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:1.
Goal! Willian plays a pass to the feet of Eden Hazard (Chelsea), and he shoots into the roof of the net from inside the box. It's 2:2.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle. Chelsea get a free kick.
Goal! Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:3.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Charlie Austin (Southampton) comes onto the pitch so that James Ward-Prowse can be given a rest.
Shane Long (Southampton) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Willian (Chelsea) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Joshua Sims (Southampton) is brought on as a substitute for Dusan Tadic.
Antonio Conte decides to make a substitution. Eden Hazard will be replaced by Victor Moses (Chelsea).

Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but his fine header towards the underside of the crossbar is perfectly saved by the goalkeeper.
Great save! Joshua Sims (Southampton) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the left side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Thibaut Courtois.
Substitution. Jan Bednarek did his best and is replaced by Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton).
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Gary Cahill (Chelsea) for his blatant foul.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
A lofted pass picks out Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) in space in the box, he beats the keeper with a low drive but it's blocked on the line by a defender. West Ham get a corner.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.

Great save! Willian (Chelsea) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the right side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Joe Hart. The ball is out of play. Chelsea will have a chance to score from a corner.
Goal! Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Mark Noble (West Ham) gets a yellow card.
What a huge chance for Willian (Chelsea). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The corner is swung into the six-yard box and Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) gets his head on the ball, but he is unable to keep it down and it goes miles over the bar.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
David William Moyes is forced to make a change. Aaron Cresswell is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Patrice Evra (West Ham).
Fine attempt! Victor Moses (Chelsea) collects a pass and manages to hold off the defender, then rifles in a shot from mid-range which unluckily swerves inches past the left post.
That will be all from Edimilson Fernandes who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Chicharito (West Ham).
Goal Chicharito (West Ham)! Chicharito (West Ham) was put through by Marko Arnautovic and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the right side of the net. 1:1.
Substitution. Victor Moses makes way for Pedro (Chelsea).
Antonio Conte has decided to make a change. Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) replaces Alvaro Morata.

A sweet pass finds Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the roof of the net. Joe Hart is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. Chelsea will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Josh Cullen (West Ham) for Joao Mario.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away.

What a save from Joe Hart! Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. Chelsea force a corner. They send men into the box.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) latches on to a pass inside the box, but his low effort towards the right post is well blocked.

What a chance! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance. Southampton have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Goal! Cedric Soares displays great vision and sends a pass to Shane Long (Southampton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Goal! Danny Welbeck puts the ball on a plate for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:1.
Goal! Alex Iwobi passes the ball to Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Alex McCarthy couldn't do anything about it. 2:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Alex McCarthy, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Arsenal win a corner.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) is given a yellow card.

Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the left side of the goal. Alex McCarthy is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. The ball goes out of play. Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.

What a save from Petr Cech! Shane Long (Southampton) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. The ball goes out for a corner. Southampton can continue in their attacking effort.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Shane Long (Southampton) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Reiss Nelson walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) replacing Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maya Yoshida trots off the pitch and is replaced by Charlie Austin (Southampton).
Goal! Cedric Soares puts the ball across the area and Charlie Austin (Southampton) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:2.
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Hector Bellerin is replaced by Rob Holding (Arsenal).
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box.
Shane Long comes off the pitch to be replaced by Joshua Sims (Southampton).

It's a goal! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) makes it 3:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Alex Iwobi and planted his close-range header into the bottom left corner. Alex McCarthy was helpless.

Dusan Tadic (Southampton) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed towards the top of the net, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt. The ball goes behind for a corner. Southampton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).
Jack Stephens (Southampton) is awarded a red card due to his behaviour.
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) is sent off with a straight red card. He can't believe his eyes, but the referee's call is final.
Wesley Hoedt (Southampton) has tested the patience of referee Andre Marriner and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Andre Marriner is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
A pass into the box finds Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) unmarked. He carefully places a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by David de Gea denies him.

Goal! Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) jumps highest inside the box to meet the resulting corner from Leroy Sane. His well-placed header ends up in the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. 1:0.
Goal - 2:0! Raheem Sterling tees up Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past David de Gea.
CHANCE! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.
CHANCE! David Silva finds Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just over the bar!
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Ander Herrera (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.
Martin Atkinson shows the yellow card to Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) for a heavy challenge.
Martin Atkinson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Post! Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Goal! Ander Herrera shows great vision to find Paul Pogba (Manchester United) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the right side of the goal. 2:1.

Goal! Alexis Sanchez clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Paul Pogba (Manchester United), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the bottom left corner. Ederson had no chance of stopping that. 2:2.
The foul by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson.
Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just over the crossbar. It could have been a fantastic goal!
Alexis Sanchez floats a lovely ball in from the free kick to Chris Smalling (Manchester United), and he strikes the ball into the middle of the net to increase the score to 2:3.
The referee signals a substitution. Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for David Silva.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) replacing Bernardo Silva.
Here is a change. Ilkay Gundogan is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Fernandinho (Manchester City) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Yellow card. Paul Pogba (Manchester United) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
The substitution has been made. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) has replaced Alexis Sanchez.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Jesse Lingard is replaced by Scott McTominay (Manchester United).

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the top of the net, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Manchester City.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) fires a rebound from close range only onto the right post.
Danilo (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make.
Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Atkinson ignores the protests.
Jose Mourinho decides to make a substitution. Ander Herrera will be replaced by Victor Lindelof (Manchester United).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds James McArthur (Crystal Palace) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Bournemouth.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) converts the free kick from about 23 metres out with a perfectly bent shot that ends up inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. What a shot!

Chance! Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the right side of the goal, but Wayne Hennessey is alert and makes a great save to deny him. Bournemouth will take a corner kick.

Lewis Cook (Bournemouth) accelerated away from the defence and took his shot early from the edge of the box. The ball flew towards the bottom right corner, but Wayne Hennessey made a superb athletic save to deny him. Bournemouth earn a corner.

Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom right corner. However, Asmir Begovic anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) tricks his way to edge of the area and unleashes a howitzer of a shot towards the inside the right post, but Asmir Begovic earns his money with a fine reflex save.
Here is a change. Marc Pugh is going off and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders to Lys Mousset (Bournemouth).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Joshua King (Bournemouth) replaces Callum Wilson.

Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the right post. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:1.
GOAL 1:2! Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) brilliantly slaloms his way forward past a few defenders and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which is deflected and goes into the back of the net.
Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Lewis Cook. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Andrew Surman (Bournemouth).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Simon Francis (Bournemouth) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Goal! Joshua King (Bournemouth) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Steve Cook, then sends the ball inside the right post. 2:2.
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) violates the laws of the game and is shown a yellow card by the referee, but it could have been a straight red as well.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
What a big chance! Davy Propper (Brighton) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Jonas Lossl pulls off a comfortable save.
Jonas Lossl (Huddersfield) scores an own goal! No one would like to be in his position right now.
Goal! The ball breaks to Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) after some poor defending, he finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and calmly puts the ball into the back of the net! He makes it 1:1.

Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick low strike towards the middle of the goal that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a superb goal-line clearance.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Lewis Dunk (Brighton) latches onto the free kick from Solomon March, but heads just wide of the left post from close range.
Today's referee Anthony Taylor rightly decides to book Shane Duffy (Brighton) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Glenn Murray leaves the pitch and is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Brighton).
We have witnessed a sending-off! Davy Propper (Brighton) is given a red card for his dangerous challenge. Anthony Taylor's decision is final.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Biram Kayal (Brighton) comes onto the pitch so that Pascal Gross can be given a rest.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Jonathan Hogg limps off the pitch to be replaced by Philip Billing (Huddersfield).

Jonas Lossl pulls off a great save to deny Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Solomon March whips in the corner and finds Shane Duffy (Brighton) in space with just the keeper to beat, but somehow he plants his header just over the bar from close in. He should have scored!
Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) times his run into the box beautifully and plants a good looking header at goal from the corner, but the ball flashes just wide of the right post.
David Wagner has decided to substitute Rajiv van La Parra and he is replaced by Collin Quaner (Huddersfield).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tom Ince (Huddersfield) departs the field of play to be replaced by Laurent Depoitre.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the right post is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper. Newcastle will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Goal! Ayoze Perez passes the ball to Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Kasper Schmeichel couldn't do anything about it. 0:1.
Yellow card! It's like Harry Maguire (Leicester) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Stuart Attwell agrees and books him.
Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Iborra is being substituted because of an injury. Claude Puel sends Hamza Choudhury (Leicester) on the pitch.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Stuart Attwell has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just over the crossbar. It could have been a fantastic goal!
Stuart Attwell shows a yellow card to Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.
Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) has tested the patience of referee Stuart Attwell and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Claude Puel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) replacing Danny Simpson.
That will be all from Kenedy who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd).
Rafael Benitez prepares a substitution. Dwight Gayle is replaced by Joselu (Newcastle Utd).

What a goal that is! Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) received the ball on the edge of the 18-yard box and spotted the goalkeeper off his line. He set himself up perfectly and lobbed the ball over Kasper Schmeichel and into the net. Florian Lejeune provided the assistance. 0:2.
Claude Puel decides to make a substitution. Fousseni Diabate will be replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Rafael Benitez has decided to substitute Mohamed Diame and he is replaced by Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd).
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Shinji Okazaki and Jamie Vardy (Leicester) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 1:2.

Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) was all set to celebrate a sensational goal after he collected a rebound and blasted a shot in from long range. Unfortunately for him, his effort sailed narrowly wide of the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) picks up the ball inside the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort that sails well over the crossbar and ends in the stands.

Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Jack Butland makes a decent save to deny his effort directed low to the middle of the target.
The foul by Erik Pieters (Stoke City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Graham Scott.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Graham Scott starts the second half.
What a goal! Dele Alli plays it to Christian Eriksen (Tottenham), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Jack Butland into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Goal! Hugo Lloris makes a huge mistake and Mame Diouf (Stoke City) has an easy task to put the ball into the back of the net. 1:1.
GOAL! Christian Eriksen curls the free kick into the box. Harry Kane (Tottenham) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Jack Butland and into the right side of the net. 1:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Heung-Min Son departs the field of play to be replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Paul Lambert prepares a substitution. Ramadan Sobhi is replaced by Tyrese Campbell (Stoke City).
Graham Scott shows the yellow card to Glen Johnson (Stoke City) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Peter Crouch (Stoke City) on for Glen Johnson.
The game is interrupted. Serge Aurier (Tottenham) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
A decent effort by Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) from a close-range free kick! His attempt flies narrowly over the crossbar.
The substitution has been made. Eric Dier (Tottenham) has replaced Victor Wanyama.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Dele Alli and he is replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City) receives a yellow card!
Harry Kane (Tottenham) gets a yellow card. The referee Graham Scott made the right call.
Here is a change. Moritz Bauer is going off and Paul Lambert gives the last tactical orders to Kurt Zouma (Stoke City).
Badou Ndiaye (Stoke City) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Graham Scott pulls out a yellow card.
Booking. Danny Rose (Tottenham) receives a caution from the referee.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Chris Wood (Burnley) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Troy Deeney (Watford) is ready on the edge of the six-yard box and duly receives the cross, but his header fizzes just wide of the left post.
Roberto Pereyra (Watford) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Nick Pope is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Burnley) is cautioned by the referee.

The opposition back off Roberto Pereyra (Watford), who needs no second invitation to shoot from inside the box. It's a decent effort towards the roof of the net, but Nick Pope denies him with the save. The ball is out of play. Watford will have a chance to score from a corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Paul Tierney blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) receives a yellow card.
Goal! Roberto Pereyra (Watford) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Substitution. Georges-Kevin N'Koudou walks off the pitch and Sam Vokes (Burnley) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Sam Vokes (Burnley) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:1.
Goal! Kevin Long feeds Jack Cork (Burnley), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 1:2.
That will be all from Daryl Janmaat who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Stefano Okaka (Watford).
Jack Cork (Burnley) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the right side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
It is time for a substitution. Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) is on for Aaron Lennon.
Javier Gracia Carlos decides to make a substitution. Abdoulaye Doucoure will be replaced by Andre Carrillo (Watford).
Javier Gracia Carlos has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Richarlison (Watford) replacing Will Hughes.

Chris Wood (Burnley) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Orestis Karnezis makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom left corner.
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Stefano Okaka (Watford) is given a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Chris Brunt (West Brom) latches on to a low pass and without any hesitation whatsoever releases a first-time rocket towards the roof of the net. Unfortunately for him, his long-distance effort is blocked by Lukasz Fabianski who makes a glorious save!
Good chance! Andre Ayew (Swansea) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored!
Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the top of the net. His effort is blocked by Lukasz Fabianski with a brilliant diving save!
Roger East has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Carlos Carvalhal makes a half-time substitution. Kyle Bartley (Swansea) comes on in place of Mike van der Hoorn.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) outbattles his marker to get a close-range header in on goal from the corner, but a defender unwittingly blocks the ball as it looked set to find the net. The ball is out of play. West Brom win a corner kick.
Salomon Rondon plays a terrific cross over to Jay Rodriguez (West Brom), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
A yellow card for bad language! Sam Clucas (Swansea) couldn’t remain silent and the result is obvious.
Carlos Carvalhal prepares a substitution. Andy King is replaced by Nathan Dyer (Swansea).
Sam Clucas sends the resulting corner into the box and expertly finds Tammy Abraham (Swansea), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the roof of the net. It's 1:1.
A substitution has been made. Jay Rodriguez goes off and Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) comes on.
Carlos Carvalhal decides to make a substitution. Andre Ayew will be replaced by Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea).
Matt Phillips (West Brom) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
James McClean (West Brom) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Kyle Bartley (Swansea) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

Jordan Pickford makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.

Yannick Bolasie (Everton) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the right side of the goal. Loris Karius is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. Corner kick. Everton will have an opportunity.

James Milner (Liverpool) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Jordan Pickford pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The referee points to the corner flag and Liverpool will take a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Michael Oliver starts the second half.
Here is a change. Wayne Rooney is going off and Samuel Allardyce gives the last tactical orders to Idrissa Gueye (Everton).
Here comes a substitution. Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Yannick Bolasie.
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. James Milner will be replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool).
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) evades challenges and shoots from the edge of the box. It's a good effort, but flies just over the bar.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Sadio Mane is replaced by Roberto Firmino (Liverpool).
Substitution. Beni Baningime (Everton) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Tom Davies walks off.
Theo Walcott picks out Cenk Tosun (Everton) on the edge of the six-yard box, but the headed attempt bends just round the right post.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) is left with the simplest of tasks from close in after a lucky rebound off one of his own teammates, but somehow he slams his shot well wide of the right post.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) replaces Danny Ings.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Dele Alli (Tottenham) comes close to scoring. He meets a lovely lofted pass from Christian Eriksen, but sends his close-range header way wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Chelsea will have a goal kick.

Willian (Chelsea) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the left post. Hugo Lloris has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Goal! Victor Moses hands Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the left side of the goal. 1:0.
Nice piece of skill by Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) as he collected a pass and fired an unstoppable thunderbolt into the roof of the net, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
The end of the first half.
Andre Marriner blows his whistle and the second half starts.

That was a nice football moment. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the top left corner. Wilfredo Caballero guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Tottenham force their opponents to concede a corner.
Eric Dier passes the ball into the penalty area. Dele Alli (Tottenham) collects it and quickly sends it into the right side of the goal via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:2!
Goal! Dele Alli (Tottenham) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:3.
Andre Marriner shows the yellow card to Ben Davies (Tottenham) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Harry Kane (Tottenham) on for Heung-Min Son.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to make a change. Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) replaces Eric Dier.
Today's match ends for Victor Moses who will be replaced by Olivier Giroud (Chelsea).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Emerson (Chelsea) will replace Marcos Alonso.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) replacing Erik Lamela.
Substitution. Alvaro Morata leaves the pitch and is replaced by Callum Hudson-Odoi (Chelsea).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) smacks a rebound from close range into the crossbar.
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) has an effort from close range after latching on to a precise pass, but he can't beat one of the defenders who makes a good block.
Paul Lambert is forced to make a change. Mame Diouf is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
Substitution. Danny Welbeck makes way for Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Glen Johnson (Stoke City) was quite harsh and Craig Pawson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Jack Butland. The ball goes out for a corner. Arsenal can continue in their attacking effort.
Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City) makes a rough challenge and Craig Pawson blows his whistle for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. Arsenal are awarded a penalty kick!
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Jack Butland into the bottom right corner.
Here comes a substitution. Jack Wilshere is given a rest as he is replaced by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) replaces Mohamed Elneny.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ramadan Sobhi departs the field of play to be replaced by Peter Crouch (Stoke City).

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads low towards the middle of the goal, but Jack Butland shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 2:0.
Dangerous play by Badou Ndiaye (Stoke City). Craig Pawson blows his whistle for a foul. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Arsenal!
Goal! Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Jack Butland to commit before slotting the penalty into the bottom right corner.
This is a yellow card! Joe Allen (Stoke City) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
It's a goal! David Silva plays the ball to the feet of Leroy Sane (Manchester City), who hits a tremendous first-time shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out. 0:1.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) leaps to meet an excellent cross and steers a fantastic header past the goalkeeper, inside the right post.

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
David Silva (Manchester City) takes a short pass in his stride and attempts to beat the keeper from mid-range, but the shot screeches just wide of the right post.

David Silva is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom left corner to make the score 0:3.
Paul Tierney has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Wayne Rooney leaves the pitch and Tom Davies (Everton) comes on.
A piece of footballing magic! Yannick Bolasie (Everton) collected a precise pass and fired a shot towards the bottom left corner, bouncing in off the post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Substitution. Raheem Sterling walks off the pitch and Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.
Cenk Tosun (Everton) rises high to meet a cross from the corner kick and plants a header from inside the penalty area. His effort went just narrowly wide of the left post.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin comes off the pitch to be replaced by Beni Baningime (Everton).
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) replacing Kevin De Bruyne.
Substitution. Oumar Niasse (Everton) on for Cenk Tosun.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Danilo (Manchester City) replaces Aymeric Laporte.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Chris Kavanagh shows a yellow card to Wes Morgan (Leicester) for his blatant foul.
Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Chris Kavanagh and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Glenn Murray (Brighton) does well inside the box to bring down a pass from Pascal Gross. He gets away a decent shot but it creeps just past the right post.
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Here comes a substitution. Shinji Okazaki is given a rest as he is replaced by Fousseni Diabate (Leicester).
Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
What was Danny Simpson (Leicester) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Biram Kayal (Brighton) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Harry Maguire (Leicester) was quite harsh and Chris Kavanagh didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Lewis Dunk (Brighton) latches onto the free kick from Pascal Gross, but heads just over the bar from close range.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom right corner. His promising effort is kept out by Mathew Ryan, who pulls off a stunning save!
Substitution. Solomon March (Brighton) has come on for Jurgen Locadia.
Harry Maguire (Leicester) commits a rough challenge and Chris Kavanagh blows his whistle for a foul. No point in arguing there. Brighton will take a penalty kick.

Glenn Murray (Brighton) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot inside the right post. Kasper Schmeichel anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.
Gaetan Bong (Brighton) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.
Claude Puel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Demarai Gray (Leicester) replacing Marc Albrighton.
Benjamin Chilwell launches a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Iborra (Leicester) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. 0:1.
Biram Kayal comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sam Baldock (Brighton).
Claude Puel has decided to substitute Riyad Mahrez and he is replaced by Christian Fuchs (Leicester).
Chris Kavanagh blows his whistle and Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.

Solomon March (Brighton) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save. Brighton force their opponents to concede a corner.
Goal! Demarai Gray puts the ball across the area and Jamie Vardy (Leicester) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 0:2.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

Wonderful movement! Alexis Sanchez is in a good position inside the box but decides to pass the ball to Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United), who keeps his cool and blasts the ball into the top left corner. What a finish that is – 1:0.

Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Goal! Jesse Lingard plays a simple square pass into the feet of Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) in the box, who composes himself and lashes the ball into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nathan Dyer departs the field of play to be replaced by Tammy Abraham (Swansea).
Carlos Carvalhal makes a half-time substitution. Thomas Carroll (Swansea) comes on in place of Sung-Yong Ki.
A decent cross gives Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) a chance to score, but he sends his header inches over the bar from close range.
Sam Clucas doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Wayne Routledge (Swansea) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) latches onto a brilliant cross and fires the ball towards goal, but his shot goes high over the crossbar.
A pass travels right across the box to Tammy Abraham (Swansea) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper inside the left post, but David de Gea denies him with a decent save.
The referee signals a substitution. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) is brought on as a substitute for Alexis Sanchez.
Here is a change. Jesse Lingard is going off and Jose Mourinho gives the last tactical orders to Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
A substitution has been made. Juan Manuel Mata goes off and Scott McTominay (Manchester United) comes on.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) sees a yellow card from Martin Atkinson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Yellow card! It's like Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Martin Atkinson agrees and books him.
The ball falls for Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) in the box, and he hits a first-time shot at goal that is inadvertently blocked by a defender. A bit unlucky there!
So close! Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) tries a curler from the edge of the box, but it slides just wide of the left post.

Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) receives a slide-rule pass inside the box and has just the keeper to beat. His shot towards the bottom right corner lacks power and Jonas Lossl easily makes the save. The referee signals a corner kick to Newcastle.
Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
A pass across the box picks out an unmarked Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) and he tries to place the ball towards the roof of the net, but it goes just over the bar.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Elias Kachunga is substituted due to injury. David Wagner gives a chance to Collin Quaner (Huddersfield).
Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
The game is interrupted. Christopher Schindler (Huddersfield) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Zanka (Huddersfield) gets himself onto the end of the corner, but his header is blocked.
Rafael Benitez has decided to make a change. Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd) replaces Matt Ritchie.
It will be a substitution. Islam Slimani (Newcastle Utd) is ready to enter the pitch as Dwight Gayle walks off.
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) replacing Mohamed Diame.
It's in the back of the net! Kenedy is the provider as he slips the ball to Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) will replace Tom Smith.
Martin Atkinson shows the yellow card to Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) for a heavy challenge.
Here is a change. Rajiv van La Parra is going off and David Wagner gives the last tactical orders to Scott Malone (Huddersfield).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Jose Holebas produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Kiko (Watford) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball inside the left post. What a brilliant finish. 1:0.
Jose Holebas (Watford) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Bournemouth!
Jose Holebas (Watford) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
Junior Stanislas just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) replaces him.
Andy Madley has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Will Hughes produces a sweet pass and picks out Roberto Pereyra (Watford) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 2:1!
Sebastian Prodl (Watford) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
Substitution. Sebastian Prodl did his best and is replaced by Craig Cathcart (Watford).
Here is a change. Jordon Ibe is going off and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders to Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Stefano Okaka (Watford) comes onto the pitch for Will Hughes.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) was quite harsh and Andy Madley didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Free kick. Bournemouth will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
Javier Gracia Carlos has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Richarlison (Watford) replacing Kiko.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Callum Wilson as he is replaced by Andrew Surman (Bournemouth).
Stefano Okaka (Watford) has tested the patience of referee Andy Madley and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

GOAL! Nathan Ake jumps high to meet the resulting free kick and nods the ball into the path of Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth), who is unmarked inside the box and slots the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:2.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a goal that is! Aaron Lennon sends a brilliant cross into the box and Ashley Barnes (Burnley) scores a stunning bicycle kick goal! Wow, take a bow gentlemen. 0:1.
Chris Wood (Burnley) makes sure he wins the cross from Jack Cork near the penalty spot but is unable to get his header on target, sending it narrowly wide of the right post.

Salomon Rondon (West Brom) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom right corner. Nick Pope shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Alan Pardew decided to make a change. Kieran Gibbs is replaced by Matt Phillips (West Brom).
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) receives a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) replaces Georges-Kevin N'Koudou.
Chris Wood (Burnley) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 0:2.
Alan Pardew has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Oliver Burke (West Brom) replacing Jay Rodriguez.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sam Vokes (Burnley) comes onto the pitch so that Chris Wood can be given a rest.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Jack Cork (Burnley) gets booked.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header inside the right post. Excellent finish.
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Nick Pope (Burnley) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Problems for David William Moyes as Michail Antonio is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) replaces him.

Cheikhou Kouyate passes to Joao Mario (West Ham), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top of the net. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.

What a miss! Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
Alex McCarthy makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the left-hand post by Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) after a cross from the side.
Goal! Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 2:0.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) gets on the end of a delightful cross and sends the ball inside the right post!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Mark Hughes decided to make a change. Manolo Gabbiadini is replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
Mario Lemina (Southampton) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Jack Stephens (Southampton) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Substitution. Nathan Redmond makes his way off the pitch and Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Marko Arnautovic is going off and David William Moyes gives the last tactical orders to Jordan Hugill (West Ham).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dusan Tadic (Southampton) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Charlie Austin is given a rest as he is replaced by Guido Carrillo (Southampton).
David William Moyes decides to make a substitution. Cheikhou Kouyate will be replaced by Josh Cullen (West Ham).
Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) receives a cross from the resulting free kick and shoots! However, his effort from just outside the box crashes against the crossbar. What an opportunity!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. His dangerous effort is blocked by Loris Karius, who makes a glorious save! Crystal Palace will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
The corner is flicked onto Sadio Mane (Liverpool), but his close-range header flies a whisker wide of the left post.

Loris Karius (Liverpool) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle for an infringement. Crystal Palace are awarded a penalty kick!
Neil Swarbrick shows the yellow card to Loris Karius (Liverpool) for a heavy challenge.
Goal! Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Loris Karius into left side of the goal.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) is booked by the referee.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The referee shows the yellow card to Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace).
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) rises above the defence and powers a header at the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper denies him with a superb save.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Sadio Mane (Liverpool) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from James Milner inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) receives a cross in the box and attempts to shoot, but mishits the ball and misses the goal.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar.

Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) has the opportunity to threaten the opponent's goal via a free kick on the edge of the box. He hits a fine strike towards the left side of the goal, but Loris Karius denies him with a great save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Crystal Palace will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) comes onto the pitch so that Sadio Mane can be given a rest.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Georginio Wijnaldum is replaced by Adam Lallana (Liverpool).
Jurgen Klopp is forced to make a change. Adam Lallana is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Dejan Lovren (Liverpool).
The referee signals a substitution. Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) is brought on as a substitute for Yohan Cabaye.
Goal - 1:2! Andrew Robertson laid the ball off to Mohamed Salah (Liverpool), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Substitution. Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Crystal Palace) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Aaron Wan-Bissaka walks off.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Orestis Karnezis with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Jurgen Klopp is forced to make a change. Emre Can is unable to continue due to injury, James Milner (Liverpool) comes on.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Orestis Karnezis makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Liverpool.
Andrew Robertson plays a terrific cross over to Mohamed Salah (Liverpool), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Goal! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) latches onto the ball inside the box and scores a fantastic back-heel goal. He makes it 3:0.
Joe Gomez (Liverpool) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card. Watford are awarded a free kick.
OFF THE BAR! Roberto Pereyra (Watford) strikes a brilliant shot towards goal from the free kick, but his effort rattles the crossbar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Will Hughes (Watford) will replace Richarlison.
Here is a change. Troy Deeney is going off and Javier Gracia Carlos gives the last tactical orders to Stefano Okaka (Watford).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) comes onto the pitch for Georginio Wijnaldum.

Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Orestis Karnezis is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 4:0.
It is time for a substitution. Danny Ings (Liverpool) is on for Roberto Firmino.
Javier Gracia Carlos decides to make a substitution. Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera will be replaced by Daryl Janmaat (Watford).
Orestis Karnezis pulls off a great save to deny Danny Ings (Liverpool), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal.

Orestis Karnezis can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Danny Ings (Liverpool). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Goal! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) has the simplest of tasks to roll the ball into an empty net from close range after a rebound left the keeper stranded. 5:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Eddie Howe is forced to make a change. Simon Francis is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth).
Adam Smith (Bournemouth) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Jake Livermore (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Graham Scott and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Salomon Rondon and Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 0:1.
Eddie Howe prepares a substitution. Adam Smith is replaced by Lys Mousset (Bournemouth).
