The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Callum Wilson leaves the pitch and Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) comes on.
Alan Pardew has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Matt Phillips (West Brom) replacing Jonny Evans.
What a goal! Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) receives an accurate pass and tries his luck with a long-range shot. He unleashes a superb strike that goes into the right post and behind the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Chris Brunt walks off the pitch and Sam Field (West Brom) comes on as a substitute.
Alan Pardew has decided to make a change. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) replaces Jay Rodriguez.
Graham Scott shows a yellow card to Craig Dawson (West Brom) for his blatant foul. There is a free kick near the sideline to Bournemouth.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!
Matt Phillips (West Brom) receives a pinpoint pass, takes one touch and produces a shot. It's a few inches shy of ending inside the left post. A great effort, though!
That's it for today, Graham Scott has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but the effort goes just wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jeffery Schlupp departs the field of play to be replaced by Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace).
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) won himself just enough space to meet the corner and shoots. The goalkeeper makes a comfortable save as the ball goes into the middle of a goal.
Goal! 0:1. James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. David Wagner decided to make a change. Scott Malone is replaced by Chris Lowe (Huddersfield).
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) gets a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) is coming onto the pitch as Tom Ince cannot continue after picking up an injury.
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort.
Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the left post.

A clumsy foul by Mathias Jorgensen (Huddersfield) and Michael Dean blows his whistle. PENALTY to Crystal Palace! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Goal! Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Jonas Lossl to commit before slotting the penalty into the left of the goal.
Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alex Pritchard trots off the pitch and is replaced by Elias Kachunga (Huddersfield).
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) for his blatant foul.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the middle of the goal was easily saved by Jonas Lossl.
Aaron Wan-Bissaka (Crystal Palace) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Christopher Schindler (Huddersfield) gets booked for the first time in this match. Crystal Palace will take a free kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) replaces Wilfried Zaha.

Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Jonas Lossl pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. Crystal Palace force their opponents to concede a corner.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Tom Davies (Everton) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went a whisker over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.

Peter Crouch (Stoke City) misses a good chance to score. A perfect cross into the box finds Peter Crouch (Stoke City) who rises for a header, but he sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.
Very strict call by the referee! He pulls out the red card and sends Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) off the pitch.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Problems for Samuel Allardyce as Tom Davies is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) replaces him.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) receives a yellow card.
What a save from Jack Butland! Cenk Tosun (Everton) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.
Goal! A rebound wrong foots everyone except Cenk Tosun (Everton), and he slams the ball into the open net from close range. 0:1.
That will be all from Ramadan Sobhi who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City).
We are about to witness a substitution. Saido Berahino (Stoke City) is replacing Xherdan Shaqiri.
A cross from the free kick is whipped deep into the box by Joe Allen and Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) gets in a shot, sending the ball into the middle of the net. 1:1.
Paul Lambert is forced to make a change. Maxim Choupo-Moting is unable to continue due to injury, Jese (Stoke City) comes on.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Phil Jagielka (Everton) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Goal! Theo Walcott plays a hopeful cross into a crowded box. Cenk Tosun (Everton) times his jump perfectly and sends a header into the bottom right corner from close in. 1:2.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the bottom left corner. Jack Butland is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save.
Here comes a substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Wayne Rooney.
Theo Walcott (Everton) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to substitute Yannick Bolasie and he is replaced by Mason Holgate (Everton).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Goal! Raheem Sterling displays great vision and sends a pass to David Silva (Manchester City), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 0:1.

A neat pass is well received by Fernandinho (Manchester City), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot. The linesman points to the corner flag, Manchester City are going to take it.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.

GOAL! Superb work from Gabriel Jesus, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to David Silva (Manchester City), who beats Jack Butland with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 0:2.

Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) produced a promising shot towards the bottom right corner after his wonderful solo run, but Jack Butland thwarted him with a fabulous save. Manchester City force a corner. They send men into the box.

Leroy Sane (Manchester City) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the left post! The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Paul Lambert has decided to substitute Jese and he is replaced by Peter Crouch (Stoke City).
The foul by Joe Allen (Stoke City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked. Manchester City force their opponents to concede a corner.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Raheem Sterling is replaced by Bernardo Silva (Manchester City).
Here is a change. Geoff Cameron is going off and Paul Lambert gives the last tactical orders to Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City).
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Gabriel Jesus will be replaced by Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A great pass puts Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hit his shot off the crossbar.
Goal! Adam Smith puts a cross into the box and finds Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Danny Rose (Tottenham) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Harry Kane has picked up an injury and is replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Serge Aurier feeds the ball through to Dele Alli (Tottenham), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the middle of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Simon Francis (Bournemouth) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and produces a ferocious strike towards the left post, but his shot is well held by the goalkeeper. Bournemouth will take a corner kick.

Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Tottenham.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom right corner, but Asmir Begovic has other ideas and makes a brilliant save.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Dan Gosling (Bournemouth), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Dele Alli sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:2.
Substitution. Joshua King (Bournemouth) has come on for Lys Mousset.
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Charlie Daniels and he is replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).
Substitution. Junior Stanislas leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Danny Rose leaves the pitch to be replaced by Kieran Trippier (Tottenham).
Goal disallowed! Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) scores but Michael Dean blows his whistle for a foul.
Dele Alli just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) replaces him.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) runs on to a clever pass from Christian Eriksen and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He still has work to do but finishes with aplomb into the back of the net.

Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the top left corner. Asmir Begovic guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Tottenham.
It's a goal! Serge Aurier (Tottenham) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 1:4.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Goal! Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Mesut Ozil, and he steers a powerful header from near the penalty spot inside the left post. What a finish that is - 1:0!
The ball rebounds to Roberto Pereyra (Watford) inside the box after a goalmouth scramble, but he whips the ball high over bar.

Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Orestis Karnezis to get hold of the ball.
Richarlison (Watford) wins the ball near the penalty spot and unleashes a header towards the bottom right corner, but Petr Cech is alert and denies him.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) picks up a yellow card.

It's a goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal) commits a rough foul. Martin Atkinson stops the game and makes a call. A penalty is awarded to Watford!
Penalty saved! Troy Deeney (Watford) sends the penalty towards the left hand side of the goal, but Petr Cech pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
Substitution. Will Hughes (Watford) replaces Kiko.
Jose Holebas (Watford) gets a yellow card.
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Alex Iwobi will be replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
Here is a change. Roberto Pereyra is going off and Javier Gracia Carlos gives the last tactical orders to Stefano Okaka (Watford).
Calum Chambers (Arsenal) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Shkodran Mustafi.

3:0. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Arsenal) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires in a fantastic first-time effort. His rocket of a shot goes through Orestis Karnezis and into the middle of the goal. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang provided the assistance.
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) replaces Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Daryl Janmaat walks off the pitch to be replaced by Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford).
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) is booked.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
GOAL 1:0! Willian (Chelsea) brilliantly slaloms his way forward past a few defenders and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which is deflected and goes into the back of the net.

An own goal from Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace)! Despite his good intentions to intercept a pass directed to the dangerous area in front of the goal, he made a rather clumsy move and put the ball into his own net.

What a great touch by Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. Good work from Chelsea as they win a corner.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Eden Hazard (Chelsea) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Anthony Taylor starts the second half.
Half-time substitution. Roy Hodgson decided to make a change. Christian Benteke is replaced by Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace).
Alexander Sorloth (Crystal Palace) storms into the box to get on the end of a pass, but smashes his shot straight onto the left post. Unlucky!

What a great touch by Willian (Chelsea) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Chelsea.
Great save! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the bottom left corner was brilliantly saved by Wayne Hennessey.
Anthony Taylor shows the yellow card to Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) for a heavy challenge.
Post! Olivier Giroud (Chelsea) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
The referee signals a substitution. Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Olivier Giroud.
Roy Hodgson has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jairo Riedewald (Crystal Palace) replacing Jeffery Schlupp.
Substitution. Andros Townsend walks off the pitch and Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) comes on as a substitute.
Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) is yellow-carded.
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Antonio Conte decides to make a substitution. Eden Hazard will be replaced by Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea).
It is time for a substitution. Pedro (Chelsea) is on for Cesc Fabregas.
Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) collects a delightful pass inside the box and nets with a perfect low drive into the middle of the goal. What a clinical finish!
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Seamus Coleman (Everton) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Yannick Bolasie (Everton) has a great chance on the edge of the six-yard box following a lofted pass, but his header lacks accuracy and flies just past the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
What was Ezequiel Schelotto (Brighton) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Gaetan Bong (Brighton), who attempted to smack the ball away, but instead he sends it inside the right post of his own goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Biram Kayal departs the field of play to be replaced by Jurgen Locadia (Brighton).
The referee signals a substitution. Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Theo Walcott.
Goal! A great through ball by Leighton Baines sets up Cenk Tosun (Everton) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the top right corner. 2:0.
Chris Hughton has decided to substitute Glenn Murray and he is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Brighton).
Substitution. Mason Holgate (Everton) has come on for Yannick Bolasie.
Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) makes a tackle on his opponent and is shown a harsh red card by the referee!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Markus Suttner (Brighton) replaces Gaetan Bong.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Davy Klaassen (Everton) replaces Tom Davies.
Dangerous play by Shane Duffy (Brighton). Roger East blows his whistle for a foul. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Everton.
Penalty saved! Wayne Rooney (Everton) sends the penalty towards the bottom left corner, but Mathew Ryan pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and the referee sends him off!
Alfie Mawson (Swansea) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Martin Olsson (Swansea) gets a yellow card. The referee Michael Oliver made the right call.
Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the right post.
Close! Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.

A wonderful opportunity! Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) strikes from close range and hits the ball nicely towards the top of the net. However, Lukasz Fabianski makes a great save as he anticipates the shot and manages to parry it onto the bar. Huddersfield get a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Andre Ayew (Swansea). Michael Oliver doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

This was a nice set play except the finish. Unmarked Florent Hadergjonaj (Huddersfield) controlled a precise lofted pass from the corner kick far out and unleashed a long-range shot. He didn't hit the ball exactly how he'd wanted and it went within inches of the left post.
David Wagner has decided to substitute Alex Pritchard and he is replaced by Collin Quaner (Huddersfield).
A substitution has been made. Aaron Mooy goes off and Daniel Williams (Huddersfield) comes on.
Florent Hadergjonaj (Huddersfield) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Substitution. Tammy Abraham (Swansea) in, Andre Ayew out.
David Wagner decides to make a substitution. Rajiv van La Parra will be replaced by Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield).
Substitution. Sung-Yong Ki will be replaced by Thomas Carroll (Swansea).
Tom Ince (Huddersfield) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a decent header which rattles the left post!
Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Goal! Kenedy (Newcastle Utd) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and fires the ball inside the back of the net.

Goal! Dwight Gayle displays great vision and sends a pass to Kenedy (Newcastle Utd), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Mauricio Pellegrino probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Mario Lemina. He is replaced by Joshua Sims (Southampton).
Here is a change after the half-time break. Dusan Tadic is replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
Wesley Hoedt (Southampton) picks up a yellow card.
Goal! Jonjo Shelvey slips it to Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 3:0.
The referee signals a substitution. Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) is brought on as a substitute for Guido Carrillo.
Jack Stephens (Southampton) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Joselu (Newcastle Utd) replacing Dwight Gayle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kenedy trots off the pitch and is replaced by Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd).
Here is a change. Jonjo Shelvey is going off and Rafael Benitez gives the last tactical orders to Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Jose Rondon (West Brom) meets a perfect cross from Oliver Burke deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner via the post. It's 1:0.
Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) latches onto a short pass just on the edge of the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper but comes back off the crossbar. Close!
Amazing piece of skill! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) picks up a cross on the edge of the 18-yard box and hammers the ball into the bottom right corner. What a finish that is!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The foul by Jamie Vardy (Leicester) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Madley.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Robert Madley blows his whistle to start the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by Danny Simpson (Leicester). Robert Madley doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Grzegorz Krychowiak is replaced by Sam Field (West Brom).
Claude Puel has decided to make a change. Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) replaces Shinji Okazaki.
GOAL! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Ben Foster, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:2.
Here's the change. Demarai Gray leaves the pitch and Marc Albrighton (Leicester) comes on as a substitute.
Alan Pardew has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) replacing Matt Phillips.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) heads the ball into the middle after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
Jake Livermore (West Brom) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) comes onto the pitch for Oliver Burke.
The game has come to an end for Riyad Mahrez. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Fousseni Diabate (Leicester).
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Iborra (Leicester) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight under the crossbar. He makes it 1:4.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Nick Pope pulls off a great save to deny Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Joao Mario (West Ham) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.

Great save! Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the bottom right corner was brilliantly saved by Nick Pope. West Ham earn a corner.
Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Lee Mason ignores the protests.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Lee Mason blows his whistle to start the second half.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Ashley Barnes (Burnley) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The foul by Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Lee Mason.
Ashley Westwood (Burnley) sees a yellow card from Lee Mason after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Sean Dyche decides to make a substitution. Jeff Hendrick will be replaced by Chris Wood (Burnley).

0:1. Ashley Barnes (Burnley) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires a fantastic first-time shot into the top right corner of the net. What a finish that is! Joe Hart did his best to stop it, but the shot was just too good. Chris Wood provided the assistance.
It's a goal! Aaron Lennon plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Chris Wood (Burnley). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:2.
The substitution has been made. Chicharito (West Ham) has replaced Joao Mario.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Aaron Lennon (Burnley), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a low shot goalwards. The ball is directed towards the middle of the goal, but it lacks power and Nick Pope pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort.

A nice pass finds Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) in space. He sets himself up and hammers in a fantastic low shot from distance that looks bound for the middle of the goal, but the out of position Joe Hart pulls off a breathtaking save to deny him.
Goal! The rebound fell to Chris Wood (Burnley) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:3.
Sean Dyche has decided to substitute Ashley Barnes and he is replaced by Sam Vokes (Burnley).
That's it for today, Lee Mason has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Goal! Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 2:0.
The whistle blows and Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) is booked for an infringement.
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) is punished with the yellow card.
The cross fools the defence and leaves Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) with an easy chance inside the box, but he mistimes his shot and sends it just wide of the right post.
Craig Pawson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain will be replaced by Adam Lallana (Liverpool).
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Eric Bailly (Manchester United), who attempted to smack the ball away, but instead he sends it into his own net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcus Rashford departs the field of play to be replaced by Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Trent Alexander-Arnold as he is replaced by Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) replaces Andrew Robertson.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Antonio Valencia (Manchester United).
Here comes a substitution. Juan Manuel Mata is given a rest as he is replaced by Jesse Lingard (Manchester United).
Alexis Sanchez goes off the pitch and Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) comes on.
Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.

Wayne Hennessey pulls off a fantastic save! Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the top of the net, but the effort is kept out.
Goal! Christian Benteke passes the ball to Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. David de Gea couldn't do anything about it. 1:0.
Today's referee Neil Swarbrick rightly decides to book Scott McTominay (Manchester United) for his harsh tackle. Crystal Palace have been awarded a free kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Neil Swarbrick starts the second half.
Jose Mourinho makes a half-time substitution. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) comes on in place of Scott McTominay.
Goal - 2:0! Jeffery Schlupp laid the ball off to Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace), who shot from close range into the left side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Chris Smalling (Manchester United) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Crystal Palace will have a goal kick.
Goal! Antonio Valencia picks out Chris Smalling (Manchester United) in the box with a decent cross, and he scores in the bottom right corner with a header from close range. 2:1.
The foul by Ashley Young (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Neil Swarbrick.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Wayne Hennessey was alert and the score remains the same. It will be a corner kick for Manchester Utd.
Substitution. Ashley Young makes way for Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United).
Here is a change. Antonio Valencia is going off and Jose Mourinho gives the last tactical orders to Luke Shaw (Manchester United).

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Nemanja Matic (Manchester United) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. His low strike heads towards the middle of the target, but it's deflected away thanks to a brilliant intervention by one of the defenders.
The expression of the referee Neil Swarbrick is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) is shown a yellow card.
Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) receives a pass and fires in a shot from the edge of the box. It deflects off one of the defending players and hits the underside of the crossbar!
Goal! Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.
A brilliant cross into the box finds Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace), who directs his header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows all his agility and makes an astonishing save.
Roy Hodgson prepares a substitution. Jeffrey Schlupp is replaced by Jairo Riedewald (Crystal Palace).

Nemanja Matic (Manchester United) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes inside the left post. He makes it 2:3 with this magnificent strike.
Nemanja Matic (Manchester United) gets a yellow card. The referee Neil Swarbrick made the right call.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Oleksandr Zinchenko (Manchester City) for his blatant foul.

Leroy Sane (Manchester City) clutches his head in despair after he blew a huge opportunity! He received the ball from the free kick, took a good first touch and unleashed a daisy-cutter from close range to the middle of the goal, but it was stopped by one of the defenders.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Goal! Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from David Silva, then sends the ball into the middle of the net. 1:0.
Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.

Ambitious effort from Victor Moses (Chelsea). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the right post.
Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) has tested the patience of referee Michael Oliver and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Manchester City have a free kick.
Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Willian is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Chelsea).
Here's the change. Pedro leaves the pitch and Emerson (Chelsea) comes on as a substitute.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) replacing Sergio Aguero.
Substitution. Danilo (Manchester City) in, Oleksandr Zinchenko out.

That's the end of the game for David Silva, who is replaced by Phil Foden (Manchester City).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Lewis Dunk (Brighton) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 1:0.
Goal! Pascal Gross plays a neat lofted pass into the box for Glenn Murray (Brighton), who beats the defender in the air and plants a header low into the middle of the goal from close range. 2:0.
Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Stuart Attwell lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal). Stuart Attwell doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Superb finishing from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal). Granit Xhaka plays a fantastic through ball and finds Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a close-range shot past the goalkeeper. It's 2:1.
The match has reached half-time.
Stuart Attwell blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) sees a yellow card from Stuart Attwell after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and produces a ferocious strike towards the left post, but his shot is well held by the goalkeeper. Arsenal will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Dale Stephens (Brighton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Stuart Attwell didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Ezequiel Schelotto (Brighton) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Problems for Chris Hughton as Ezequiel Schelotto is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Bruno Saltor (Brighton) replaces him.

Chris Hughton decides to make a substitution. Anthony Knockaert will be replaced by Solomon March (Brighton).

That will be all from Calum Chambers who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Edward Nketiah (Arsenal).

Here's the change. Pascal Gross leaves the pitch and Biram Kayal (Brighton) comes on as a substitute.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.

Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot towards the left side of the goal. His effort is blocked by Martin Dubravka with a brilliant diving save!
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly fires the ball into the middle of the net.

A pass into the box finds Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the top left corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Loris Karius denies him. Newcastle will take a corner kick.

Sadio Mane (Liverpool) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball inside the right post.

Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) beats the defender inside the box and lashes a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Asmir Begovic makes a brilliant reflex save to deny him. Goalkeeping at its best!

What a sensational goal that would have been! Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.

Alex McCarthy makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom right corner by Badou Ndiaye (Stoke City) after a cross from the side. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Stoke.

Jack Butland makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. Andre Ayew slides a pass towards Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) who unleashes a fabulous shot from long range. The ball goes behind the surprised goalkeeper and into the bottom right corner. The score is now 1:0.

Federico Fernandez (Swansea) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
Samuel Byram (West Ham) comes onto the pitch after Winston Reid signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Adrian was forced into action to thwart Andre Ayew (Swansea). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper.
Mike van der Hoorn (Swansea) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:0.

Goal! 3:0. Andy King (Swansea) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.

What an amazing save by Lukasz Fabianski! Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the right side of the goal, but fails.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) makes a slide tackle, but referee Martin Atkinson blows for a foul. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Swansea!
Goal! Jordan Ayew (Swansea) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Adrian into the bottom left corner.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.

Michail Antonio (West Ham) scores after a cross from the free kick. He controls the ball with a precise first touch and hits the net! His low effort from inside the box went into the middle of the goal.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom left corner. However, Jonas Lossl anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Jonas Lossl thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.

GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mike Jones had an easy-decision to make.

Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to Etienne Capoue (Watford), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) fails to convert a close-range free kick as he sends the ball narrowly over the bar.

The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Stefano Okaka (Watford) for Richarlison.

Stefano Okaka (Watford) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom right corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.

Gylfi Sigurdsson picks out Theo Walcott (Everton) unmarked inside the box, but he blazes the ball well over the bar.
GOAL! Cenk Tosun (Everton) scores with a header from close range after Seamus Coleman headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 0:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton). Chris Kavanagh doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Theo Walcott (Everton) is first to latch onto the rebound inside the penalty area. He sends a promising shot towards the bottom right corner, but it is denied by the goalkeeper who pulls off a superb save.

Ashley Barnes (Burnley) meets a splendid cross on the edge of the 6-yard box and sends the ball towards the left post, forcing Jordan Pickford into a superb diving save to keep it out. The game is interrupted. Ashley Westwood (Burnley) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.

Referee Chris Kavanagh blows his whistle to start the second half.

Ashley Westwood (Burnley) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the right side of the goal. However, Jordan Pickford anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save. Burnley get a corner.

Goal! Great link up play between Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) and Leroy Sane gives the former a clear sight of goal on the edge of the box. He doesn't disappoint and beats the keeper in the top left corner. 0:1.

It's unbelievable, Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) blows a huge opportunity! He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific daisy-cutter from point blank range. His first-time effort is directed towards the middle of the target, but Petr Cech reacts superbly to keep the ball out.

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Andre Marriner blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. Arsenal are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Arsenal) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot into the bottom right corner. Ederson anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.

Petr Cech pulls off a great save to deny Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Alexis Sanchez (Manchester United) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Thibaut Courtois is alert and denies him.

What an opportunity! Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. CHANCE! Harry Kane (Tottenham) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a low shot towards Wayne Hennessey, who produces an excellent reflex save. Tottenham force a corner. They send men into the box.
Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.

The second half gets underway.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Crystal Palace.

The corner kick falls to Ben Davies (Tottenham), who does his best to finish. The snap shot, however, only marks the left post! The ball goes out of play and Crystal Palace will have a goal kick.

Goal! Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:2. He was ably assisted there by Ayoze Perez.

Ambitious effort from Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.

Phil Foden looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who collects the ball perfectly and unleashes a terrific shot that ricochets in off the crossbar. The score is 5:1.

The match has just started.
Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) whips a volley from long range towards the goal. His beautiful effort whistles wide of the left post.

Idrissa Gueye (Everton) gets to the rebound outside the penalty box and unleashes a long-range shot towards the bottom left corner, but Wayne Hennessey makes a decent save to stop the effort. The ball goes out of play and Everton have been awarded a corner kick.
Samuel Allardyce is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Eliaquim Mangala suffers an injury and Ashley Williams (Everton) comes on.
What a chance that is! Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Samuel Allardyce makes a half-time substitution. Jonjoe Kenny (Everton) comes on in place of Seamus Coleman.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Everton) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Wayne Hennessey. 1:0.
It's a goal! Oumar Niasse (Everton) bravely launches himself at a cross from Cuco Martina and gives Wayne Hennessey no chance with a close-range bullet header into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
The foul by Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.

A lofted pass evades the keeper and lands right on the head of Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) in the centre of the box, but his header sails narrowly wide of the right post when an empty net was beckoning.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Jordan Pickford dived superbly to block a header by Alexander Sorloth (Crystal Palace) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the left post, but Jordan Pickford pulled off a remarkable save! The ball is out of play and Crystal Palace manage to earn a corner.
Theo Walcott (Everton) has tested the patience of referee Jonathan Moss and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Wayne Hennessey pulls off a great save to deny Oumar Niasse (Everton) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Goal! Tom Davies (Everton) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:0.
The manager makes a subsitution with Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) coming on for Idrissa Gueye.

Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top right corner is blocked by Jordan Pickford, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Crystal Palace have a corner.
Ashley Williams (Everton) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. The referee gives a penalty to Crystal Palace!
Goal! Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Jordan Pickford into left side of the goal.
That's it for today, Jonathan Moss has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The defence just can't clear the ball and a rebound eventually falls to Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) deep inside the box, but his well-hit shot flies just over the bar.
The opposition back off Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) and he lashes in a shot from the edge of the box that just flies over the bar. Unlucky!
Goal! Dale Stephens shows great vision to find Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom right corner. 0:1.

Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Davy Propper (Brighton) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies just over the bar.

Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
That will be all from Glenn Murray who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Leonardo Ulloa (Brighton).

Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the left side of the target, but Mathew Ryan pulls off a superb save.
Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
That's it for today, Robert Madley has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Sam Vokes (Burnley) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Yellow card! It's like Martin Olsson (Swansea) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Andre Marriner agrees and books him.
Andre Marriner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.

Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) clutches his head in despair after he blew a huge opportunity! He received the ball from the set piece, took a good first touch and unleashed a mid-range projectile to the top right corner, but Lukasz Fabianski makes a nice save. Good work from Burnley as they win a corner.
Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Carlos Carvalhal decides to make a substitution. Martin Olsson will be replaced by Andre Ayew (Swansea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Scott Arfield (Burnley) comes onto the pitch for Aaron Lennon.

Nick Pope makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded low towards the middle of the goal by Tammy Abraham (Swansea) after a cross from the side.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nahki Wells (Burnley) will replace Sam Vokes.
Goal! Kyle Naughton slips it to Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 1:0.

The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jordan Ayew walks off the pitch to be replaced by Andy King (Swansea).

Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Chicharito (West Ham) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Orestis Karnezis.
Chicharito (West Ham) leaps high to plant a header towards the right side of the goal. Orestis Karnezis is unable to keep the ball out and the score is 1:0.
The game is interrupted. Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.

Today's match ends for Gerard Deulofeu who will be replaced by Dodi Lukebakio (Watford).

Harry Kane (Tottenham) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) strikes the ball from a mid-range free kick towards the top left corner of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Tottenham.
We are about to witness a substitution. Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) is replacing Henrikh Mkhitaryan.

Troy Deeney (Watford) finds some space to control the ball from the corner and shoots, but his attempt goes way wide of the right post.

Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Dean didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.

Absolutely fantastic goal! Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) hits a perfect volley from far out and the ball flies into the top left corner. Take a bow.

Loris Karius (Liverpool) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Jonathan Moss blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. The referee blows his whistle and awards Tottenham a penalty after chaos inside the box.

Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and drills a good shot to the middle of the goal. Lukasz Fabianski shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop the effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!

Ahmed Hegazy (West Brom) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a powerful header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the roof of the net. What a beautiful moment! Mario Lemina (Southampton) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top left corner. Ben Foster just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:1.

Jack Stephens (Southampton) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet a cross the corner kick and scores with a great header into the top right corner. The goalkeeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:2.

Chris Brunt (West Brom) was close to scoring from the resulting free kick. He unleashed a decent strike from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper made a great save to keep him out.

What an opportunity! Ben Mee (Burnley) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the bottom right corner, but Ederson reacts superbly to keep the ball out. Burnley force a corner. They send men into the box.

Ben Foster pulls off a great save to deny Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.

Eric Dier (Tottenham) fails to score from inside the box as his rebound smashes against the right post!
Gooal! Ben Davies takes over corner duties. Harry Kane (Tottenham) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the middle of the net. 1:1.
What a sensational goal that would have been! Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.
The free kick is whipped into the box and finds Jack Stephens (Southampton), who plants a header just wide of the right post from close range.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Jack Stephens (Southampton) for his blatant foul.
Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) has tested the patience of referee Kevin Friend and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Oriol Romeu (Southampton) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Mauricio Pellegrino decides to make a substitution. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg will be replaced by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).

Harry Kane (Tottenham) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Harry Kane (Tottenham) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out for a corner. Tottenham can continue in their attacking effort.
A substitution has been made. Heung-Min Son goes off and Erik Lamela (Tottenham) comes on.
Kieran Trippier (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch because Serge Aurier simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Kieran Trippier (Tottenham) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mario Lemina walks off the pitch to be replaced by Steven Davis (Southampton).
Substitution. Manolo Gabbiadini will be replaced by Michael Obafemi (Southampton).
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) connects with an accurate pass inside the box and fires the ball to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players steps in to block the effort.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Mousa Dembele and he is replaced by Victor Wanyama (Tottenham).
Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) wastes a golden opportunity inside the box by shooting straight into the back of an opponent when the goal was at his mercy.
Chance! Harry Kane (Tottenham) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Dele Alli, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.

Goal! Kevin De Bruyne hands Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the right side of the goal. 1:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Paul Tierney has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Paul Tierney blows his whistle and signals a foul after Javier Manquillo (Newcastle Utd) brought his opponent down. PENALTY! One of the players from Manchester City is about to take a penalty kick.
Goal! Karl Darlow gets a hand on the penalty from Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), but can't stop it from flying inside the left post.
Substitution. Christian Atsu leaves the pitch and is replaced by Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd).
Rafael Benitez prepares a substitution. Javier Manquillo is replaced by DeAndre Yedlin (Newcastle Utd).
Goal! Ciaran Clark slips in Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd) for a one-on-one with the keeper, and he simply dinks the ball over him into the net.
A substitution has been made. Joselu is replaced by Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd).
The whistle blows and Ciaran Clark (Newcastle Utd) is booked for an infringement.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) takes a short pass from Leroy Sane in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot low into the middle of the goal. 3:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Raheem Sterling trots off the pitch and is replaced by Bernardo Silva (Manchester City).
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Brahim Diaz (Manchester City) replacing Leroy Sane.
That's it for today, Paul Tierney has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
Goal! Nacho Monreal produces a great pass that finds Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 2:0.
Goal Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal)! Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) was put through by Nacho Monreal and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 3:0.

4:0. Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires a fantastic first-time shot into the bottom right corner. What a finish that is! Wayne Hennessey did his best to stop it, but the shot was just too good. Mesut Ozil provided the assistance.
Arsene Wenger is forced to make a change. Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Ainsley Maitland-Niles.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Chris Kavanagh blows his whistle to start the second half.
Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Wayne Hennessey.

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) races onto a cross inside the box and lets fly with a powerful effort, but Petr Cech makes a fantastic reaction save to deny him. The ball is out of play. Crystal Palace will have a chance to score from a corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Mesut Ozil as he is replaced by Reiss Nelson (Arsenal).
The ball from the corner slips through the box to Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) and he slots it into the bottom right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) is put clear inside the box by a lofted pass. He only has the keeper to beat, but Wayne Hennessey comes out bravely to save at his feet. Great goalkeeping skills!
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Alex Iwobi is replaced by Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal).
Substitution. Jairo Riedewald (Crystal Palace) replaces Yohan Cabaye.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Ben Mee (Burnley) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Ashley Young (Manchester United) lacks options so goes solo. It's a fine run and good shot from inside the box, but it's a whisker past the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Romelu Lukaku passes the ball into the penalty area. Anthony Martial (Manchester United) collects it and quickly sends it into the top left corner via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) unleashes a brilliant effort from the free kick, but the ball crashes against the bar. What a chance!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Phillip Bardsley (Burnley) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Steven Defour (Burnley) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) has come on for Juan Manuel Mata.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Nemanja Matic (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) for Jesse Lingard.
Sean Dyche decides to make a substitution. Scott Arfield will be replaced by Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Burnley).
Substitution. Sam Vokes (Burnley) replaces Jeff Hendrick.
Nick Pope was forced into action to thwart Anthony Martial (Manchester United). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.
The manager makes a subsitution with Nahki Wells (Burnley) coming on for Ashley Barnes.
Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
A substitution has been made. Anthony Martial is replaced by Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
That's it for today, Michael Dean has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
A wild pass somehow finds Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) in space, he steadies himself and shoots from mid-range but sends it just over the bar.

It's in the back of the net! Grzegorz Krychowiak slips the ball through to Jay Rodriguez (West Brom), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
A snap shot by Jonjoe Kenny (Everton) from the edge of the area flies towards the top right corner, but Ben Foster produces a good reflex save to thwart him.
The foul by Theo Walcott (Everton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Stuart Attwell.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Stuart Attwell has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Samuel Allardyce makes a switch. Yannick Bolasie (Everton) is coming on in place of Nikola Vlasic at the start of the second period.
Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Stuart Attwell didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
James McCarthy is being substituted because of an injury. Samuel Allardyce sends Wayne Rooney (Everton) on the pitch.
Here comes a substitution. Oumar Niasse (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Cenk Tosun.
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Theo Walcott and Oumar Niasse (Everton) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 1:1.
Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) is unlucky with a low drive from the edge of the box. A decent save by Jordan Pickford stops the ball from hitting the middle of the net.

Theo Walcott (Everton) was in a good shooting position just outside the box and unleashed a first-time shot towards the inside of the left post, but the goalkeeper made a decent save to thwart his effort.
It's time for a substitution. James McClean (West Brom) comes on in place of Jay Rodriguez.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Chris Brunt walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jake Livermore (West Brom).
Here is a change. Jonny Evans is going off and Alan Pardew gives the last tactical orders to Gareth McAuley (West Brom).

What a chance! Jose Rondon (West Brom) squanders a promising opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the right post!
Stuart Attwell shows the yellow card to Craig Dawson (West Brom) for a heavy challenge.
Salomon Rondon (West Brom) gets into a shooting position! What a long-range cannonball of a shot! His nice effort, however, only crashes against the crossbar. Aim better, sir.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the right side of the goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save.
Molla Wague (Watford) makes a slide tackle, but referee Lee Probert blows for a foul. Leicester are awarded a penalty kick!
Goal! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Orestis Karnezis.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) collects a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a low drive to the middle, but Orestis Karnezis makes a save.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Roberto Pereyra will be replaced by Andre Gray (Watford).
Marco Silva decides to make a substitution. Molla Wague will be replaced by Sebastian Prodl (Watford).
The referee signals a substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) is brought on as a substitute for Shinji Okazaki.

Andre Gray (Watford) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Andre Gray (Watford) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Watford force a corner. They send men into the box.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Daryl Janmaat as he is replaced by Stefano Okaka (Watford).

Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Orestis Karnezis was alert and the score remains the same.
It is time for a substitution. Adrien Silva (Leicester) is on for Jamie Vardy.

An amazing individual effort from Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 2:0. Orestis Karnezis was helpless.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Jonas Lossl, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
A goal, which was scored by Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City), was disallowed due to offside.

Goal! Great link up play between Joe Allen (Stoke City) and Maxim Choupo-Moting gives the former a clear sight of goal on the edge of the box. He doesn't disappoint and beats the keeper in the bottom right corner. 1:0.
We are about to witness a substitution. Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) is replacing Tom Ince.
The manager makes a subsitution with Abdelhamid Sabiri (Huddersfield) coming on for Alex Pritchard.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) receives a precise pass and tries his luck with a low shot from mid range. The ball glances off the left-hand post and behind the surprised goalkeeper.

Moritz Bauer (Stoke City) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Substitution. Jonathan Hogg makes way for Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield).
