Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) lets fly with a crisp shot from inside the box after picking up a lofted pass from Pablo Zabaleta, but the ball goes just over the bar.
James Collins (West Ham) sees a yellow card from Martin Atkinson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Lewis Cook (Bournemouth) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) for a tough tackle.
Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Atkinson ignores the protests.
Today's referee Martin Atkinson rightly decides to book Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) for his harsh tackle.
Today's match ends for Jordon Ibe who will be replaced by Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth).
David William Moyes decides to make a substitution. Manuel Lanzini will be replaced by Chicharito (West Ham).
Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) has a great chance inside the box and fires the ball inside the left post.
Goal! Chicharito (West Ham) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.

Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and smashes a glorious looking effort towards the right side of the goal, but Adrian thwarts him with a great two-handed save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Bournemouth will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Substitution. Joshua King (Bournemouth) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Ryan Fraser walks off.
Substitution. Cheikhou Kouyate will be replaced by Declan Rice (West Ham).
Aaron Cresswell is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Samuel Byram (West Ham).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) passes the ball into the box but an opposing player clears.
Goal! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the middle of the net.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) and Michy Batshuayi combine well with a quick one-two to trick their opponent.
Goal! Great play by Michy Batshuayi releases Willian (Chelsea) in space on the edge of the box. He spots the keeper off his line and coolly puts the ball into the right side of the goal. 0:2.

Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) cuts inside his marker and unleashes a rocket of a shot from inside the box. The ball flies towards the roof of the net, but it's kept out by magnificent save from Mathew Ryan. Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

> peeled away from his marker and got on the end of a cross inside the box. He attempted to head the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the keeper made a block. The ball goes out of play. Brighton are awarded a corner kick.
The referee cannot ignore such behaviour. Ezequiel Schelotto (Brighton) sees a yellow card and needs to watch himself for the rest of the game.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Davy Propper (Brighton) leaps high to meet a lofted pass around the penalty spot, but his header crashes against the right post!
It's like he was asking for a caution. Shane Duffy (Brighton) receives a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. David Luiz (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Andreas Christensen.
Willian (Chelsea) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.

Wilfredo Caballero makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Ezequiel Schelotto (Brighton) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Biram Kayal (Brighton) will replace Pascal Gross.
Chris Hughton decides to make a substitution. Tomer Hemed will be replaced by Glenn Murray (Brighton).
Antonio Conte has decided to make a change. Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) replaces Marcos Alonso.

Eden Hazard (Chelsea) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Mathew Ryan is just a bystander as the ball flies into the left side of the goal. The score is 0:3.
Connor Goldson (Brighton) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Charly Junior Musonda (Chelsea) comes onto the pitch so that Willian can be given a rest.
Chris Hughton has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) replacing Solomon March.
Goal! Charly Junior Musonda sends a precise cross into the box, Victor Moses (Chelsea) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:4.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Paul Pogba slips it to Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) on the edge of the box and he finds the top left corner with a great effort. The score is 1:0.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) unleashes a sweet first-timer from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal. The goalkeeper stops the shot with a quick save.

Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Manchester Utd.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. Stoke force their opponents to concede a corner.

It's in! Paul Pogba spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Anthony Martial (Manchester United) doesn't think twice and curls a first-time shot into the top right corner. The score is now 2:0.

What a chance that is! Kurt Zouma (Stoke City) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Manchester Utd.
Chance! Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the bottom right corner, but David de Gea is alert and makes a great save to deny him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Anthony Taylor starts the second half.
Eddie Niedzwiecki has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Kevin Wimmer (Stoke City) comes on the pitch for Josh Tymon.

He should have scored! Anthony Martial (Manchester United) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal is pretty weak and Jack Butland makes an easy save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Maxim Choupo-Moting as he is replaced by Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City).

Big chance! A simple pass from Jesse Lingard left Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) with just the keeper to beat inside the box, but his shot went agonisingly just past the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stoke.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) was quite harsh and Anthony Taylor didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
A yellow card for bad language! Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) couldn’t remain silent and the result is obvious.
Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Peter Crouch leaves the pitch and Mame Diouf (Stoke City) comes on.
Fantastic team goal! Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) was set free in the area by Anthony Martial and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 3:0.
The game has come to an end for Anthony Martial. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) replacing Jesse Lingard.
A substitution has been made. Juan Manuel Mata is replaced by Scott McTominay (Manchester United).
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Jack Butland was alert and made an amazing save!

A nice lofted cross finds Mame Diouf (Stoke City) unmarked and he displays an excellent touch to control the ball. Mame Diouf (Stoke City) drills a low shot towards the middle of the net, but doesn't give the goalkeeper anything to worry about. An easy save.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) misses the left post by a whisker with a close-range rebound. What a chance that was! The ball goes out of play and Manchester Utd will have a goal kick.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

Goal! Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Ederson had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:0.
Pep Guardiola is forced to make a change. Fabian Delph is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Danilo (Manchester City).
Leroy Sane (Manchester City) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Loris Karius with a strike into the left side of the goal. He makes it 1:1.
Andre Marriner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless. The ball goes out of play and Liverpool will have a goal kick.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom left corner is thwarted by Ederson. Liverpool have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

That was absolutely fantastic! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) tries his luck with a hammer shot from long range, but his effort only rattles the crossbar! Here is an example of luck not being on your side.
GOAL - 2:1! Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain found Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Ederson off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) receives a yellow card for infringement.

What a great touch by Sadio Mane (Liverpool)! He picks up a precise pass on the edge of the box and immediately unleashes a shot on goal. His effort, however, only rattles the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Goal! Mohamed Salah plays a short, square pass into the path of Sadio Mane (Liverpool), who bends a shot straight into the top left corner to make it 3:1. Fabulous goal!
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) collects a ball that was parried far away from the box and immediately strikes it beyond the keeper. It's a spectacular goal!
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Raheem Sterling (Manchester City), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Here is a change. Raheem Sterling is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Bernardo Silva (Manchester City).
The foul by Fernandinho (Manchester City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.
We are about to witness a substitution. James Milner (Liverpool) is replacing Emre Can.
Goal! Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 4:2.
It is time for a substitution. Adam Lallana (Liverpool) is on for Mohamed Salah.
Goal! Sergio Aguero sends a precise cross into the box, Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 4:3.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to James Milner (Liverpool) for a tough tackle.
Here comes a substitution. Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) is brought on as a substitute for Sadio Mane.

Kevin De Bruyne delivers a perfect cross for Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who has simple job scoring from close range but somehow contrives to send the ball just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Liverpool will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.

OFF THE BAR! Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball crashes against the crossbar.
Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Simon Francis (Bournemouth) for a heavy challenge.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Asmir Begovic is alert and denies him.

Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) beats his marker in the air and aims a header at goal from the free kick, but the close-range effort flashes just past the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bournemouth.

Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Bournemouth win a corner.
Kevin Friend has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.

Goal! Alex Iwobi produces a great pass that finds Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 0:1.
The foul by Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Kevin Friend.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) comes onto the pitch for Charlie Daniels.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Ryan Fraser, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:1.
Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) sees a yellow card from Kevin Friend after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Calum Chambers trots off the pitch and is replaced by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal).
Goal! Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the back of the net. Callum Wilson assisted in the goal. 2:1.
Steve Bould has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Theo Walcott (Arsenal) replacing Alex Iwobi.
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Jordon Ibe and he is replaced by Marc Pugh (Bournemouth).
Eddie Howe prepares a substitution. Callum Wilson is replaced by Benik Afobe (Bournemouth).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Wayne Rooney (Everton) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) strikes the ball towards goal from the middle of the penalty area, but his shot goes straight into the gloves of the goalkeeper.
Goal! Serge Aurier puts the ball across the area and Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 1:0.
Phil Jagielka (Everton) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
It's in the back of the net! Heung-Min Son sprays a pass out to Harry Kane (Tottenham), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Everton.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Yannick Bolasie walks off the pitch to be replaced by Aaron Lennon (Everton).
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) has a sight of goal and fires from the edge of the box, but his strike rattles the left post!
Goal - 3:0! Eric Dier laid the ball off to Harry Kane (Tottenham), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Today's match ends for Cenk Tosun who will be replaced by Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton).
It is time for a substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) is on for James McCarthy.
Mauricio Pochettino prepares a substitution. Eric Dier is replaced by Victor Wanyama (Tottenham).
This is a yellow card! Wayne Rooney (Everton) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.

Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but Jordan Pickford shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Goal - 4:0! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the left post. Dele Alli provided an assist for the goal.
The referee signals a substitution. Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Mousa Dembele.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Erik Lamela (Tottenham) is coming onto the pitch as Christian Eriksen cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.

Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) was about to celebrate after he was first to the rebound and produced a header from a difficult position inside the box, but Thibaut Courtois managed to pull off a magnificent save to stop the ball from ending up inside the bottom left corner.
Matthew James (Leicester) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mike Jones didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Gary Cahill is being substituted because of an injury. Antonio Conte sends Andreas Christensen (Chelsea) on the pitch.

Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) beats his marker and unleashes a thunderbolt of a shot from the edge of the box. Kasper Schmeichel sees the ball late but does well to stop it going into the roof of the net. Good work from Chelsea as they win a corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Mike Jones has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mike Jones had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Cesc Fabregas is replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Here is a change. Eden Hazard is going off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical orders to Pedro (Chelsea).
Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) for his blatant foul.
Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) is penalised.
The match has ended for Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) as he picks up his second yellow card and referee Mike Jones pulls out a red card!
That's the end of the game for Shinji Okazaki, who is replaced by Christian Fuchs (Leicester).
Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea) takes the rebound on the edge of the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
Substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) on for Jamie Vardy.
Mike Jones shows the yellow card to Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) for a heavy challenge.
Claude Puel prepares a substitution. Matthew James is replaced by Iborra (Leicester).
Mike Jones is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Nick Pope is just a bystander as the ball flies into the top right corner. The score is 1:0.
Tempers flare after Steven Defour (Burnley) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Sean Dyche has decided to make a change. Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Burnley) replaces Jeff Hendrick.
Phillip Bardsley (Burnley) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Charlie Taylor (Burnley) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Substitution. Johann Gudmundsson will be replaced by Nahki Wells (Burnley).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Mark Noble (West Ham) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the right post. He makes it 0:1.
Tom Smith (Huddersfield) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Joe Lolley (Huddersfield) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Adrian with a strike into the left side of the goal. He makes it 1:1.
Jonathan Moss has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Jonas Lossl is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:2.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) meets a cross on the edge of the box and produces a header towards the right side of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
Goal! Marko Arnautovic displays great vision and sends a pass to Manuel Lanzini (West Ham), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 1:3.

Substitution. Alex Pritchard (Huddersfield) on for Joe Lolley.
The game has come to an end for Tom Smith. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Terence Kongolo (Huddersfield).
Alex Pritchard (Huddersfield) misses a promising chance to score from the free kick, but Adrian makes a decent save.
Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) picks up a yellow card.
David William Moyes has decided to make a change. Andre Ayew (West Ham) replaces Marko Arnautovic.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Manuel Lanzini trots off the pitch and is replaced by Declan Rice (West Ham).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.

Kyle Bartley (Swansea) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
A goal, which was scored by Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd), was disallowed due to offside.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Carlos Carvalhal prepares a substitution. Mike van der Hoorn is replaced by Connor Roberts (Swansea).

Alfie Mawson (Swansea) receives a yellow card from the referee, but it seems like a very harsh decision.

Daryl Janmaat (Watford) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the roof of the net. Alex McCarthy has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Watford get a corner.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner in trademark fashion.
Heurelho Gomes makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the right-hand post by Shane Long (Southampton) after a cross from the side.
A yellow card for a tackle by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton). Roger East doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

What a chance! Shane Long (Southampton) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance. Southampton will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Marco Silva decides to make a substitution. Tom Cleverley will be replaced by Roberto Pereyra (Watford).
Goal! Dusan Tadic tees up James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to score low into the middle of the goal. 0:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Marco Silva has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Troy Deeney (Watford) comes on the pitch for Ben Watson.

Daryl Janmaat (Watford) latches on to a pin-point pass on the edge of the box and fires the ball into the roof of the net, but an amazing dive from the goalkeeper denies him. The strike bounces off his gloves and crashes against the bar!
Andre Gray (Watford) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the bottom right corner, and thus alter the score to 1:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mario Lemina (Southampton) comes onto the pitch for Steven Davis.
That's the end of the game for Andre Gray, who is replaced by Stefano Okaka (Watford).

Booking. Cedric Soares (Southampton) receives a caution from the referee.

The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Solomon March (Brighton) is coming onto the pitch as Jose Izquierdo cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the top right corner. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Craig Dawson (West Brom) has a reason to celebrate!
It is time for a substitution. Sam Baldock (Brighton) is on for Pascal Gross.

The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Michael Dean blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Andre Ayew (West Ham) has come on for Chicharito.

What a beautiful moment! Pedro Obiang (West Ham) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top left corner. Hugo Lloris just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:1.
Here's the change. Moussa Sissoko leaves the pitch and Erik Lamela (Tottenham) comes on as a substitute.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) replacing Eric Dier.

Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) received a brilliant pass and arrowed the ball into the top right corner. It couldn't have gone in a better place, what a beautiful long-range goal.

Andrew Carroll (West Ham) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Mark Noble (West Ham) gets a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
What a big chance! Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!

Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box to the bottom right corner, but Thibaut Courtois shows his agility and makes a save. The ball goes out of play. Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.
Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
Good team movement sets up Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) for his blatant foul.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes just over the bar.
The end of the first half.
Anthony Taylor blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Victor Moses (Chelsea) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Petr Cech inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the bottom left corner, but was denied by a great save. Chelsea earn a corner.

Thibaut Courtois was forced into action to thwart Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. The linesman makes the right call and Arsenal will have a corner.
Rob Holding (Arsenal) earns the yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) is coming onto the pitch as Victor Moses cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Goal! Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) latches on to a superb pass inside the box, finds himself in a promising position and fires a shot in off the inside of the left post. The goalkeeper was helpless to keep out his effort.

Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) beats the defender inside the box and lashes a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Thibaut Courtois makes a brilliant reflex save to deny him. Goalkeeping at its best! Arsenal get a corner.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Anthony Taylor blows his whistle for a foul. Penalty awarded! Chelsea will take a penalty kick.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) is yellow-carded.
Goal! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Petr Cech to commit before slotting the penalty into the left of the goal.
What a miss! Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
The substitution has been made. Daniel Drinkwater (Chelsea) has replaced Cesc Fabregas.
Half-chance! Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) plays a pass into the box, but Petr Cech reacts well to snuff out the attack.
Alexandre Lacazette goes off the pitch and Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) comes on.
Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Eden Hazard is replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) unleashes a quick low drive into the middle of the net and past the goalkeeper. Here is an example of luck being on your side.
We are about to witness a substitution. Theo Walcott (Arsenal) is replacing Calum Chambers.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) receives a yellow card!

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the left post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Thibaut Courtois, so the score changes to 2:2.
Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) gets inside the penalty area and sends a powerful shot that almost ends inside the net. The keeper is alert and makes a good save.
Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) hits the crossbar with a rebound from just outside the box.
That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Leroy Sane, then sends the ball inside the right post. 1:0.
Good chance! Leroy Sane laid the ball off to John Stones (Manchester City) inside the box, he ducked inside his man and rifled a shot in at goal that skimmed the top of the bar.
This is definitely not what Christian Kabasele (Watford) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 2:0.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) fires the ball from the free kick and it smashes against the crossbar!
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to David Silva (Manchester City) for a tough tackle.

Andre Gray (Watford) collects a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a low drive to the middle, but Ederson makes a save. The ball is out of play. Watford will have a chance to score from a corner.
Heurelho Gomes pulls off a great save to deny Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Lee Mason has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Kevin De Bruyne plays a short lofted pass to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), whose header from the centre of the box drifts well past the left post.
That's the end of the game for Etienne Capoue, who is replaced by Tom Cleverley (Watford).
Marco Silva decides to make a substitution. Ben Watson will be replaced by Roberto Pereyra (Watford).
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 3:0.

The manager makes a subsitution with Yaya Toure (Manchester City) coming on for Fernandinho.

A yellow card for a tackle by Roberto Pereyra (Watford). Lee Mason doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
A pass into the box finds Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Heurelho Gomes denies him.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Shane Long (Southampton) latched on to a sweet pass and coolly slotted the ball inside the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Stuart Attwell blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Roy Hodgson probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Yohan Cabaye. He is replaced by Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace).
A yellow card for a tackle by Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Crystal Palace). Stuart Attwell doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) is coming onto the pitch as Jeffery Schlupp cannot continue after picking up an injury.

What a wasted opportunity by Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom right corner, but Alex McCarthy makes an astonishing save to thwart him.

A superb goal from great team play! James McArthur (Crystal Palace) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from James Ward-Prowse as he is replaced by Steven Davis (Southampton).

Oriol Romeu (Southampton) watches the corner all the way, but places his header a whisker wide of the right post from close range.
A lofted pass finds Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) free in the box, but his first-time effort sails high over the bar.
That's all for today as the game is over.

Martin Olsson (Swansea) has tested the patience of referee Robert Madley and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Fernando Llorente (Tottenham) celebrates a beautiful goal. He wins the ball inside the box from the free kick and plants a header inside the left post. 0:1.

CHANCE! Nathan Dyer (Swansea) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
The game has come to an end for Nathan Dyer. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Oliver McBurnie (Swansea).

Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and fires in from the penalty spot, but his effort zooms just past the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Swansea.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) smashes the ball upfield and Dele Alli brings it down with a fine first touch. Dele Alli (Tottenham) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Lukasz Fabianski thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Goal! Dele Alli (Tottenham) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 0:2.

The first half of this match is about to start.
Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) for a tough tackle.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) is unlucky with a low drive from the edge of the box. A decent save by Ben Foster stops the ball from hitting the middle of the net.
James McClean (West Brom) rounds off a sensational solo effort with a shot from about 20 metres out. The ball slams under the crossbar, leaving the goalkeeper beaten. The score sheet now reads 0:1.

Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and produces a low shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
CHANCE! Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) receives a brilliant pass and finds himself one-on-one with Ben Foster, who reacts superbly to stop him.
Mike Jones shows the yellow card to Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) for a heavy challenge.

David William Moyes makes a switch. Mark Noble (West Ham) is coming on in place of Pedro Obiang at the start of the second period.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went inches over the bar.

GOAL! Aaron Cresswell produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Andrew Carroll (West Ham) rises high to head the ball into the bottom right corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:1.
A yellow card for a tackle by Andrew Carroll (West Ham). Mike Jones doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
It will be a substitution. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) is ready to enter the pitch as Jake Livermore walks off.

Goal! Marko Arnautovic displays great vision and sends a pass to Andrew Carroll (West Ham), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:1.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) is given a yellow card.
