What a goal-scoring opportunity! Oumar Niasse (Everton) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in. It will be a corner kick for Everton.
A yellow card for a tackle by Wayne Rooney (Everton). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Manchester Utd earn a free kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 23 metres out. Jordan Pickford pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the top of the net. Manchester Utd will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) fires a brilliant shot in from 25 metres out, but the effort rattles the left post! It could have been a superb goal.

Brilliant finish! Anthony Martial (Manchester United) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Paul Pogba, then produced a nice strike into the right side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
Today's match ends for Yannick Bolasie who will be replaced by Aaron Lennon (Everton).
Samuel Allardyce prepares a substitution. Wayne Rooney is replaced by James McCarthy (Everton).

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Jordan Pickford makes a great save to deny his effort directed under the crossbar. Manchester Utd get a corner.
Oumar Niasse (Everton) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Anthony Martial walks off the pitch to be replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).

Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom right corner, but Jordan Pickford has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. Manchester Utd have been awarded a corner kick.

Lovely run from Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) who weaves his way through the defence and takes a shot from the edge of the box that goes inside the right post! What an amazing goal ladies and gentlemen!
Substitution. Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) has come on for Oumar Niasse.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Mason Holgate (Everton) for his blatant foul.
Jose Mourinho decides to make a substitution. Jesse Lingard will be replaced by Daley Blind (Manchester United).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Axel Tuanzebe (Manchester United) is coming onto the pitch as Juan Manuel Mata cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Simon Mignolet, who pulls off a stunning save!
What a chance that is! Scott Arfield (Burnley) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! That is a fantastic finish by Sadio Mane (Liverpool) from just outside the box. He wastes little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flies past the goalkeeper into the top of the net.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jeff Hendrick as he is replaced by Sam Vokes (Burnley).
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Sadio Mane is replaced by Roberto Firmino (Liverpool).

Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 24 metres out. Nick Pope stops the effort which is headed for the top right corner. Corner kick. Liverpool will have an opportunity.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads inside the right post, but Nick Pope shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.

Sam Vokes (Burnley) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom left corner. Simon Mignolet shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nahki Wells (Burnley) replacing Scott Arfield.
Substitution. Adam Lallana leaves the pitch and is replaced by James Milner (Liverpool).
GOAL! Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) scores with a header from close range after Sam Vokes headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 1:1.
GOAL 1:2! The resulting free kick is headed powerfully goalwards by Dejan Lovren and Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) glances a header from close range into the back of the net.
The manager makes a subsitution with Joel Matip (Liverpool) coming on for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Wes Morgan (Leicester) was quite harsh and Graham Scott didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Claude Puel is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Wes Morgan suffers an injury and Aleksandar Dragovic (Leicester) comes on.
What a sensational goal that would have been! Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.

Islam Slimani (Leicester) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Jonas Lossl, who pulls off a comfortable save!
What a hit! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the left post. 1:0.
Goal disallowed! Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) scores but Graham Scott blows his whistle for a foul.
David Wagner has decided to make a change. Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) replaces Joe Lolley.
Islam Slimani (Leicester) bursts into the box after a great solo run and gets one-on-one with the keeper, who he neatly side steps and rolls the ball into an empty net. Wonderful effort!
Substitution. Chris Lowe makes way for Scott Malone (Huddersfield).
Here is a change. Riyad Mahrez is going off and Claude Puel gives the last tactical orders to Demarai Gray (Leicester).
The referee signals a substitution. Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) is brought on as a substitute for Tom Smith.
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar!
Scott Malone (Huddersfield) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Adrien Silva (Leicester) will replace Matthew James.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Marc Albrighton (Leicester) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Goal! Marc Albrighton (Leicester) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 3:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd) controls a nice lofted pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but his attempt only went low to the middle of the goal, so Jack Butland stops it easily. Newcastle have been awarded a corner kick.
Javier Manquillo (Newcastle Utd) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Stoke couldn't find the way to score from a mid-range free kick as Karl Darlow (Newcastle Utd) leaped high and intercepted the cross. Stoke win a corner.
Ciaran Clark (Newcastle Utd) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

A sweet pass finds Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the top right corner. Karl Darlow is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. The ball is out of play. Stoke win a corner kick.
Joe Allen (Stoke City) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Xherdan Shaqiri walks off the pitch and Mame Diouf (Stoke City) comes on as a substitute.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Chris Kavanagh and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Christian Atsu will be replaced by Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd).
Kevin Wimmer (Stoke City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Chris Kavanagh had an easy-decision to make.
Erik Pieters just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Saido Berahino (Stoke City) replaces him.
Goal Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd)! Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) was put through by Jacob Murphy and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the top of the net. 0:1.

Karl Darlow makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Mame Diouf (Stoke City) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the right side of the target.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) will replace Jacob Murphy.
Today's match ends for Ayoze Perez who will be replaced by Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd).
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar.

Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Jack Butland pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! Jose Izquierdo feeds Anthony Knockaert (Brighton), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 1:0.
Superb touch by Glenn Murray (Brighton) as he receives a precise pass inside the box. He finds the keeper prepared as he unleashes his shot to the left side of the goal. Wonderful save!

Steve Cook (Bournemouth) displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header home from close range after a fine cross following the corner kick. The ball bounces in off the inside of the left post. He alters the score – 1:1.

Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Mathew Ryan makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.
What a sweet touch by Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Asmir Begovic to hold.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.
It's in the back of the net! Jose Izquierdo sprays a pass out to Glenn Murray (Brighton), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:1.
Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. If it wasn't for Mathew Ryan's superb save the ball would have probably ended up in the bottom right corner.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Shane Duffy (Brighton) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. The strike heads towards the middle of the target, but it's deflected away thanks to a brilliant intervention by one of the defenders.
The referee signals a substitution. Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) is brought on as a substitute for Marc Pugh.
Substitution. Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Benik Afobe walks off.

Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to rifle a shot low into the middle of the goal, but Asmir Begovic makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Harry Arter leaves the pitch and Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) comes on.

Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) didn't hesitate to shoot from around the penalty spot and aimed towards the bottom left corner. Asmir Begovic was alert, made a superb save and parried the ball onto the post. The linesman makes the right call and Brighton will have a corner.
Chris Hughton is forced to make a change. Ezequiel Schelotto is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Bruno Saltor (Brighton).
Goal! Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Davy Propper (Brighton) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Simon Francis (Bournemouth) for his blatant foul.
Pascal Gross comes off the pitch to be replaced by Isaiah Brown (Brighton).
Glenn Murray (Brighton) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
CHANCE! Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) fires just over the crossbar from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Alexis Sanchez.

A sweet pass finds Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the left side of the goal. Ben Foster is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. The ball is out of play. Arsenal will have a chance to score from a corner.
Yellow card. Jonny Evans (West Brom) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Arsene Wenger is forced to make a change. Sead Kolasinac is unable to continue due to injury, Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal) comes on.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Michael Dean blows his whistle to start the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Ben Foster thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Alexis Sanchez rounds off a good move with a layoff to Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) inside the box, he has a clear sight of goal but sends the ball just wide of the left post.
Per Mertesacker (Arsenal) comes onto the pitch after Laurent Koscielny signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Alan Pardew has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) replacing Chris Brunt.
Substitution. Matt Phillips makes his way off the pitch and James McClean (West Brom) comes on as his replacement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) will replace Alex Iwobi.
Alan Pardew has decided to substitute Hal Robson-Kanu and he is replaced by Allan Nyom (West Brom).

Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the left side of the goal, but Petr Cech made an astonishing save!
Craig Dawson (West Brom) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
James McClean (West Brom) scores an unfortunate own goal after deflecting the ball into his own net!
Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) goes into the book for bad language. His vulgar comments could have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's a yellow card.
Goal! Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) puts the penalty low into the middle of the goal and past Petr Cech.
That's the end of the match.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Petr Cech (Arsenal) for his unsportsmanlike behavior after the match has ended.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out for a corner. Crystal Palace can continue in their attacking effort.

Good work from Crystal Palace as they win a corner. Ederson earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a first-time long-range effort towards the right post. Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) has tested the patience of referee Jonathan Moss and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Scott Dann is substituted due to injury. Roy Hodgson gives a chance to Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace).
Pep Guardiola is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Gabriel Jesus suffers an injury and Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) comes on.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the left post.
A big opportunity missed by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City). He got on the ball inside the box and thumped a splendid first-time shot on goal, but it went narrowly wide of the right post.
Leroy Sane (Manchester City) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Jonathan Moss starts the second half.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) for his blatant foul.
Kevin De Bruyne picks out Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box.
It will be a substitution. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) is ready to enter the pitch as Ilkay Gundogan walks off.

Leroy Sane (Manchester City) gets on the end of a cross and unleashes an explosive shot at goal from close range, but Wayne Hennessey makes a fine one-handed save to deny him. The ball is out of play. Manchester City will have a chance to score from a corner.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yohan Cabaye.
Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Bernardo Silva goes off the pitch and Yaya Toure (Manchester City) comes on.
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jonathan Moss had an easy-decision to make.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.

Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot low into the middle of the goal. Ederson anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and doesn't have to move to stop the effort.
Yellow card. Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) for his blatant foul.
Roy Hodgson is forced to make a change. Jason Puncheon is unable to continue due to injury, Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) comes on.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a wasted chance that is! A precise cross into the box found Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United), whose header floated just over the bar.

A pass travels right across the box to James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper in the bottom right corner, but David de Gea denies him with a decent save.
Jose Mourinho is forced to make a change. Romelu Lukaku is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).

James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for David de Gea to dive and make a save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Southampton.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Well-positioned Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Alex McCarthy reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!
Wesley Hoedt (Southampton) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Shane Long (Southampton) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at David de Gea, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him. Good work from Southampton as they win a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton). Craig Pawson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Today's referee Craig Pawson rightly decides to book Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) for his harsh tackle.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan is replaced by Anthony Martial (Manchester United).
Nemanja Matic (Manchester United) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Craig Pawson ignores the protests.
Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Shane Long.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Mauricio Pellegrino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mario Lemina (Southampton) replacing Dusan Tadic.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Sofiane Boufal as he is replaced by Nathan Redmond (Southampton).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Jordan Pickford pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.

Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) meets a perfect cross from Joshua King deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
Eddie Howe is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Joshua King suffers an injury and Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) comes on.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Samuel Allardyce makes a half-time substitution. Wayne Rooney (Everton) comes on in place of James McCarthy.
Substitution. Oumar Niasse (Everton) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Dominic Calvert-Lewin walks off.
Oumar Niasse feeds the ball through to Idrissa Gueye (Everton), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Jordan Pickford is alert and denies him.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) tries to find Benik Afobe, but he puts too much power on the through ball.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yannick Bolasie (Everton) comes onto the pitch so that Idrissa Gueye can be given a rest.
Eddie Howe has decided to make a change. Harry Arter (Bournemouth) replaces Lewis Cook.

Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Jordan Pickford makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.
Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Callum Wilson walks off the pitch to be replaced by Lys Mousset (Bournemouth).
Goal! Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Willian picks out Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) in the box with a decent cross, and he scores in the bottom left corner with a header from close range. 1:0.
Goal! Daniel Drinkwater (Chelsea) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top right corner. It's 2:0.
Goal! Willian plays a short, square pass into the path of Pedro (Chelsea), who bends a shot straight into the bottom left corner to make it 3:0. Fabulous goal!
This is a yellow card! Mame Diouf (Stoke City) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Saido Berahino (Stoke City) latches onto a cross inside the box and aims a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Thibaut Courtois reacts superbly to deny him.
Pedro (Chelsea) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Substitution. Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) replaces Victor Moses.

Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save! The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Chelsea will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Here is a change. N'Golo Kante is going off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical orders to Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea).
Today's match ends for Alvaro Morata who will be replaced by Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea).
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Ibrahim Afellay and he is replaced by Julien Ngoy (Stoke City).

Referee Kevin Friend sees the trip by Geoff Cameron (Stoke City) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. PENALTY! One of the players from Chelsea is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Goal! Willian (Chelsea) calmly steps up and smashes the ball low into the middle of the goal.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Charles Graham Adam will be replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City).

Goal! Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Jack Butland is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 5:0.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Mathias Jorgensen (Huddersfield) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Steven Defour (Burnley) is lurking on the edge of the box and receives a pass from Johann Gudmundsson. He shows nice control before hitting a soft shot just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
David Wagner has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Tom Smith (Huddersfield) comes on the pitch for Florent Hadergjonaj.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Tom Ince as he is replaced by Joe Lolley (Huddersfield).
The game has come to an end for Jeff Hendrick. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sam Vokes (Burnley).
The whistle blows and Ben Mee (Burnley) is booked for an infringement.
Sean Dyche decides to make a substitution. Ashley Barnes will be replaced by Nahki Wells (Burnley).
Substitution. Collin Quaner is replaced by Daniel Williams (Huddersfield).
Joe Lolley (Huddersfield) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
A great team effort had put Jamie Vardy (Leicester) one-on-one with the goallkeeper and he smashed the ball into the top of the net.

A great pass puts Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hits his shot against the left post. The ball goes out of play and Leicester will have a goal kick.
It must be a yellow card. It is. James Milner (Liverpool) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Sadio Mane (Liverpool) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

Close! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Leicester.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle to start the second half.

An amazing individual effort from Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball low into the middle of the goal and makes it 1:1. Kasper Schmeichel was helpless.
Harry Maguire (Leicester) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Emre Can (Liverpool) is awarded a yellow card for a sharp discussion with the referee. He should relax or he could be sent off.
What a big chance! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Leicester will have a goal kick.
Yellow card. Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
A goal, which was scored by Sadio Mane (Liverpool), was disallowed due to offside.
Substitution. Sadio Mane walks off the pitch and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. Riyad Mahrez is going off and Claude Puel gives the last tactical orders to Shinji Okazaki (Leicester).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jamie Vardy will be replaced by Islam Slimani (Leicester).
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
Today's match ends for Mohamed Salah who will be replaced by Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool).
Claude Puel has decided to substitute Marc Albrighton and he is replaced by Matthew James (Leicester).
Substitution. Philippe Coutinho makes his way off the pitch and Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) comes on as his replacement.
Andrew Robertson (Liverpool) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Neil Swarbrick had an easy-decision to make.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Anthony Taylor has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Mathew Ryan shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
DeAndre Yedlin (Newcastle Utd) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Chris Hughton prepares a substitution. Glenn Murray is replaced by Tomer Hemed (Brighton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Matt Ritchie departs the field of play to be replaced by Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd).
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) for his blatant foul.
Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
That will be all from Mikel Merino who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd).
Here's the change. Joselu leaves the pitch and Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd) comes on as a substitute.
Yellow card. Lewis Dunk (Brighton) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) tries his luck with a shot from long range, and his superb effort rattles the crossbar!

Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a great save to deny Richarlison (Watford) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Andre Carrillo (Watford) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball inside the left post, and thus alter the score to 1:0.
Andre Carrillo (Watford) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Thomas Carroll (Swansea) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Martin Atkinson has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Carlos Carvalhal makes a half-time substitution. Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) comes on in place of Roque Mesa.
Substitution. Tammy Abraham makes his way off the pitch and Oliver McBurnie (Swansea) comes on as his replacement.
Marco Silva prepares a substitution. Molla Wague is replaced by Sebastian Prodl (Watford).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Andre Gray (Watford) for Stefano Okaka.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Carlos Carvalhal has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nathan Dyer (Swansea) replacing Sam Clucas.
Sebastian Prodl (Watford) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Here comes a substitution. Roberto Pereyra (Watford) is brought on as a substitute for Andre Carrillo.
Andre Gray (Watford) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Lukasz Fabianski is alert and denies him.
Goal! Oliver McBurnie puts the ball across the area and Jordan Ayew (Swansea) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 1:1.
Yellow card. Marvin Zeegelaar (Watford) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Nathan Dyer (Swansea) collects a rebound a long way out and doesn't hesitate to release a goal-bound hammer of a shot. His attempt is precise and low towards the bottom left corner. It would have ended in the back of the net if it wasn't for Heurelho Gomes and his brilliant save.
Goal! Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:2.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

A cross from the side line is well received by Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) who doesn't hesitate to slam it goalwards. And his long-range effort wasn't poor at all. It attracted the keeper's attention as it missed the left post only by a whisker.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) smashes a first-time shot a goal from inside the box, but it's bravely blocked by a defender.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) produces a good strike that sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows great reflexes and dives to keep the effort from hitting the net.
A shot is blocked but the rebound lands at the feet of Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) who fires the ball into the back of the net.
Calum Chambers (Arsenal) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Unbelievable! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) wastes a huge scoring opportunity! He finds himself unmarked right in front of goal and fires in a first-time shot. Julian Speroni pulls off one of the best saves of his career and stops the effort from hitting the net.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) easily beats an opponent inside the box and goes for goal, but his effort flies just wide of the right post.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the right side of the target, but Julian Speroni easily deals with the threat.
The end of the first half.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) picks up a yellow card for unsporting behaviour after the half-time whistle. He should have gone straight into the dressing room instead.
The second half gets underway.
Fantastic team goal! Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) was set free in the area by Wilfried Zaha and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 1:1.
It will be a substitution. James McArthur (Crystal Palace) is ready to enter the pitch as Yohan Cabaye walks off.
Alexandre Lacazette feeds the ball through to Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:2!
Jack Wilshere sends a lovely ball into Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal). He latches on to it and shoots inside the left post from the edge of the box. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:3.
Ruben Loftus-Cheek comes off the pitch to be replaced by Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace).
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) replaces Alexandre Lacazette.
Substitution. Martin Kelly walks off the pitch and Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Crystal Palace) comes on as a substitute.
A pass into the box finds Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Julian Speroni denies him.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post.
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Granit Xhaka will be replaced by Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal).

James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the right side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 2:3.
Michael Oliver is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) gathers a cross inside the box and strikes the ball. He wastes a great scoring opportunity as his shot only hits the right-hand post.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.
Pep Guardiola is forced to make a change. Vincent Kompany is unable to continue due to injury, Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) comes on.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt to the middle of the target fails to beat Rob Elliot, who makes a sensational save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Manchester City.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Rob Elliot. Good work from Manchester City as they win a corner.

What a chance that is! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.

Kevin De Bruyne sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot which hits the bottom of the left post and bounces in off it. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 0:1.

Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) controls a cross inside the box and sends a shot towards the roof of the net, but one of the defenders reacts superbly to block his effort. The ball is out of play. Newcastle win a corner kick.

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Manchester City will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
A pass into the box finds Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) unmarked. He carefully places a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Rob Elliot denies him.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the right post.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) connects with a pass inside the box, but his effort goes well wide of the left post.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Joselu walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd).

OFF THE POST! Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Rolando Aarons comes off the pitch to be replaced by Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd).
Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) replaces Sergio Aguero.
Rafael Benitez has decided to make a change. Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd) replaces Chancel Mbemba.
Here comes a substitution. Bernardo Silva is given a rest as he is replaced by Leroy Sane (Manchester City).
Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Mohamed Salah passes to Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Roberto Firmino (Liverpool). This could have been a legendary goal. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Swansea.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) takes a great first touch inside the box after the free kick, wins himself some space and beats the goalkeeper with an accurate strike low into the middle of the target.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Martin Olsson (Swansea) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) blows a huge opportunity after receiving a cross from the free kick. He shoots from just outside of the box, but the ball goes narrowly wide of the right post! The ball goes out of play and Swansea will have a goal kick.
It is time for a substitution. Tammy Abraham (Swansea) is on for Oliver McBurnie.
Wonderful movement! Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) perfectly times his run onto a brilliant cross and smashes the ball from deep inside the box straight into the roof of the net. What a finish.
Leon Britton prepares a substitution. Roque Mesa is replaced by Sam Clucas (Swansea).
It's a goal! Mohamed Salah plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Roberto Firmino (Liverpool). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 4:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Roberto Firmino trots off the pitch and is replaced by Dominic Solanke (Liverpool).
The substitution is prepared. Adam Lallana (Liverpool) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mohamed Salah.
Substitution. James Milner (Liverpool) in, Andrew Robertson out.
Leroy Fer comes off the pitch to be replaced by Renato Sanches (Swansea).

What a wonderful finish! Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and smashes the ball inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.
A lofted pass into the box is met by Dominic Solanke (Liverpool), who rifles a shot just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Swansea.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
James Collins (West Ham) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 0:1.

Callum Wilson plays a lovely pass into Joshua King (Bournemouth), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and West Ham will have a goal kick.
Goal! Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Simon Francis (Bournemouth) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
What was Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Stuart Attwell has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
The booking goes to James Collins (West Ham).
Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and sends in a superb strike that finds its way into the bottom left corner.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) for Pedro Obiang.
David William Moyes prepares a substitution. Andre Ayew is replaced by Chicharito (West Ham).
Substitution. Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) has come on for Joshua King.
Lewis Cook (Bournemouth) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Stuart Attwell had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Pablo Zabaleta walks off the pitch and Declan Rice (West Ham) comes on as a substitute.
Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) latches on to a brilliant pass and hits a poor shot towards the middle of the goal, but the ball goes into the back of the net after the goalkeeper makes a howler!
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Ryan Fraser and he is replaced by Marc Pugh (Bournemouth).
Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Goal! 2:3. Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.
It's a goal! Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 3:3.
Stuart Attwell is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) runs onto a lofted ball into the box, but hits a weak shot towards the right side of the goal that is easily dealt with by Mathew Ryan.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Michael Dean starts the second half.

Goal! Cesar Azpilicueta hands Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Chance! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Tiemoue Bakayoko, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dale Stephens (Brighton). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top right corner only for Mathew Ryan to dive and make a save. Now Chelsea have a corner.
Gooal! Cesc Fabregas takes over corner duties. Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Biram Kayal goes off the pitch and Pascal Gross (Brighton) comes on.
Antonio Conte decides to make a substitution. Eden Hazard will be replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Substitution. Tomer Hemed will be replaced by Glenn Murray (Brighton).
That will be all from Solomon March who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Anthony Knockaert (Brighton).
Here is a change. Alvaro Morata is going off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical orders to Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea).
Here's the change. N'Golo Kante leaves the pitch and Daniel Drinkwater (Chelsea) comes on as a substitute.
Pascal Gross floats over the free kick into a crowded box. Shane Duffy (Brighton) does well to win the ball, but sends his header just wide of the right post from close in.
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Tom Ince (Huddersfield) collects a delightful pass inside the box and slashes the ball into the middle of the goal. What a clinical finish!
Jonas Lossl pulls off a fantastic reflex save to deny a powerful header from the corner kick by Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) towards the middle of the target.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) fails to score from the rebound as the goalkeeper stops his effort from hitting the net.
Substitution. Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) has come on for Ryan Shawcross.
Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) doesn't hesitate to shoot inside the box after a neat pass from Jonathan Hogg. It's a good effort but just misses the left post.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Good chance for Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the crossbar.
Unlucky! A great strike from Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) near the edge of the box had the keeper scrambling but flew just over the bar.
Christopher Schindler (Huddersfield) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Joe Allen finds Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Rajiv van La Parra trots off the pitch and is replaced by Joe Lolley (Huddersfield).
A substitution has been made. Steve Mounie is replaced by Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield).
Mark Hughes has decided to make a change. Mame Diouf (Stoke City) replaces Xherdan Shaqiri.
Geoff Cameron (Stoke City) sees a yellow card from Anthony Taylor after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Kurt Zouma (Stoke City), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Here comes a substitution. Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Darren Fletcher.
A yellow card for a tackle by Mame Diouf (Stoke City). Anthony Taylor doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
David Wagner prepares a substitution. Chris Lowe is replaced by Scott Malone (Huddersfield).
Mathias Jorgensen (Huddersfield) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Goal 0:1! Ashley Barnes (Burnley) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Martin Atkinson shows the yellow card to Ashley Barnes (Burnley) for a heavy challenge.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) wastes a huge chance as he sends a first-time shot from the goal area straight onto the crossbar! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Manchester Utd.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top right corner. His long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. Corner kick. Manchester Utd will have an opportunity.
A yellow card for a tackle by Charlie Taylor (Burnley). Martin Atkinson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Steven Defour (Burnley) takes a wonderful free kick and curls the ball into the top left corner with an absolutely phenomenal strike!

What a great touch by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes behind for a corner. Manchester Utd will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) gets a shot away from around 19 metres out after his fine solo run. The ball went just wide of the right post!
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The game is over for Zlatan Ibrahimovic. Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) comes on for the second half.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Marcos Rojo will be replaced by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United).
Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Nick Pope is alert and denies him.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Luke Shaw (Manchester United), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
GOAL! Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) finishes off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel goal. Ashley Young provided the assist with a brilliant pass. 1:2.
Booking. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) receives a caution from the referee.

The expression of the referee Martin Atkinson is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) is shown a yellow card. Manchester Utd are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Sean Dyche prepares a substitution. Steven Defour is replaced by Sam Vokes (Burnley).
The foul by Phillip Bardsley (Burnley) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson. Manchester Utd earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) takes the free kick and unleashes a strong shot from mid-range. Unfortunately for him, the ball curls inches over the crossbar. What a squandered chance!
Nick Pope (Burnley) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Martin Atkinson pulls out a yellow card.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Substitution. Jonathan Walters (Burnley) in, Ashley Barnes out.
Today's referee Martin Atkinson rightly decides to book Jack Cork (Burnley) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Harry Maguire (Leicester) picks up a yellow card.
Ben Watson (Watford) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Chris Kavanagh had an easy-decision to make.
Christian Kabasele (Watford) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.

Golden chance! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Watford.
Chris Kavanagh shows a yellow card to Aleksandar Dragovic (Leicester) for his blatant foul.
It's a goal! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Marc Albrighton and scores magnificently from close range into the top left corner. 0:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Stefano Okaka (Watford) comes onto the pitch so that Roberto Pereyra can be given a rest.
Goal! Molla Wague (Watford) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:1.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Kasper Schmeichel (Leicester), who attempted to block the ball after a cross, but instead he sends it inside the bottom left corner of his own goal.
That will be all from Aleksandar Dragovic who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Here is a change. Shinji Okazaki is going off and Claude Puel gives the last tactical orders to Islam Slimani (Leicester).
Andy King (Leicester) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Substitution. Andy King makes way for Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Marco Silva decides to make a substitution. Ben Watson will be replaced by Sebastian Prodl (Watford).
Marvin Zeegelaar (Watford) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
That's the end of the game for Andre Carrillo, who is replaced by Jerome Sinclair (Watford).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Salomon Rondon (West Brom) latches onto a cross and drills a shot towards goal that goes well wide of the right post.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Alan Pardew is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Salomon Rondon suffers an injury and Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Yannick Bolasie is given a rest as he is replaced by Aaron Lennon (Everton).
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Oumar Niasse (Everton) replaces Dominic Calvert-Lewin.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) sees a yellow card from Roger East after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. Jake Livermore is replaced by Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom).
The foul by Gareth Barry (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Roger East.
Substitution. Beni Baningime (Everton) has come on for Tom Davies.
Here is a change. Matt Phillips is going off and Alan Pardew gives the last tactical orders to James McClean (West Brom).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Heung-Min Son provides the assist in the box, but Harry Kane (Tottenham) places his shot a fraction wide of the right post.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Graham Scott shows the yellow card to Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) for a heavy challenge. Tottenham win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Goal! A great cross from Christian Eriksen finds Harry Kane (Tottenham), who scores with a simple header into an empty net. 1:0.
It's a goal! Heung-Min Son plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Harry Kane (Tottenham). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Shane Long (Southampton) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires from the edge of the box to the middle of the goal, but Hugo Lloris is equal to it.
Mario Lemina (Southampton) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the bar.
Goal - 3:0! Dele Alli (Tottenham) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Heung-Min Son provided an assist for the goal.
GOAL! Superb work from Dele Alli, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Heung-Min Son (Tottenham), who beats Fraser Forster with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 4:0.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Mousa Dembele as he is replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
Harry Kane (Tottenham) smacks a great volley at goal from inside the box, but sends the effort just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Southampton will have a goal kick.
Shane Long (Southampton) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Graham Scott ignores the protests.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Dusan Tadic (Southampton) for Nathan Redmond.
Here is a change. Mario Lemina is going off and Mauricio Pellegrino gives the last tactical orders to Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton).
What a beauty from just outside the box! Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the bottom left corner.
GOAL - 5:1! Dele Alli found Harry Kane (Tottenham) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Fraser Forster off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Substitution. Erik Lamela (Tottenham) in, Heung-Min Son out.
Mauricio Pellegrino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sam McQueen (Southampton) replacing Matt Targett.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Dusan Tadic (Southampton) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a shot towards the middle of the goal, which Hugo Lloris was unable to keep it out. 5:2.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss! The ball goes out of play and Southampton will have a goal kick.
Here comes a substitution. Dele Alli is given a rest as he is replaced by Harry Winks (Tottenham).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Chris Smalling (Manchester United) wins himself enough space to connect with a cross inside the box, but his fine header goes narrowly over the crossbar!

Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the roof of the net. Kasper Schmeichel has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Manchester Utd get a corner.
Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) threads a pass through the eye of a needle into the box for Romelu Lukaku, but Kasper Schmeichel displays great awareness to stop him.
Goal Jamie Vardy (Leicester)! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) was put through by Riyad Mahrez and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Victor Lindelof (Manchester United) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Goal - 1:1! Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) receives a precise pass inside the box from Jesse Lingard and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The foul by Nemanja Matic (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.
Christian Fuchs (Leicester) controls a cross inside the box and sends a shot towards the right post, but one of the defenders reacts superbly to block his effort.
Close! Anthony Martial (Manchester United) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot narrowly over the bar.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) is awarded a yellow card.
Claude Puel is forced to make a change. Danny Simpson is unable to continue due to injury, Daniel Amartey (Leicester) comes on.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) shoots from the free kick just outside the box, hitting the top right corner. Football supporters are always pleased to see such a fabulous goal.
Substitution. Iborra walks off the pitch and Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) comes on as a substitute.
Daniel Amartey (Leicester) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Jose Mourinho has decided to make a change. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) replaces Anthony Martial.
Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the right post.
RED CARD! Daniel Amartey (Leicester) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Jonathan Moss. He can have an early bath.
Substitution. Jesse Lingard will be replaced by Ander Herrera (Manchester United).

Lovely run from Marcus Rashford (Manchester United). He finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, lines up a shot, but the keeper boldly launches himself to intercept the ball. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Leicester.

The yellow card is received by Riyad Mahrez (Leicester).

What a wonderful finish! Harry Maguire (Leicester) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and drills a low shot into the bottom left corner. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.
Jonathan Moss is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Superb finishing from Harry Kane (Tottenham). Moussa Sissoko plays a fantastic through ball and finds Harry Kane (Tottenham), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:2.

Mauricio Pochettino decides to make a substitution. Heung-Min Son will be replaced by Mousa Dembele (Tottenham).

Richarlison (Watford) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the left side of the goal. However, Mathew Ryan anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save. The ball goes out for a corner. Watford can continue in their attacking effort.

It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Roberto Pereyra as he is replaced by Jerome Sinclair (Watford).

What a save from Fraser Forster! Christopher Schindler (Huddersfield) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) latches onto a pass and lets rip with a swerving shot from long range towards the top of the net. It's a difficult effort to deal with and Jonas Lossl does well to punch it away.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Wesley Hoedt (Southampton) is booked.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Huddersfield.

Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Rob Elliot is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.

Henri Saivet (Newcastle Utd) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the bottom left corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:1.

An absolutely sensational volley by Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd). He took a shot from inside the penalty area and the ball went in just under the crossbar. All credit to Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd), excellent finish.
Ciaran Clark (Newcastle Utd) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Lee Mason signals. PENALTY! One of the players from West Ham is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.

What a beautiful moment! Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top of the net. Simon Mignolet just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 2:2.

GOAL - 3:2! Alexandre Lacazette found Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Simon Mignolet off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
