It's a goal! Marcus Rashford sends a long raking pass onto the head of Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball into the top right corner. 0:1.
What a great touch by Salomon Rondon (West Brom) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
Goal! Juan Manuel Mata plays a short, square pass into the path of Jesse Lingard (Manchester United), who bends a shot straight into the middle of the goal to make it 0:2. Fabulous goal!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Alan Pardew decided to make a change. Claudio Yacob is replaced by Gareth Barry (West Brom).
Booking. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) receives a caution from the referee.
Oliver Burke (West Brom) attempts to find Salomon Rondon, but puts far too much on the pass and the chance is gone.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Today's match ends for Oliver Burke who will be replaced by Jay Rodriguez (West Brom).
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) replacing Antonio Valencia.
The referee signals a substitution. Chris Brunt (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Grzegorz Krychowiak.
Goal - 1:2! Gareth Barry (West Brom) receives a precise pass inside the box from Jonny Evans and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
Here comes a substitution. Marcus Rashford is given a rest as he is replaced by Anthony Martial (Manchester United).
Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) launches himself at a lofted pass, but his close-range header flies just wide of the left post.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Jesse Lingard is replaced by Scott McTominay (Manchester United).

Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.
The whistle blows and Nemanja Matic (Manchester United) is booked for an infringement.
The foul by Salomon Rondon (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Anthony Taylor.
Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:0.

Hugo Lloris can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Sergio Aguero (Manchester City). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
The game has begun to heat up. Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Craig Pawson blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Fabian Delph (Manchester City) has tested the patience of referee Craig Pawson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.
Substitution. Sergio Aguero makes way for Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City).
Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.

Leroy Sane (Manchester City) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the middle of the target as Hugo Lloris produces a good save.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dele Alli (Tottenham) was quite harsh and Craig Pawson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Hugo Lloris with a strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 2:0.
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Craig Pawson blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY to Manchester City! Great chance to score.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) fails to score from the penalty spot! His effort crashes against the left post.
Close! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar.
Substitution. Heung-Min Son will be replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Goal! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) scores after an assist by Leroy Sane that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Phil Foden (Manchester City) replaces Ilkay Gundogan.
Mauricio Pochettino decides to make a substitution. Dele Alli will be replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
It is time for a substitution. Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) is on for Leroy Sane.

Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top left corner. Hugo Lloris pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The referee points to the corner flag and Manchester City will take a corner.
Substitution. Danny Rose walks off the pitch and Ben Davies (Tottenham) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Raheem Sterling (Manchester City), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 4:0.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) for his blatant foul.

Goal! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Ederson is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 4:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Erik Pieters (Stoke City) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Graham Scott blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. West Ham are awarded a penalty!
Goal! Mark Noble (West Ham) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Jack Butland into the bottom right corner.
Kevin Wimmer (Stoke City) is cautioned by the referee.
David William Moyes is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Mark Noble suffers an injury and Declan Rice (West Ham) comes on.

Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Jack Butland has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The referee blows his whistle, West Ham are awarded a corner kick.
That's unlucky! Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) side steps a tackle after receiving a pass, advances then hits a booming shot from mid-range which only rises at the last second to fly just over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Graham Scott shows a yellow card to Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
Graham Scott shows the yellow card to Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) for a heavy challenge.
Today's match ends for Mame Diouf who will be replaced by Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Darren Fletcher and he is replaced by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Erik Pieters trots off the pitch and is replaced by Josh Tymon (Stoke City).
OFF THE BAR! Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
Substitution. Michail Antonio is replaced by Diafra Sakho (West Ham).
Manuel Lanzini feeds the ball through to Marko Arnautovic (West Ham), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:2!
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marko Arnautovic leaves the pitch and Chicharito (West Ham) comes on.
Chance! Diafra Sakho (West Ham) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Chicharito, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the left post.
Goal - 0:3! Manuel Lanzini laid the ball off to Diafra Sakho (West Ham), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Chicharito (West Ham) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Jack Butland thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same. West Ham have been awarded a corner kick.
Graham Scott is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
The defender bravely blocks the shot from Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) inside the box. The ball is out of play and Arsenal manage to earn a corner.
What a hit! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the top of the net. 1:0.
Stuart Attwell shows a yellow card to Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Atsu trots off the pitch and is replaced by Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd).
Jacob Murphy comes off the pitch to be replaced by Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Alex Iwobi limps off the pitch to be replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
Here comes a substitution. Alexandre Lacazette is given a rest as he is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range low towards the middle of the net, but Rob Elliot was alert and made an amazing save!
Substitution. Mikel Merino leaves the pitch and is replaced by Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd).
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) has tested the patience of referee Stuart Attwell and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Alexis Sanchez as he is replaced by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Stuart Attwell is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Glenn Murray (Brighton) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the roof of the net. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Nick Pope makes a comfortable save.
Nick Pope was forced into action to thwart Anthony Knockaert (Brighton). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.

Lewis Dunk (Brighton) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the top left corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper. Brighton will take a corner kick.
Chris Kavanagh blows his whistle after James Tarkowski (Burnley) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. PENALTY to Brighton! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Glenn Murray (Brighton) fails to score from the penalty kick. His shot goes just a few inches over the crossbar.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Chris Kavanagh has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Charlie Taylor (Burnley) sees a yellow card from Chris Kavanagh after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) swept past a couple of defenders inside the box and tried to score into the bottom left corner, but great anticipation by Nick Pope allowed him to make a comfortable save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Brighton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Mathew Ryan makes a great save to stop his effort.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) shoots the rebound towards the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows the goalkeeper to pull off a stunning save.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Chris Wood (Burnley) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tomer Hemed (Brighton) comes onto the pitch for Glenn Murray.
Solomon March (Brighton) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Sean Dyche decides to make a substitution. Steven Defour will be replaced by Ashley Barnes (Burnley).
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) takes out his opponent with a horrible challenge and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Chris Wood (Burnley) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Mathew Ryan.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Isaiah Brown (Brighton) for Pascal Gross.
Dale Stephens (Brighton) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Here is a change. Chris Wood is going off and Sean Dyche gives the last tactical orders to Sam Vokes (Burnley).
Substitution. Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) replaces Anthony Knockaert.
The foul by Lewis Dunk (Brighton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Chris Kavanagh.
Shane Duffy (Brighton) is penalised.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) whips the ball in, but it fails to reach any of his teammates as the opposition's defence averts the threat.
Marcos Alonso provides the assist in the box, but Willian (Chelsea) places his shot a fraction wide of the right post.
Mauricio Pellegrino decides to make a substitution. Cedric Soares will be replaced by Mario Lemina (Southampton).
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Fraser Forster makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal.
Gary Cahill (Chelsea) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the bottom left corner, but Fraser Forster was alert and made a comfortable save.
N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and produces a ferocious strike towards the left post, but his shot is well held by the goalkeeper.

Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea) gets on the end of a pass and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by one of the defending players. The ball goes out for a corner. Chelsea can continue in their attacking effort.
Pedro (Chelsea) swirls around the defenders and shoots from inside the box. His promising effort goes past the goalkeeper, but one of the defenders gets back and knocks the ball onto the post.
Today's referee Roger East rightly decides to book Maya Yoshida (Southampton) for his harsh tackle.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) proves that he is an excellent free-kick taker after finding the back of the net with a clever shot that goes straight into the bottom left corner!
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Manolo Gabbiadini leaves the pitch and Charlie Austin (Southampton) comes on.
The goalkeeper pulls off a great save to deny Charlie Austin (Southampton), whose good effort would probably have ended inside the right post.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pedro trots off the pitch and is replaced by Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea).
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is forced to stop his attacking move after the linesman signals for offside.

Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going inside the right post, but Fraser Forster has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. The ball is out of play. Chelsea win a corner kick.
Mauricio Pellegrino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) replacing Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
Substitution. Eden Hazard will be replaced by Alvaro Morata (Chelsea).
Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Fraser Forster is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) is ready on the edge of the six-yard box and duly receives the cross, but his header fizzes just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Victor Moses makes way for Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea).

Charlie Austin (Southampton) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the right post.
Roger East shows a yellow card to Nathan Redmond (Southampton) for a tough tackle.
Jack Stephens (Southampton) fails to control his temper and is booked by the referee for dissent.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.

Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Fraser Forster makes a great save to stop his effort. Chelsea win a corner.
Roger East rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Marcos Alonso (Chelsea).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! 0:1. Elias Kachunga (Huddersfield) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.
Tom Ince (Huddersfield) comes onto the pitch because Elias Kachunga simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Richarlison (Watford) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Jose Holebas, but he hits a shot just over the crossbar.
It's in the back of the net! Collin Quaner plays it into the box, and Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the left post. 0:2.
A substitution has been made. Adrian Mariappa is replaced by Roberto Pereyra (Watford).
Troy Deeney (Watford) is shown a red card by the referee for chasing his opponent and bringing him down with a very nasty tackle!
Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
A goal, which was scored by Richarlison (Watford), was disallowed due to offside.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Chris Lowe is substituted due to injury. David Wagner gives a chance to Scott Malone (Huddersfield).
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! The ball breaks to Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) after some poor defending, he finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and calmly puts the ball into the back of the net! He makes it 0:3.
Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
David Wagner prepares a substitution. Rajiv van La Parra is replaced by Daniel Williams (Huddersfield).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Andre Gray (Watford) for Etienne Capoue.
Goal! Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 1:3.
Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
A substitution has been made. Jose Holebas goes off and Stefano Okaka (Watford) comes on.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) jumps into a tackle and Michael Oliver blows his whistle for a foul. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Huddersfield!
Goal! Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) puts the ball into the left side of the goal past the outstretched arm of Heurelho Gomes.

Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the right side of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Booking. Daryl Janmaat (Watford) receives a caution from the referee.
The first half has just begun.
Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace) finds space inside the box but rifles his effort just wide of the right post.

Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) beats the defender inside the box and lashes a shot towards the left side of the goal, but Kasper Schmeichel makes a brilliant reflex save to deny him. Goalkeeping at its best!
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) jumps for a cross and plants a crashing header into the middle of the net. Even though the goalkeeper was standing near, he couldn't make a save.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) produced a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Kasper Schmeichel thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Kasper Schmeichel with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:2.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.

Andros Townsend sends a lovely lofted pass forward that flies over the top of the defence and into the path of Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace), but he can't direct his header on target as it flies well wide of the right post.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) sees a yellow card from Martin Atkinson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Harry Maguire (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Martin Atkinson and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Goal disallowed! Iborra (Leicester) scores but Martin Atkinson blows his whistle for a foul.
Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) has weakened his team by being sent-off early, following two yellow cards and the inevitable red.
Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make.
Demarai Gray (Leicester) failed to convert a mid-range free kick and sends the ball narrowly over the bar.
A substitution has been made. Iborra goes off and Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) comes on.
Claude Puel has decided to substitute Marc Albrighton and he is replaced by Andy King (Leicester).

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Kasper Schmeichel, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball is out of play and Crystal Palace manage to earn a corner.
Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) controls a nice low pass and shoots from just outside the box, but it's a poor effort that flies into the stands. Wasted opportunity!

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Yohan Cabaye walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jairo Riedewald (Crystal Palace).
Claude Puel prepares a substitution. Jamie Vardy is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Danny Simpson (Leicester) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) on for Christian Benteke.
After receiving a beautiful pass, Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) had a huge opportunity. He coolly unleashed a perfect shot, which went towards the top left corner, bouncing in off the post.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Golden chance! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity!
Paul Tierney has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Emre Can (Liverpool) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Paul Tierney had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Hal Robson-Kanu trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jay Rodriguez (West Brom).
Substitution. Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) has come on for Sadio Mane.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Georginio Wijnaldum is replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool).
The manager makes a subsitution with Chris Brunt (West Brom) coming on for Grzegorz Krychowiak.
We are about to witness a substitution. Joe Gomez (Liverpool) is replacing Trent Alexander-Arnold.
Goal, no wait. Paul Tierney blows his whistle for handball and Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.
Having seen unsporting behavior, Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to one of the players sitting on the bench. And Sam Field (West Brom) is the recipient.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

David de Gea makes a brilliant save! Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the bottom right corner but is saved by the keeper! The referee points to the corner flag and Bournemouth will take a corner.

Goal! Juan Manuel Mata hands Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the top right corner. 1:0.
Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Graham Scott had an easy-decision to make.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A fortuitous save from David de Gea stops the ball from going into the middle of the goal.
Graham Scott shows a yellow card to Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) for a tough tackle.
David de Gea blocks Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth)'s effort from the edge of the box.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
What a big chance! Anthony Martial (Manchester United) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) for Anthony Martial.
Eddie Howe prepares a substitution. Callum Wilson is replaced by Benik Afobe (Bournemouth).
Junior Stanislas goes off the pitch and Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) comes on.
It's time for a substitution. Ander Herrera (Manchester United) comes on in place of Jesse Lingard.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lewis Cook (Bournemouth) will replace Dan Gosling.
David de Gea pulls off a great save to deny Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Today's match ends for Luke Shaw who will be replaced by Ashley Young (Manchester United).
Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. David de Gea makes a comfortable save to stop the effort from flying into the middle of the goal.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his strike flies just a few inches over the bar.
Erik Lamela (Tottenham) latches onto a loose ball inside the box but slams it just wide of the left post.

What a beautiful moment! Serge Aurier (Tottenham) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top of the net. Mathew Ryan just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:0.
Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) picks up a yellow card.
Danny Rose (Tottenham) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Madley didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.

Erik Lamela (Tottenham) unleashed a rocket of a shot aiming towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies his attempt with a stunning save. The referee signals a corner kick to Tottenham.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Solomon March (Brighton) comes onto the pitch for Jose Izquierdo.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch so that Harry Winks can be given a rest.
Tomer Hemed (Brighton) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Hugo Lloris pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Chris Hughton prepares a substitution. Tomer Hemed is replaced by Glenn Murray (Brighton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Erik Lamela leaves the pitch and Dele Alli (Tottenham) comes on.
Chris Hughton decides to make a substitution. Beram Kayal will be replaced by Pascal Gross (Brighton).

Danny Rose (Tottenham) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. The ball goes out for a corner. Tottenham can continue in their attacking effort.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) takes the free kick from 23 metres out and attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a low shot under the defensive wall. Mathew Ryan stops the ball from reaching the bottom right corner by deflecting it onto the post. Great save!

It's in the back of the net! Christian Eriksen flights the free kick into the box, where Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) peels off his marker and heads straight into the top of the net from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:0.
The referee signals a substitution. Ben Davies (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Heung-Min Son.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) has a goal ruled out for offside!
A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Adrian pulls off a brilliant save.
