Stuart Attwell blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Chris Hughton makes a switch. Solomon March (Brighton) is coming on in place of Ezequiel Schelotto at the start of the second period.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) replaces Pascal Gross.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Isaiah Brown trots off the pitch and is replaced by Tomer Hemed (Brighton).
Here's the change. Steve Mounie leaves the pitch and Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) comes on as a substitute.
David Wagner prepares a substitution. Tom Ince is replaced by Joe Lolley (Huddersfield).
That will be all from Elias Kachunga who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Daniel Williams (Huddersfield).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The foul by Claudio Yacob (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Sam Field (West Brom), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Wayne Routledge (Swansea) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and glances off the left-hand post.
Alfie Mawson (Swansea) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Michael Dean blows his whistle to start the second half.
Alan Pardew has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. James McClean (West Brom) comes on the pitch for Sam Field.
A yellow card for a tackle by Thomas Carroll (Swansea). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Wilfried Bony (Swansea) creates some space for himself and unleashes a strike from long range, but his effort sails just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Jordan Ayew (Swansea) has come on for Wayne Routledge.
Substitution. Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) replaces Nathan Dyer.
Substitution. Thomas Carroll makes his way off the pitch and Tammy Abraham (Swansea) comes on as his replacement.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Ben Foster easily deals with the threat.
Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) gets a yellow card.
Oliver Burke (West Brom) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Hal Robson-Kanu.
Goal! Wilfried Bony (Swansea) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
The substitution has been made. Chris Brunt (West Brom) has replaced Jay Rodriguez.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Jonny Evans (West Brom) for a tough tackle.
The whistle blows and Roque Mesa (Swansea) is booked for an infringement.
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Chris Brunt (West Brom) for his harsh tackle.
Tammy Abraham (Swansea) beats an opponent and drives towards the edge of the penalty area. He steadies himself and hits a tremendous shot that flashes a whisker past the left post.
That's it for today, Michael Dean has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What bad luck! Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) got in the way of a pass and unintentionally sent the ball past his own goalkeeper. The score is 1:0.

Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Jack Butland makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom right corner.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for Jack Butland to dive and make a save.
Close! Harry Kane (Tottenham) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) takes a first-time shot inside the box after latching onto a nice lofted pass, but the effort is blocked and spins away to safety.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Roger East starts the second half.
Goal! Dele Alli tees up Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) leaps to meet a beautiful cross and pings a header past the goalkeeper low into the middle of the net.

Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but Hugo Lloris shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Harry Kane (Tottenham) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Jack Butland. 4:0.
Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
It will be a substitution. Erik Lamela (Tottenham) is ready to enter the pitch as Dele Alli walks off.
Here is a change. Thomas Edwards is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Peter Crouch (Stoke City).
Goal! Heung-Min Son plays a pass to the feet of Christian Eriksen (Tottenham), and he shoots inside the right post from inside the box. It's 5:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Xherdan Shaqiri leaves the pitch and Geoff Cameron (Stoke City) comes on.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) replacing Harry Winks.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) comes onto the pitch so that Joe Allen can be given a rest.

A perfectly taken corner kick. Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) gets on the end of it and produces a fantastic bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes inside the right post, increasing the score of today's match – 5:1.

Jack Butland was forced into action to thwart Christian Eriksen (Tottenham). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Tottenham.
Substitution. Fernando Llorente (Tottenham) on for Heung-Min Son.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) meets the lofted pass inside the box with a well placed shot towards the bottom right corner, but Jack Butland pulls off a fantastic save to deny him. The ball is out of play. Tottenham will have a chance to score from a corner.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) receives a yellow card.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) was quite harsh and Anthony Taylor didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

A sweet pass finds N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the bottom right corner. Adrian is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. Chelsea win a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
Anthony Taylor blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Antonio Conte gives a chance to Pedro (Chelsea) and Tiemoue Bakayoko is off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcos Alonso departs the field of play to be replaced by Victor Moses (Chelsea).
Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) finds himself unmarked on the edge of the box, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Adrian (West Ham) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Here comes a substitution. Willian (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Davide Zappacosta.
Winston Reid (West Ham) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Anthony Taylor didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) for his blatant foul.
The game has come to an end for Marko Arnautovic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Diafra Sakho (West Ham).
Pedro Obiang (West Ham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
David William Moyes is forced to make a change. Michail Antonio is unable to continue due to injury, Andre Ayew (West Ham) comes on.
What a huge chance for Alvaro Morata (Chelsea). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
That's unlucky! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) side steps a tackle after receiving a pass, advances then hits a booming shot from mid-range which only rises at the last second to fly just over the bar.
Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Michail Antonio (West Ham) finds space inside the box to shoot after collecting a short pass, but it's a wasted effort as it flies high over the bar.
Declan Rice (West Ham) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

A sweet pass finds David Silva (Manchester City) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the roof of the net. Adrian is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second. Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick.

Ederson makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the right side of the target.
Cheikhou Kouyate is substituted due to injury. David William Moyes gives a chance to Diafra Sakho (West Ham).

Goal – 0:1! Aaron Cresswell sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the bottom left corner.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Pep Guardiola decided to make a change. Danilo is replaced by Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City).
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but Adrian dives superbly to deny him. His shot went towards the right side of the goal.
It's in the back of the net! Gabriel Jesus is the provider as he slips the ball to Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:1.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

The opposition back off Leroy Sane (Manchester City), who needs no second invitation to shoot from inside the box. It's a decent effort towards the left side of the goal corner, but Adrian denies him with the save.
David William Moyes has decided to make a change. Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) replaces Manuel Lanzini.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Adrian pulls off a brilliant save.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne puts a cross into the box and finds David Silva (Manchester City), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:1.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Sergio Aguero is replaced by Fernandinho (Manchester City).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Michail Antonio walks off the pitch to be replaced by Andre Ayew (West Ham).
Leroy Sane goes off the pitch and Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) comes on.
Adrian (West Ham) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) is yellow-carded.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Virgil Van Dijk (Southampton) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) meets a splendid cross on the edge of the 6-yard box and sends the ball towards the left post, forcing Fraser Forster into a superb diving save to keep it out.
Adam Smith (Bournemouth) picks up a caution.
Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) picked up a yellow card for saying too much to the referee.

Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Fraser Forster, who makes a glorious save!
Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) whips a volley from long range towards the goal. His beautiful effort whistles wide of the right post. It was close and it could have been a top class goal!

GOAL! Superb work from Andrew Surman, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth), who beats Fraser Forster with a brilliant shot into the right side of the net. 1:0.
Jonathan Moss has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Mauricio Pellegrino gives a chance to Nathan Redmond (Southampton) and James Ward-Prowse is off.
Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.

Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom right corner, but Fraser Forster has other ideas and makes a brilliant save.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. Southampton have a corner.

It's a goal! Nathan Redmond plays the ball to the feet of Charlie Austin (Southampton), who hits a tremendous first-time shot into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out. 1:1.
Good chance! Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored!
The referee signals a substitution. Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) is brought on as a substitute for Jermain Defoe.
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Junior Stanislas and he is replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).
Substitution. Mario Lemina (Southampton) has come on for Dusan Tadic.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Mario Lemina (Southampton) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) is unable to keep his close-range header down and sends the cross from Ryan Bertrand just over the bar.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Asmir Begovic, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Steven Davis goes off the pitch and Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) comes on.
It's time for a substitution. Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) comes on in place of Ryan Fraser.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Paul Pogba plays a simple square pass into the feet of Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) in the box, who composes himself and lashes the ball low into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
Goal - 0:2! Anthony Martial tees up Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Petr Cech.
Arsene Wenger is forced to make a change. Shkodran Mustafi is unable to continue due to injury, Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) comes on.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort.
Crossbar! Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) throws the chance away as he attempts to produce a shot from inside the box, but his attempt only rattles the crossbar! The goalkeeper can remain calm.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) unleashes a cannonball of a shot from the edge of the area, but it zips narrowly wide of the left post.

Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) decides to strike the ball towards goal, but his effort fails to threaten the goalkeeper after being well blocked by one of the defenders. Arsenal force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the left side of the goal, but David de Gea was alert and made a comfortable save.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) crosses the ball into the box, but one of the defending players averts the threat.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Andre Marriner blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Goal! Aaron Ramsey puts the ball on a plate for Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:2.

Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) unleashes a promising shot towards the left side of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Petr Cech thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Great chance! Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) fails to turn the rebound in as the goalkeeper pulls off a great save to keep him out.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) for a tough tackle.
It's in the back of the net! Paul Pogba is the provider as he slips the ball to Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:3.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the middle of the goal is, however, saved by David de Gea!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ander Herrera (Manchester United) comes onto the pitch for Anthony Martial.
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Granit Xhaka is replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) clatters into his opponent and is shown a red card by the referee! Despite protesting, he knows the match has ended for him.
Jesse Lingard comes off the pitch to be replaced by Matteo Darmian (Manchester United).
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) replacing Sead Kolasinac.
A yellow card for a tackle by Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Andre Marriner's book.
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) tries to convince the referee to change his mind and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Substitution. Ashley Young did his best and is replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).
Andre Marriner is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Philippe Coutinho sends in a great cross from the corner and finds Emre Can (Liverpool), who outjumps the defence to put the ball into the roof of the net with a stunning header. The score is 0:1.

Philippe Coutinho sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 0:2.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Goal! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Mohamed Salah inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. 0:3.
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) commits a rough challenge and Graham Scott blows his whistle for a foul. Brighton are about to take a penalty!
Goal! Glenn Murray (Brighton) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Simon Mignolet into left side of the goal.
Bruno Saltor (Brighton) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.

What a wasted opportunity by Mohamed Salah (Liverpool)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the middle of the net, but Mathew Ryan makes a comfortable save to thwart him.
Substitution. Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) replaces Isaiah Brown.
Chris Hughton has decided to substitute Anthony Knockaert and he is replaced by Solomon March (Brighton).
The game has come to an end for Bruno Saltor. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Ezequiel Schelotto (Brighton).
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Mohamed Salah is replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool).

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. Even though his effort is aimed at the middle of the goal, the goalkeeper is unable to pull off a save and keep the ball out.
Roberto Firmino will be replaced by Dominic Solanke (Liverpool).
OWN GOAL! Lewis Dunk (Brighton) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 1:5.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Marko Grujic (Liverpool) replaces Jordan Henderson.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Scott Malone (Huddersfield) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Jonjoe Kenny (Everton) has tested the patience of referee Chris Kavanagh and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Tempers flare after Tom Davies (Everton) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.

Jonas Lossl makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Cuco Martina (Everton) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of inside the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Chris Kavanagh blows his whistle and the second half starts.
It's time for a substitution. Kasey Palmer (Huddersfield) comes on in place of Collin Quaner.

Brilliant finish! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Everton) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Dominic Calvert-Lewin, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
The referee signals a substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Tom Davies.
Substitution. Ademola Lookman (Everton) replaces Aaron Lennon.
Here is a change. Scott Malone is going off and David Wagner gives the last tactical orders to Steve Mounie (Huddersfield).
GOAL! Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Jonas Lossl, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:0.
Substitution. Michael Keane (Everton) on for Wayne Rooney.
That's it for today, Chris Kavanagh has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Nick Pope stops the ball from hitting the bottom left corner.
Goal! Demarai Gray (Leicester) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.

Chris Wood (Burnley) fails to turn the rebound in from a promising position. The goalkeeper pulls off a superb save and denies his effort. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Burnley.

A big opportunity is wasted by Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the bottom right corner. Unfortunately for him, Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort.
Sean Dyche is forced to make a change. Robbie Brady is unable to continue due to injury, Scott Arfield (Burnley) comes on.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to place a shot inside the left post, but Nick Pope makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory.
Paul Tierney has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Tempers flare after Phillip Bardsley (Burnley) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.

Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) produced a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Kasper Schmeichel thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
We are about to witness a substitution. Ashley Barnes (Burnley) is replacing Steven Defour.

What an amazing save by Nick Pope! Marc Albrighton (Leicester) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the left side of the target, but fails. The referee blows his whistle, Leicester are awarded a corner kick.
Demarai Gray (Leicester) wastes a huge chance as he sends a first-time shot from inside the penalty area straight onto the left post!
Here comes a substitution. Sam Vokes (Burnley) is brought on as a substitute for Chris Wood.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and produces a low shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
Substitution. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Demarai Gray walks off.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ben Mee (Burnley) was quite harsh and Paul Tierney didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot goalwards, but the keeper produces a decent save!
That's all for today as the game is over.
Craig Pawson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Wilfried Bony (Swansea) meets a perfect cross from Martin Olsson on the edge of the penalty area and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike straight into the left side of the goal. It's 0:1.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom right corner.
Goal! Peter Crouch plays a short, square pass into the path of Mame Diouf (Stoke City), who bends a shot straight into the top right corner to make it 2:1. Fabulous goal!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Craig Pawson has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Problems for Mark Hughes as Bruno Martins Indi is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Kevin Wimmer (Stoke City) replaces him.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post!
Substitution. Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) replaces Maxim Choupo-Moting.
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Darren Fletcher and he is replaced by Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City).
Today's match ends for Sam Clucas who will be replaced by Thomas Carroll (Swansea).
Substitution. Jordan Ayew did his best and is replaced by Oliver McBurnie (Swansea).
Thomas Carroll (Swansea) produces a shot from a mid-range free kick. His effort is directed under the crossbar but is caught by the goalkeeper. Swansea have been awarded a corner kick.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Kevin Wimmer (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Renato Sanches (Swansea) will replace Leroy Fer.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) is given a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Christian Kabasele (Watford) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner kick and scores with a great header into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:0.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Dele Alli, but he can't get on the end of the pass. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Watford.
Goal! Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Christian Eriksen. The score is 1:1.
Tom Cleverley (Watford) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Christian Kabasele (Watford) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Davinson Sanchez (Tottenham) is awarded a red card due to his behaviour.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) fires a brilliant shot from the edge of the box, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Christian Eriksen and he is replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
We are about to witness a substitution. Etienne Capoue (Watford) is replacing Christian Kabasele.
Substitution. Roberto Pereyra makes way for Andre Carrillo (Watford).
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) receives a yellow card.
A yellow card is awarded to Marvin Zeegelaar (Watford).
Heung-Min Son will be replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Here is a change. Dele Alli is going off and Mauricio Pochettino gives the last tactical orders to Harry Winks (Tottenham).
Richarlison (Watford) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Gray (Watford) will replace Tom Cleverley.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) beats the defender to the ball in the box and shoots, but the ball flashes over the bar.
What a miss! The corner finds Ahmed Hegazy (West Brom) unmarked in the box with the goal at his mercy, but somehow he mistimes his header and sends it just wide of the left post.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) fires a shot at goal from a very promising position outside the penalty area, but it is blocked by a self-sacrificing defender.
Gareth Barry is being substituted because of an injury. Alan Pardew sends Claudio Yacob (West Brom) on the pitch.

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ben Foster to get hold of the ball.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The defender bravely blocks the shot from Sam Field (West Brom) inside the box.
Julian Speroni was forced into action to thwart Jay Rodriguez (West Brom). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Jake Livermore (West Brom) picks up a yellow card.
We are about to witness a substitution. James McClean (West Brom) is replacing Hal Robson-Kanu.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) blows a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) on for Andros Townsend.
This shall not pass! Sam Field (West Brom) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender.
Alan Pardew has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Oliver Burke (West Brom) replacing Jay Rodriguez.
The whistle blows and Sam Field (West Brom) is booked for an infringement.
Today's referee Michael Oliver rightly decides to book Allan Nyom (West Brom) for his harsh tackle.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Goal! Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Clinical finish! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) finds himself some space inside the box to control a rebound and fires the ball into the left side of the goal, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Goal! Victor Moses hands Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the left side of the goal. 2:1.
Ciaran Clark (Newcastle Utd) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Kevin Friend had an easy-decision to make.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) replaces Ayoze Perez.

Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Kevin Friend blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. The referee makes a call and blows his whistle for an infringement. Chelsea are awarded a penalty.
Goal! Karl Darlow gets a hand on the penalty from Eden Hazard (Chelsea), but can't stop it from flying inside the left post.
It's time for a substitution. Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) comes on in place of Mohamed Diame.
Antonio Conte has decided to substitute Cesc Fabregas and he is replaced by Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea).
Substitution. Eden Hazard leaves the pitch and is replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Andreas Christensen comes off the pitch to be replaced by Gary Cahill (Chelsea).
Here is a change. Mikel Merino is going off and Rafael Benitez gives the last tactical orders to DeAndre Yedlin (Newcastle Utd).
That's it for today, Kevin Friend has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Michael Oliver blows his whistle after Joe Hart (West Ham) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. Everton are awarded a penalty kick!

Wayne Rooney (Everton) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the left post. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Joe Hart to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
Goal! Wayne Rooney (Everton) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
What a hit! Wayne Rooney (Everton) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Gylfi Sigurdsson (Everton) for his blatant foul.
Michael Oliver has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. David William Moyes decided to make a change. Pedro Obiang is replaced by Diafra Sakho (West Ham).
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) hammers the ball goalwards from about 30 metres. The shot is directed to the roof of the net but is thwarted by a save from Jordan Pickford.
A long pass into the box is latched onto by Aaron Cresswell (West Ham), who looks up and slams a terrific shot past the keeper but onto the crossbar. He did everything right but score!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Tom Davies (Everton) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ashley Williams (Everton) manages to dispossess his opponent of the ball, but he commits a foul in the process and the referee blows his whistle. It's a penalty for West Ham!

Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot inside the left post. Jordan Pickford anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.
Here comes a substitution. Marko Arnautovic is given a rest as he is replaced by Michail Antonio (West Ham).

Sensational goal, a once in a lifetime shot. Wayne Rooney (Everton) spots the goalkeeper off his line and decides to shoot from 50 metres out. The keeper tries desperately to stop the ball but it hits the back of the net.

Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) expertly controls the pass inside the penalty area and shoots, but it's inadvertently blocked a defender. The referee blows his whistle, Everton are awarded a corner kick.
Declan Rice (West Ham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Winston Reid.
Gylfi Sigurdsson takes the corner and Ashley Williams (Everton) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the top left corner. The score is 4:0.
David Unsworth decides to make a substitution. Wayne Rooney will be replaced by Beni Baningime (Everton).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Aaron Lennon walks off the pitch to be replaced by Ademola Lookman (Everton).
David Unsworth prepares a substitution. Dominic Calvert-Lewin is replaced by Nikola Vlasic (Everton).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Fernandinho (Manchester City) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the left post! The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) sees his header crash off the crossbar after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.

Fernandinho (Manchester City) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Manchester City earn a corner.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Fraser Forster is alert and denies him.
Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.

Mario Lemina (Southampton) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his low strike to the middle of the target as Ederson produces a good save. The linesman makes the right call and Southampton will have a corner.
Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to Vincent Kompany (Manchester City), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) stands over the free kick and fires the ball goalwards. It's deflected and goes past the stranded goalkeeper, who couldn't do much. 1:0.
A sweet pass inside the box gives Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) time to measure a shot, but it's slightly mishit and goes just wide of the right post. That really was a great chance!
Great save! Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the right side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Fraser Forster.

Fraser Forster gets a well deserved ovation! He pulls off a remarkable save to block a long-range effort from Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) towards the top left corner. Nice goalkeeping skills! The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Manchester City.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) gets in a header from close range after a lofted pass, but the effort flies just over the bar.
Mauricio Pellegrino prepares a substitution. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg is replaced by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).
Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to Shane Long (Southampton) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and David Silva (Manchester City) is coming onto the pitch as Gabriel Jesus cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Goal - 1:1! Sofiane Boufal tees up Oriol Romeu (Southampton) inside the box and he slams the ball into the roof of the net and past Ederson.
Substitution. Ilkay Gundogan makes his way off the pitch and Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Shane Long is going off and Mauricio Pellegrino gives the last tactical orders to Charlie Austin (Southampton).
Substitution. Cedric Soares makes way for Sam McQueen (Southampton).

Goal! Great link up play between Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) and Kevin De Bruyne gives the former a clear sight of goal on the edge of the box. He doesn't disappoint and beats the keeper in the top right corner. 2:1.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal - 0:1! Dominic Solanke tees up Sadio Mane (Liverpool) inside the box and he slams the ball past Lee Grant.

A sweet pass finds Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the bottom left corner. Lee Grant is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.
Simon Mignolet (Liverpool) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make.

Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) elects to shoot from the edge of the box instead of sending the free kick into the box, but the defensive wall manages to block the shot. Wasted opportunity! Good work from Stoke as they win a corner.
Martin Atkinson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.

Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) gets on the end of a good pass and from mid-range he unleashes a decent strike, but the shot is blocked by the defender. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Liverpool.
The game has begun to heat up. Emre Can (Liverpool) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) for his blatant foul.
Kurt Zouma (Stoke City) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool).
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain goes off the pitch and James Milner (Liverpool) comes on.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) replacing Dominic Solanke.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Sadio Mane (Liverpool) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
That's the end of the game for Maxim Choupo-Moting, who is replaced by Jese (Stoke City).
Goal! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper inside the left post. 0:2.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) shows good awareness inside the box to meet a delightful cross from the free kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) bursts into the box after a great solo run and gets one-on-one with the keeper, who he neatly side steps and rolls the ball into an empty net. Wonderful effort!
Substitution. Darren Fletcher makes way for Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).

Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) releases a promising shot from the free kick on the edge of the box. His effort towards the roof of the net is comfortably saved by Lee Grant. The ball goes out of play. Liverpool are awarded a corner kick.
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. Sadio Mane will be replaced by Jordan Henderson (Liverpool).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the goalkeeper.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Wow, what an escape. Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
The game is over for Alexandre Lacazette. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) comes on for the second half.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him.
Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
Half-chance! Elias Kachunga (Huddersfield) plays a pass into the box, but Petr Cech reacts well to snuff out the attack. It will be a corner kick for Huddersfield.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) was quite harsh and Graham Scott didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
GOAL! Superb work from Mesut Ozil, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), who beats Jonas Lossl with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) receives a quality cross and unleashes an accurate shot into the top of the net and behind the goalkeeper.
Goal! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) takes a short pass from Aaron Ramsey in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner. 4:0.
Substitution. Aaron Ramsey did his best and is replaced by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to substitute Alexis Sanchez and he is replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
It will be a substitution. Daniel Williams (Huddersfield) is ready to enter the pitch as Aaron Mooy walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) comes onto the pitch for Steve Mounie.
David Wagner prepares a substitution. Jonathan Hogg is replaced by Dean Whitehead (Huddersfield).

Goal! Sead Kolasinac plays in Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box he shoots into the top of the net! Great finish - 5:0.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Chris Wood (Burnley) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Roger East blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Harry Arter leaves the pitch and is replaced by Lewis Cook (Bournemouth).
Substitution. Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) on for Marc Pugh.
Goal - 0:2! Robbie Brady (Burnley) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top right corner. Johann Gudmundsson provided an assist for the goal.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Jordon Ibe will be replaced by Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth).
Steven Defour is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Ashley Westwood (Burnley).
Goal! Joshua King (Bournemouth) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:2.
Sean Dyche has decided to make a change. Ashley Barnes (Burnley) replaces Jeff Hendrick.
That's the end of the game for Chris Wood, who is replaced by Sam Vokes (Burnley).
Yellow card! It's like Sam Vokes (Burnley) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Roger East agrees and books him.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Close effort! Willian (Chelsea) takes the resulting free kick from a promising distance, but he sends it narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Swansea will have a goal kick.

Pedro (Chelsea) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the bottom right corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Lukasz Fabianski pulls off an easy save. The referee blows his whistle, Chelsea are awarded a corner kick.

Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails under the crossbar. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save. Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
Pedro (Chelsea) gets into a great position in the box after a pass, but sends his shot just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Swansea.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Paul Clement probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Renato Sanches. He is replaced by Leroy Fer (Swansea).
Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 1:0.

Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) finds himself some space around the penalty spot and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the top right corner, but Lukasz Fabianski keeps it out. The referee signals a corner kick to Chelsea.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Oliver McBurnie (Swansea) replaces Roque Mesa.
Antonio Conte has decided to substitute Davide Zappacosta and he is replaced by Victor Moses (Chelsea).
Substitution. Eden Hazard (Chelsea) in, Pedro out.
Substitution. Daniel Drinkwater (Chelsea) has come on for Willian.
Paul Clement prepares a substitution. Jordan Ayew is replaced by Wayne Routledge (Swansea).
Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Neil Swarbrick's book.
Neil Swarbrick is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Jesse Lingard tees up Ashley Young (Manchester United) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Jonathan Moss shows the yellow card to Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) for a heavy challenge. Manchester Utd win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Ashley Young (Manchester United) takes a wonderful free kick and curls the ball into the top left corner with an absolutely phenomenal strike!
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marcos Rojo (Manchester United). Jonathan Moss doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Adrian Mariappa (Watford) sees a yellow card from Jonathan Moss after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Manchester Utd earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.

Heurelho Gomes makes a brilliant save! Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the bottom left corner but is saved by the keeper!

Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a sweet strike towards the middle of the goal. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out. Great goalkeeping! The referee blows his whistle, Manchester Utd are awarded a corner kick.
Richarlison (Watford) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Jose Mourinho is forced to make a change. Nemanja Matic is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Ander Herrera (Manchester United).
Problems for Marco Silva as Will Hughes is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Roberto Pereyra (Watford) replaces him.
The referee signals a substitution. Andre Carrillo (Watford) is brought on as a substitute for Sebastian Prodl.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Martial trots off the pitch and is replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).
Here is a change. Andre Gray is going off and Marco Silva gives the last tactical orders to Troy Deeney (Watford).

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just over the crossbar.
Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) takes a short pass in his stride and attempts to beat the keeper from mid-range, but the shot screeches just wide of the right post.
Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Jonathan Moss blows his whistle for a foul. Penalty awarded! Watford will take a penalty kick.
Goal! Troy Deeney (Watford) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for David de Gea to commit before slotting the penalty into the bottom left corner.

It's in the back of the net! Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) fires a brilliant volley inside the left post from the edge of the box, leaving the goalkeeper helpless. Andre Carrillo provided the assist. What a finish! 2:3.

Goal! Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a low drive from the edge of the box into the middle of the net, leaving Heurelho Gomes beaten. The score is 2:4.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jesse Lingard as he is replaced by Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
It's a goal! Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 1:0.
Lee Probert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
It's in the back of the net! Matt Phillips plays it into the box, and Sam Field (West Brom) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 2:0.
Ciaran Clark (Newcastle Utd) rose high above the defence to head the ball over the goalkeeper and inside the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Rolando Aarons (Newcastle Utd) replaces Jacob Murphy.
Gary Megson has decided to substitute Gareth Barry and he is replaced by Claudio Yacob (West Brom).
We are about to witness a substitution. Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) is replacing Joselu.
Substitution. James McClean (West Brom) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Kieran Gibbs walks off.
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) replacing Isaac Hayden.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) puts the ball past his own goalkeeper.
It will be a substitution. Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) is ready to enter the pitch as Sam Field walks off.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Andre Marriner blows his whistle to start the second half.
Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Lewis Dunk (Brighton) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
It is time for a substitution. James McArthur (Crystal Palace) is on for Yohan Cabaye.
Chris Hughton decides to make a substitution. Jose Izquierdo will be replaced by Solomon March (Brighton).
The game has come to an end for Pascal Gross. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Isaiah Brown (Brighton).

Glenn Murray (Brighton) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the bottom left corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper. Brighton have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee signals a substitution. Tomer Hemed (Brighton) is brought on as a substitute for Glenn Murray.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) picks up a pass and gets to the edge of the box before clipping a brilliant lob over the goalkeeper and into the empty net. He makes it 1:0.

He should have scored! Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal is pretty weak and Kasper Schmeichel makes an easy save.
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Anthony Taylor ignores the protests.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) gets on the end of a defence splitting pass inside the box and immediately directs a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Kasper Schmeichel makes a great save.

Goal! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the left post. Hugo Lloris had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) is coming onto the pitch as Moussa Sissoko cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Mauricio Pochettino decides to make a substitution. Mousa Dembele will be replaced by Fernando Llorente (Tottenham).
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) is first to a rebound inside the 6-yard box, but he misdirects his shot well wide of the left post.
Riyad Mahrez comes off the pitch to be replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Here is a change. Christian Eriksen is going off and Mauricio Pochettino gives the last tactical orders to Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Goal! Harry Kane (Tottenham) takes a short pass from Erik Lamela in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot into the top right corner. 2:1.

Fernando Llorente (Tottenham) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Leicester will have a goal kick.
It will be a substitution. Hamza Choudhury (Leicester) is ready to enter the pitch as Shinji Okazaki walks off.
Claude Puel has decided to make a change. Islam Slimani (Leicester) replaces Jamie Vardy.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Erik Lamela (Tottenham), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Kasper Schmeichel (Leicester) is booked by the referee.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) has a goal ruled out for offside!
It's an own goal! Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) unluckily beats his own goalkeeper.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Huddersfield concede a free kick following a bad challenge. The referee gives a penalty to Manchester City after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) calmly steps up and places the ball into the bottom right corner.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Jonas Lossl to get hold of the ball. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Manchester City will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield) sees a yellow card from Craig Pawson after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
OFF THE BAR! Leroy Sane (Manchester City) strikes a brilliant shot towards goal from the free kick, but his effort rattles the crossbar.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) receives a yellow card.
The foul by Scott Malone (Huddersfield) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Craig Pawson.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chris Lowe (Huddersfield) is coming onto the pitch as Scott Malone cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Vincent Kompany will be replaced by Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) replaces Tom Ince.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) gets on the end of a defence splitting pass inside the box and immediately directs a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Jonas Lossl makes a great save.
Goal! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 1:2.

Pointless reaction! Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) receives a red card for unsporting behaviour after the final whistle.
Although Leroy Sane (Manchester City) is just on the bench, Craig Pawson has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.

Steven Defour (Burnley) is punished with the yellow card.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) latches onto a long ball into the box and unleashes a fine volley at goal, but flashes the effort just over the bar. That would have been a great goal!
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Robbie Brady (Burnley), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Alex Iwobi will be replaced by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Steven Defour walks off the pitch to be replaced by Chris Wood (Burnley).
Here is a change. Alexandre Lacazette is going off and Arsene Wenger gives the last tactical orders to Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).

James Tarkowski (Burnley) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Lee Mason no option but to blow his whistle. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Arsenal.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) has a great chance inside the box following a rebound off a defender, but somehow he gets too much on the ball and it goes well wide of the right post.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) dribbles into the box, but Fraser Forster is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Leighton Baines leaves the pitch to be replaced by Ashley Williams (Everton).
Virgil Van Dijk (Southampton) finds enough space to climb high and plants a header well wide of the right post. What a poor effort.
Goal! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Everton) latches on to a precise pass on the edge of the box and fires a brilliant shot towards the top left corner that goes in off the post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) scores a goal. He rises to meet a cross and steers his header in off the crossbar.

Goal! Dusan Tadic hands Charlie Austin (Southampton) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the bottom right corner. 3:1.
Substitution. Kevin Mirallas walks off the pitch and Ademola Lookman (Everton) comes on as a substitute.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Michael Keane limps off the pitch to be replaced by Nikola Vlasic (Everton).

Substitution. Shane Long (Southampton) on for Charlie Austin.

Shane Long (Southampton) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the right side of the target as Jordan Pickford produces a good save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Southampton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
We are about to witness a substitution. Maya Yoshida (Southampton) is replacing Sofiane Boufal.
Steven Davis (Southampton) latches on to a superb pass and breaks through the defence before firing a shot from mid-range that goes past the goalkeeper inside the left post.

Eden Hazard (Chelsea) was close to scoring after a great solo effort and unleashed a promising shot from the edge of the penalty area. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Simon Mignolet showed his agility and saved this one. The ball is out of play and Chelsea manage to earn a corner.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) plays a lovely through ball to Daniel Drinkwater, but he can't beat Simon Mignolet and loses the ball.

Simon Mignolet receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the right side of the goal. Chelsea force their opponents to concede a corner.
The ball spins to Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) on the edge of the box. He hits across the ball and sends it goalwards, but it goes just wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain shows great vision to find Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom right corner. 1:0.

The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) will replace Daniel Drinkwater.

The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Willian (Chelsea) comes onto the pitch for Davide Zappacosta.

Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sadio Mane (Liverpool) replacing Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.

Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) unleashes a sweet first-timer from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal. The goalkeeper stops the shot with a quick save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Liverpool.

James McArthur (Crystal Palace) attempts to turn the rebound in from close range. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save and stops the ball from hitting the net. Great goalkeeping.

The game restarts for the second half.

Goal! Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Wayne Hennessey had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:1.
Goal - 1:1! Andros Townsend tees up Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Lee Grant.
The foul by Kevin Wimmer (Stoke City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Ramadan Sobhi and he is replaced by Peter Crouch (Stoke City).

Jese (Stoke City) picks up a lucky rebound inside the box from the clearance, beats an opponent but drills his shot inches wide of the left post.
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
Xherdan Shaqiri tees up Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) with a precision cross. He holds off the defender, but fires his shot just wide of the left post.

Jamie Vardy feeds the ball through to Marc Albrighton (Leicester), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!

Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. Corner kick. Stoke will have an opportunity.

Pascal Gross (Brighton) collects a delightful pass inside the box and nets with a perfect low drive into the middle of the goal. What a clinical finish!

Kurt Zouma (Stoke City) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the top left corner. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Kurt Zouma (Stoke City) has a reason to celebrate!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) gets booked.

Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Heurelho Gomes shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

James McArthur (Crystal Palace) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Jordan Pickford, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Anthony Taylor shows the yellow card to Oumar Niasse (Everton) for a heavy challenge.

Richarlison (Watford) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets inside the left post.

Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) makes a solo run and arrives in front of goal from where he releases a precise strike. He gets the ball past the goalkeeper, but one of the defenders arrives and clears the ball onto the post and away. The score remains the same.

The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Nathan Redmond (Southampton) gets to the rebound on the edge of the penalty area and fires a shot towards the left side of the goal, but Nick Pope gets a hand to it and keeps it out. Now Southampton have a corner.

Nathan Redmond (Southampton) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He latches on to a precise pass and fires a decent first-time shot towards the bottom left corner from a promising distance, but Nick Pope denies him. The linesman points to the corner flag, Southampton are going to take it.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.

Chance! Maya Yoshida (Southampton) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the top right corner, but Nick Pope is alert and makes a great save to deny him. Southampton have been awarded a corner kick.
Here's the change. Jeff Hendrick leaves the pitch and Ashley Barnes (Burnley) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. Chris Wood is going off and Sean Dyche gives the last tactical orders to Sam Vokes (Burnley).
A substitution has been made. Manolo Gabbiadini goes off and Charlie Austin (Southampton) comes on.
Substitution. Shane Long (Southampton) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Dusan Tadic walks off.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the right post. Excellent finish.
Substitution. Sofiane Boufal will be replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A yellow card for a tackle by Federico Fernandez (Swansea). Michael Dean doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
It's in the back of the net! Anthony Knockaert plays it into the box, and Glenn Murray (Brighton) gets on the end of the cross to put it inside the right post. 0:1.

Dale Stephens (Brighton) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. Brighton force a corner. They send men into the box.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Lewis Dunk (Brighton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Tammy Abraham (Swansea) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort.
It will be a substitution. Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) is ready to enter the pitch as Thomas Carroll walks off.
Sam Clucas (Swansea) gets a yellow card. The referee Michael Dean made the right call.
Substitution. Solomon March (Brighton) has come on for Jose Izquierdo.
Substitution. Tomer Hemed (Brighton) on for Glenn Murray.
Paul Clement has decided to substitute Jordan Ayew and he is replaced by Oliver McBurnie (Swansea).
Here is a change. Sam Clucas is going off and Paul Clement gives the last tactical orders to Wayne Routledge (Swansea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pascal Gross departs the field of play to be replaced by Isaiah Brown (Brighton).
What a chance that is! Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the crossbar!
That's it for today, Michael Dean has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box to the bottom right corner, but Kasper Schmeichel shows his agility and makes a save.
Goal! Iborra (Leicester) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 0:1.
That was close! Iborra (Leicester) makes a good run into the centre of the box and gets his head onto a lofted pass, but sends the ball a fraction over the bar.

Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) controls the ball on the edge of the box after a superb low pass by Maxim Choupo-Moting. He makes a yard for himself and fires a wonderful strike into the bottom left corner via the post. 1:1!
The match has reached half-time.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
A long pass from defence releases Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) on the edge of the box, but his snap shot somehow flies just past the right post. The crowd thought it was in!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) is coming onto the pitch as Shinji Okazaki cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the bottom left corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.

Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Jack Butland is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:2.
Iborra is substituted due to injury. Claude Puel gives a chance to Andy King (Leicester).
Substitution. Ramadan Sobhi is replaced by Peter Crouch (Stoke City).
Gooal! Xherdan Shaqiri takes over corner duties. Peter Crouch (Stoke City) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the bottom left corner. 2:2.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) bursts into the box, cuts inside his man and sends an effort just past the right post.
Substitution. Demarai Gray will be replaced by Marc Albrighton (Leicester).
Here is a change. Mame Diouf is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
A goal, which was scored by Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester), was disallowed due to offside.
Jonathan Moss is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) latches onto a rebound in the box and fires a shot a whisker wide of the right post. That was a promising chance and maybe he should have done better! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Newcastle.
Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.

Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Nick Pope pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball is out of play. Newcastle win a corner kick.
Michael Dean shows the yellow card to Jack Cork (Burnley) for a heavy challenge.
It's in the back of the net! Johann Gudmundsson plays it into the box, and Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the roof of the net. 1:0.
The foul by James Tarkowski (Burnley) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Ayoze Perez will be replaced by Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd).
