Matt Ritchie goes off the pitch and Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
Here is a change. Mohamed Diame is going off and Rafael Benitez gives the last tactical orders to Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd).
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Rob Elliot was alert and the score remained the same.

A neat pass is well received by Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot. The ball goes out of play and Newcastle have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Demarai Gray (Leicester) makes a yard for himself and attempts to endanger the goalkeeper with a long-range shot. His great effort, however, goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Wes Morgan (Leicester) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. Leicester force their opponents to concede a corner.

Jordan Pickford doesn't have to worry about this one. Demarai Gray plays a pass into the feet of Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
Goal - 1:0! Riyad Mahrez laid the ball off to Jamie Vardy (Leicester), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The foul by Tom Davies (Everton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) aims for the middle of the goal, but that's an easy job for the goalkeeper. It will take more than that to test him!
Goal! Demarai Gray (Leicester) collected a pass and decided to try his luck from distance. The shot was deflected and it was enough to turn the ball past helpless Jordan Pickford. 2:0.

Kevin Mirallas (Everton) receives a pass then lets rip from long range towards the left of the goal, but Kasper Schmeichel watches it all the way and makes an easy save. The referee signals a corner kick to Everton.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.

Oumar Niasse (Everton) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Oumar Niasse (Everton) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. Everton are awarded a corner kick.

James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) lashes in a mid-range free kick and his effort crashes against the left post. That was an excellent shot, but unfortunately for him it didn't end up in the back of the net.
Steven Davis (Southampton) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Shane Duffy (Brighton) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!

The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
It's a goal! Glenn Murray (Brighton) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Pascal Gross and scores magnificently from close range into the top left corner. 1:1.

Wesley Hoedt (Southampton) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.

Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee points to the corner flag and Southampton will take a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sofiane Boufal leaves the pitch and Nathan Redmond (Southampton) comes on.

He should have scored! Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot towards the middle of the goal is pretty weak and Asmir Begovic makes an easy save. Jordan Ayew (Swansea) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Petr Cech. The ball goes out of play. Swansea are awarded a corner kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal) latches on to a killer pass deep inside the box and coolly puts the ball inside the right post!
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Tammy Abraham (Swansea) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.

Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Swansea.
Goal! Sead Kolasinac plays a simple square pass into the feet of Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) in the box, who composes himself and lashes the ball into the bottom left corner. 2:1.

Granit Xhaka tees up Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) with a precision cross. He holds off the defender, but fires his shot just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Swansea will have a goal kick.

Roy Hodgson is forced to make a change. Patrick van Aanholt is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Crystal Palace).
Goal! Aaron Cresswell displays great vision and sends a pass to Chicharito (West Ham), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 0:1.
James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) wastes a huge opportunity. He attempts to knock a rebound inside the left post with a delicate header, but Joe Hart dives to keep the ball from hitting the net.
Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace) fails to turn the rebound in as the goalkeeper pulls off a great save to keep him out. Now Crystal Palace have a corner.
Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) sees a yellow card from Robert Madley after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Goal! Andre Ayew (West Ham) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the top left corner. Julian Speroni had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:2.
Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) blows a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the left post.

The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Successful penalty kick! Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) coolly slotted in, giving the goalkeeper no chance.

Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the left post! A few inches to the right and it could have been a sweet goal!

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Joe Hart makes a great save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal.
Substitution. Joel Ward makes his way off the pitch and Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) comes on as his replacement.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) picks up the rebound just a few yards out of the box. He attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a fine shot, but the goalkeeper is on hand to deny him.

Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Joe Hart to dive and make a save. The ball is out of play. Crystal Palace win a corner kick.
Robert Madley shows the yellow card to Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) for a heavy challenge.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Arthur Masuaku (West Ham), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
CHANCE! James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!

An amazing individual effort from Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 2:2. Joe Hart was helpless.
Robert Madley is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

David Wagner is forced to make a change. Rajiv van La Parra is unable to continue due to injury, Elias Kachunga (Huddersfield) comes on.
Tom Smith (Huddersfield) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Kevin Friend blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY! Wonderful opportunity to score for Liverpool.
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Tom Smith (Huddersfield) for a heavy challenge.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) doesn't take advantage of the chance to score from the penalty spot. He shoots to the bottom right corner, but Jonas Lossl leaps out to thwart his effort.
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) gets to a rebound in the six-yard box and his effort crashes in off the left post!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Goal! Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) gets to the ball inside the box, sees the goalkeeper off his line and lifts the ball over him and into the back of the net. 1:0.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by James Milner. His header bounced off the ground and went inside the left post behind the goalkeeper. It's 2:0.
The substitution has been made. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) has replaced Roberto Firmino.

David Wagner has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florent Hadergjonaj (Huddersfield) replacing Tom Smith.
Substitution. Daniel Sturridge will be replaced by Emre Can (Liverpool).
Mohamed Salah passes the ball into the penalty area. Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) collects it and quickly sends it into the top right corner via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 3:0!
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Mohamed Salah is replaced by Dominic Solanke (Liverpool).
Kevin Friend is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Richarlison (Watford) watches the ball all the way and fires a first-time shot goalwards from inside the box, but the effort flies just wide of the left post.
Kiko (Watford) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.

The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City) is given a yellow card.

Mame Diouf (Stoke City) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) tries his luck with a shot from long range, and his superb effort rattles the right post!

Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Leroy Sane (Manchester City) volleys the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but one of the defenders blocks his shot.
Fernandinho feeds the ball through to Leroy Sane (Manchester City), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the right side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!

That was a nice football moment. David Silva (Manchester City) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Ben Foster guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
GOAL! Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Ederson, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:1.
Goal! Fernandinho (Manchester City) collected a pass and decided to try his luck from distance. The shot was deflected and it was enough to turn the ball past helpless Ben Foster. 1:2.

David Silva (Manchester City) is unable to keep his close-range header down and sends the cross from Kevin De Bruyne just over the bar.
Great ball in from Jay Rodriguez. Salomon Rondon (West Brom) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) attempts to discuss the decision with Mike Jones, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.

Dele Alli (Tottenham) smacks a great volley at goal from inside the box, but sends the effort just wide of the left post.
Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the right post!
Goal! Romelu Lukaku gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Anthony Martial (Manchester United), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 1:0.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) for Ashley Young.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Kieran Trippier passes to Harry Kane (Tottenham), who gets one-on-one with the keeper. His dummy grounds the keeper and he has a simple task lifting the ball over him into the net.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Harry Kane, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:0.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!

Sensational! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box onto the bottom of the left post and into the net. The assist goes to Jordan Henderson and the score changes to 2:1.

Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) was in a good shooting position inside the six-yard box and produced a first-time shot low towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper made an astonishing save to thwart him.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) replaces Dejan Lovren.
A yellow card for a tackle by Emre Can (Liverpool). Andre Marriner doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. A free kick to Tottenham.

Goal! Dele Alli (Tottenham) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. Simon Mignolet is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 3:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick low strike towards the middle of the goal that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a superb goal-line clearance.
Goal! Harry Kane (Tottenham) slots the ball into an unguarded net from close range after a shot rebounds off a defender. 4:1.

What a great touch by Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) after latching on to a precise pass on the edge of the box! He finds some space and rips a shot towards the top left corner. The goalkeeper makes an astonishing save, knocking the ball onto the post.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Heung-Min Son and he is replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
Hugo Lloris pulls off a great save to deny James Milner (Liverpool), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) replacing Roberto Firmino.

Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) receives a precise pass inside the box and drills a promising first-time blast towards the middle of the goal. His effort is blocked by Hugo Lloris who dives to keep the ball out. What a save!
It is time for a substitution. Eric Dier (Tottenham) is on for Christian Eriksen.
Here is a change. Emre Can is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Marko Grujic (Liverpool).
That will be all from Harry Kane who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Fernando Llorente (Tottenham).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom right corner. However, Jordan Pickford anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save. Arsenal will take a corner kick.
A pass into the box finds Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) unmarked. He carefully places a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Jordan Pickford denies him.
Wayne Rooney (Everton) struck from medium range. He smashed the ball inside the left post. What a hit! Pure magic.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Ashley Williams (Everton) for his blatant foul. A free kick is awarded to Arsenal.
Yellow card. Idrissa Gueye (Everton) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Goal! Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. The ball is out of play. Arsenal will have a chance to score from a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Ronald Koeman decided to make a change. Ashley Williams is replaced by Tom Davies (Everton).

Goal – 1:2! Alexis Sanchez sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the net via the underside of the crossbar.
Idrissa Gueye (Everton) does not realise that he has already received a yellow card and is shocked when the referee shows him a second one!
It's a goal! Mesut Ozil plays the ball to the feet of Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal), who hits a tremendous first-time shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out. 1:3.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Wayne Rooney will be replaced by Ademola Lookman (Everton).
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Dominic Calvert-Lewin and he is replaced by Oumar Niasse (Everton).
Alexandre Lacazette will be replaced by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Mesut Ozil is replaced by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) has a great chance on the edge of the six-yard box following a lofted pass, but his header lacks accuracy and flies just past the right post.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar.
Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Goal! Jack Wilshere manages to prod the ball to Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) after a melee inside the box, and he needs no second invitation to slot the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:4.
Goal! Petr Cech makes a huge mistake and Oumar Niasse (Everton) has an easy task to put the ball into the back of the net. 2:4.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and fires the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. His low drive went into the bottom left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) latches onto a rebound in the box and fires a shot a whisker wide of the right post. That was a promising chance and maybe he should have done better!
Graham Scott blows his whistle after Oriol Romeu (Southampton) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. A free kick to West Brom.

CHANCE! Manolo Gabbiadini finds Shane Long (Southampton) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Brom.
Jonny Evans just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Allan Nyom (West Brom) replaces him.
Maya Yoshida (Southampton) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the middle of the goal is comfortably saved by the goalkeeper.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gareth McAuley (West Brom) replacing Gareth Barry.
Today's referee Graham Scott rightly decides to book Nacer Chadli (West Brom) for his harsh tackle.
Mauricio Pellegrino has decided to make a change. Nathan Redmond (Southampton) replaces Oriol Romeu.

A neat pass is well received by Dusan Tadic (Southampton), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Fraser Forster makes a brilliant save! Nacer Chadli (West Brom) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the top of the net. Good work from West Brom as they win a corner.
Here is a change. Nacer Chadli is going off and Tony Pulis gives the last tactical orders to Matt Phillips (West Brom).
Substitution. Charlie Austin (Southampton) has come on for Shane Long.
It's time for a substitution. Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) comes on in place of Dusan Tadic.

Goal! Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Ben Foster had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:0.
What a chance that is! Charlie Austin (Southampton) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Tom Smith (Huddersfield) gets a yellow card.
The booking goes to Anthony Martial (Manchester United).
Christopher Schindler (Huddersfield) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Lee Mason didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Phil Jones limps off the pitch to be replaced by Victor Lindelof (Manchester United).
Tom Ince (Huddersfield) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the left post is smartly dealt with by David de Gea.
Goal! Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.
Goal! The ball breaks to Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) after some poor defending, he finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and calmly puts the ball into the back of the net! He makes it 2:0.
David Wagner is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Elias Kachunga suffers an injury and Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) comes on.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The game is over for Anthony Martial. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) comes on for the second half.
Jose Mourinho has made a change at the break. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) has come on in place of Juan Manuel Mata.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Ashley Young (Manchester United), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A yellow card for a tackle by Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield). Lee Mason doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) is coming onto the pitch as Laurent Depoitre cannot continue after picking up an injury.
It's in! Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) finds space in the box and from close range powers an unstoppable header into the bottom left corner after a cheeky lofted pass from Romelu Lukaku. 2:1.
Daniel Williams (Huddersfield) attempts to discuss the decision with Lee Mason, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Here is a change. Tom Ince is going off and David Wagner gives the last tactical orders to Scott Malone (Huddersfield).
A decent cross into the box is met first time by Chris Smalling (Manchester United), but his powerful goalbound effort is superbly blocked by a defender.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Sean Dyche is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Chris Wood suffers an injury and Ashley Barnes (Burnley) comes on.

What an opportunity! Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the middle of the goal, but Nick Pope reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Nick Pope (Burnley) brings his opponent down. Roger East has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. Manchester City are about to take a penalty!
The game is interrupted. James Tarkowski (Burnley) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The referee gives a yellow card to Leroy Sane (Manchester City).
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Nick Pope into right side of the goal.
Roger East shows the yellow card to Fernandinho (Manchester City) for a heavy challenge.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Nick Pope is alert and denies him.
Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Roger East starts the second half.
Jack Cork (Burnley) says something out of turn to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Roger East shows a yellow card to Ashley Barnes (Burnley) for a tough tackle.
Sean Dyche has decided to substitute Jeff Hendrick and he is replaced by Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley).

David Silva (Manchester City) picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and directs a sweet strike towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper, however, makes a stunning save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Manchester City will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner kick and scores with a great header into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper had no chance to react. The score is now 2:0.

It's in the back of the net! Kevin De Bruyne slips the ball through to Leroy Sane (Manchester City), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 3:0.
Today's match ends for Sergio Aguero who will be replaced by Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City).
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Fernandinho is replaced by Yaya Toure (Manchester City).
The referee signals a substitution. Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Kevin De Bruyne.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the middle of the goal. However, he couldn't beat Nick Pope, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Sean Dyche has decided to make a change. Ashley Westwood (Burnley) replaces Steven Defour.

Close! Leroy Sane (Manchester City) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Burnley will have a goal kick.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Florian Lejeune (Newcastle Utd) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) was probably a bit loose with his words to Stuart Attwell, who decides to show him a yellow.
Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The ball breaks to James McArthur (Crystal Palace) after a scramble in the box, but his first-time effort is immediately blocked.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Isaac Hayden walks off the pitch to be replaced by Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd).
The game is interrupted. Javier Manquillo (Newcastle Utd) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
CLOSE! Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) will replace Ayoze Perez.
The foul by Joselu (Newcastle Utd) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Stuart Attwell.

Julian Speroni makes a brilliant save! Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the right side of the goal but is saved by the keeper!
Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Julian Speroni stops the ball from going inside right post.
The substitution has been made. Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) has replaced Wilfried Zaha.
Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd) strikes a powerful volley towards goal, but one of the defenders blocks his attempt.
Rafael Benitez has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) replacing Joselu.

A perfectly taken corner kick. Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd) produces a fantastic bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes in off the crossbar, increasing the score of today's match – 1:0.
Roy Hodgson prepares a substitution. James McArthur is replaced by Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace).
Stuart Attwell is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the bottom left corner.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Lee Probert signals. It's a penalty to Bournemouth! Let's see who's going to take it.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) sends Jack Butland the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!

Mame Diouf (Stoke City) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Asmir Begovic inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the right side of the target, but was denied by a great save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Stoke.
The ball falls kindly for Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) inside the box and he goes for goal. It's a decent effort but flies just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Peter Crouch (Stoke City) replaces Glen Johnson.
Substitution. Lys Mousset will be replaced by Steve Cook (Bournemouth).
A sweet pass is collected by Mame Diouf (Stoke City) inside the penalty box and he unleashes a brilliant shot which goes into the roof of the net and behind the goalkeeper.
Lewis Cook (Bournemouth) gets a yellow card. The referee Lee Probert made the right call.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Harry Arter (Bournemouth) comes onto the pitch for Lewis Cook.
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Jese and he is replaced by Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
Substitution. Jordon Ibe walks off the pitch and Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) comes on as a substitute.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going into the roof of the net, but Lukasz Fabianski has other ideas and makes a brilliant save.
Christian Fuchs (Leicester) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went straight towards the roof of the net, but Lukasz Fabianski made an astonishing save! The ball goes out of play. Leicester are awarded a corner kick.
It's an own goal! An unlucky moment for Federico Fernandez (Swansea), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but heads the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Here's the change. Leon Britton leaves the pitch and Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) comes on as a substitute.

Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) meets a perfect cross from Riyad Mahrez deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:2.
Substitution. Luciano Narsingh leaves the pitch and is replaced by Nathan Dyer (Swansea).
Alfie Mawson (Swansea) finds himself in a very promising position after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and fires the ball inside the right post!
Michael Appleton has decided to substitute Shinji Okazaki and he is replaced by Andy King (Leicester).
Substitution. Renato Sanches walks off the pitch and Wayne Routledge (Swansea) comes on as a substitute.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Riyad Mahrez departs the field of play to be replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
So close! Wayne Routledge (Swansea) tries a curler from the edge of the box, but it slides just wide of the left post.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
A piece of footballing magic! Pedro (Chelsea) collected a precise pass and fired a shot towards the top left corner, bouncing in off the post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Jose Holebas (Watford) is booked by the referee.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) weaves through the defence and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score.
Jonathan Moss shows the yellow card to Adrian Mariappa (Watford) for a heavy challenge.
Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) sees a yellow card from Jonathan Moss after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) tries his luck with a long-range effort after receiving a precise pass. It goes to the left side of the goal, but Heurelho Gomes has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save. Chelsea force a corner. They send men into the box.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball inside the right post, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Richarlison (Watford) sprints into the box to get on the end of a cross and directs a shot goalwards that flies a whisker wide of the left post. Unlucky!
Goal - 1:2! Richarlison laid the ball off to Roberto Pereyra (Watford), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Richarlison (Watford) plants his close-range header just wide of the left post after a cross into the box.
Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) earns the yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) will replace Alvaro Morata.
Roberto Pereyra has picked up an injury and is replaced by Andre Carrillo (Watford).
Antonio Conte has decided to substitute Marcos Alonso and he is replaced by Willian (Chelsea).

Goal – 2:2! Pedro sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the left side of the goal.
The referee Jonathan Moss awards Kiko (Watford) a yellow card.
Here is a change. Troy Deeney is going off and Marco Silva gives the last tactical orders to Ben Watson (Watford).
Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) bursts into the box, cuts inside his man and sends an effort just over the bar.
Substitution. Pedro walks off the pitch and Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Willian puts the ball on the head of Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea), who has the easy task to score into an empty net. 3:2.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Andre Gray (Watford) for Adrian Mariappa.
Goal! Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 4:2. He was ably assisted there by Tiemoue Bakayoko.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit.

Pascal Gross sends a superb cross into the box. Glenn Murray (Brighton) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Joe Hart beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.

Winston Reid (West Ham) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to West Ham.
A yellow card for a tackle by Chicharito (West Ham). Martin Atkinson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Chicharito (West Ham) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him.
A long pass from defence releases Chicharito (West Ham) on the edge of the box, but his snap shot somehow flies just past the right post. The crowd thought it was in!
Joe Hart pulls off a great save to deny Glenn Murray (Brighton), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Lovely run from Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) who weaves his way through the defence and takes a shot from the edge of the box that goes inside the right post! What an amazing goal ladies and gentlemen!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Martin Atkinson blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Slaven Bilic decides to make a substitution. Cheikhou Kouyate will be replaced by Andre Ayew (West Ham).
Chris Hughton has decided to make a change. Solomon March (Brighton) replaces Jose Izquierdo.
Joe Hart pulls off a great save to deny Glenn Murray (Brighton), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner. Brighton win a corner.
Substitution. Marko Arnautovic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham).
Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Martin Atkinson blows his whistle for a foul. Brighton are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Glenn Murray (Brighton) sends Joe Hart the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Substitution. Isaiah Brown (Brighton) in, Pascal Gross out.
Solomon March (Brighton) has a shot blocked from inside the box. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Brighton.
Here comes a substitution. Ezequiel Schelotto (Brighton) is brought on as a substitute for Anthony Knockaert.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Ahmed Hegazy (West Brom) for his blatant foul.
Danny Simpson (Leicester) collects the ball on the edge of the box and produces a precise shot which would have ended inside the left post, if Glyn Oliver Myhill hadn't pulled off a wonderful save.
Michael Dean has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Glyn Oliver Myhill (West Brom) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.

Harry Maguire (Leicester) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt into the bottom corner fails to beat Glyn Oliver Myhill, who makes a sensational save. The ball is out of play. Leicester will have a chance to score from a corner.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) latches onto a short pass from Marc Albrighton inside the box, but clips his shot high over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Brom.
Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Nacer Chadli (West Brom) scores a beautiful goal from the resulting free kick. He bends the ball into the top right corner. A technically stunning goal.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Craig Shakespeare has decided to substitute Kelechi Iheanacho and he is replaced by Islam Slimani (Leicester).
Substitution. Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) has come on for Danny Simpson.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!
The manager makes a subsitution with Gareth McAuley (West Brom) coming on for Nacer Chadli.
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. James McClean (West Brom) replaces Jay Rodriguez.
Craig Shakespeare has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Andy King (Leicester) replacing Iborra.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

After a goalmouth scramble Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) wins the ball and unleashes a powerful and precise effort into the back of the net, beating the helpless goalkeeper. A wonderful football moment.
DeAndre Yedlin (Newcastle Utd) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Kevin Friend has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) finds the back of the net with a strike from the edge of the penalty box, with the ball finding the bottom right corner of the goal.
Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom right corner, but Fraser Forster has other ideas and makes a brilliant save.
Goal! Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:2.
Substitution. Nathan Redmond will be replaced by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).
Rafael Benitez has decided to substitute Ayoze Perez and he is replaced by Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd).
Here is a change. Oriol Romeu is going off and Mauricio Pellegrino gives the last tactical orders to Steven Davis (Southampton).
Substitution. Dwight Gayle (Newcastle Utd) in, Joselu out.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and signals a foul after Florian Lejeune (Newcastle Utd) brought his opponent down. Southampton are given a huge opportunity to score - it's a penalty kick!
Goal! Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Rob Elliot into right side of the goal.
Caution goes to Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton).
Today's referee Kevin Friend rightly decides to book Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) for his harsh tackle.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) plants a goal-bound header towards the left post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away.
Substitution. Mame Diouf makes way for Glen Johnson (Stoke City).

Jose Rondon (West Brom) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Heurelho Gomes with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the right side of the goal. The score is 2:0.
Andre Carrillo (Watford) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.

The referee signals a substitution. Jake Livermore (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Chris Brunt.
Marco Silva decides to make a substitution. Etienne Capoue will be replaced by Roberto Pereyra (Watford).
A substitution has been made. Jose Rondon is replaced by Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom).
Marco Silva has decided to make a change. Andre Gray (Watford) replaces Andre Carrillo.
Jake Livermore (West Brom) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.
The whistle blows and James McClean (West Brom) is booked for an infringement.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds Richarlison (Watford), who rises and produces an amazing header into the top of the net.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Andre Ayew (West Ham) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Lukasz Fabianski anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the left side of the target.
Joe Hart hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Wilfried Bony (Swansea) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Roger East shows a yellow card to Renato Sanches (Swansea) for his blatant foul.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Roger East blows his whistle to start the second half.
Paul Clement has made a change at the break. Leroy Fer (Swansea) has come on in place of Wilfried Bony.
Leon Britton (Swansea) gets a yellow card.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Roger East had an easy-decision to make.
The game has begun to heat up. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Substitution. Mark Noble is replaced by Manuel Lanzini (West Ham).
Leon Britton is being substituted because of an injury. Paul Clement sends Roque Mesa (Swansea) on the pitch.
The referee signals a substitution. Diafra Sakho (West Ham) is brought on as a substitute for Chicharito.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) comes onto the pitch for Andre Ayew.
Here comes a substitution. Martin Olsson is given a rest as he is replaced by Sam Clucas (Swansea).
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) converts a killer cross with a curling shot inside the right post! What a perfect finish!
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Tom Smith (Huddersfield) dribbled past his opponents before finding himself in a great position to strike. His attempt from just outside of the box went towards the left side of the goal, but it wasn't dangerous and Hugo Lloris made a comfortable save.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Jonas Lossl with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.
Goal! Ben Davies (Tottenham) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 0:2.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Jonas Lossl.

Goal! Harry Kane (Tottenham) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the left post. Jonas Lossl had no chance of reaching it. The score is 0:3.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the left post.
A goal, which was scored by Harry Kane (Tottenham), was disallowed due to offside.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes against the crossbar!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
It's a yellow card for Dele Alli (Tottenham).
David Wagner has decided to make a change. Scott Malone (Huddersfield) replaces Chris Lowe.
Substitution. Aaron Mooy makes his way off the pitch and Philip Billing (Huddersfield) comes on as his replacement.
Yellow card. Elias Kachunga (Huddersfield) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Substitution. Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) has come on for Christian Eriksen.
Substitution. Jonathan Hogg walks off the pitch and Dean Whitehead (Huddersfield) comes on as a substitute.
Mauricio Pochettino prepares a substitution. Kieran Trippier is replaced by Kyle Walker-Peters (Tottenham).
Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Jonas Lossl, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Substitution. Harry Kane is replaced by Heung-Min Son (Tottenham).
Goal - 0:4! Ben Davies tees up Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Jonas Lossl.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Brom.

Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) suddenly has an opportunity to surge into the box after the opposition's defenders leave him in an ocean of space. He unleashes a shot towards the bottom right corner, but Petr Cech pulls off a fabulous save to deflect the ball onto the post.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) takes the free kick from just outside the box and unleashes a fine shot to the roof of the net, but his effort is thwarted by Ben Foster who parries it onto the post.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Today's referee Robert Madley rightly decides to book Jonny Evans (West Brom) for his harsh tackle. West Brom earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) argues with the referee and is booked for dissent.
Half-chance! Gareth Barry (West Brom) plays a pass into the box, but Petr Cech reacts well to snuff out the attack. West Brom force their opponents to concede a corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Madley has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Robert Madley shows the yellow card to Craig Dawson (West Brom) for a heavy challenge.

That's unlucky! Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) beautifully controls a pass and from the edge of the box drills a shot in on goal, but it's inadvertently blocked by a defender and cleared. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Arsenal.
The foul by Grzegorz Krychowiak (West Brom) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Madley.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jake Livermore walks off the pitch to be replaced by James Morrison (West Brom).
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. Salomon Rondon (West Brom) replaces Hal Robson-Kanu.

Allan Nyom (West Brom) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Robert Madley blows his whistle for an infringement. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Arsenal.
Allan Nyom (West Brom) sees a yellow card from Robert Madley after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal! Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Ben Foster into the bottom right corner.
Alexis Sanchez whips the ball in and it arrives at the feet of Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal), whose wild shot goes way over the crossbar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Matt Phillips (West Brom) will replace Allan Nyom.
Substitution. Alexandre Lacazette did his best and is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Alexis Sanchez will be replaced by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aaron Ramsey departs the field of play to be replaced by Ainsley Maitland-Niles (Arsenal).
That's it for today, Robert Madley has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) controls the ball from the corner kick and takes a shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper has a clear sight of the shot and thwarts him with a comfortable save.
Pascal Gross (Brighton) finds his way to a rebound inside the six-yard box thanks to his strength and unleashes a strike towards goal, but it ricochets away off one of his teammates.
The foul by Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.
A rebound spins to Joselu (Newcastle Utd) inside the box, but his sliced shot flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Brighton.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Andre Marriner starts the second half.
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Dale Stephens and Tomer Hemed (Brighton) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 1:0.

Today's referee Andre Marriner rightly decides to book Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) for his harsh tackle.

Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the middle of the goal. However, Simon Mignolet anticipates the shot and makes a decent save.

Good touch by Emre Can (Liverpool) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.
Goal! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Philippe Coutinho and easily beat the keeper with a header into the right side of the goal from close range. 0:1.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) scores a great goal from the resulting free kick from mid-range. He sends the ball directly inside the left post.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Joel Matip (Liverpool) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Andy King (Leicester) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the roof of the net, but Simon Mignolet pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him. Leicester earn a corner.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) scores from the corner kick. The ball slipped through the box to Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) and he slotted it past the goalkeeper.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Anthony Taylor starts the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) was quite harsh and Anthony Taylor didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Riyad Mahrez. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Here is a change. Roberto Firmino is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool).

Goal! Daniel Sturridge finds Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous shot into the middle of the goal. Fantasy football! 1:3.
Demarai Gray (Leicester) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the middle of the goal, but Simon Mignolet was alert and made an amazing save!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 2:3.
It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Leicester! Simon Mignolet (Liverpool) trips an opposition player and Anthony Taylor signals a foul.
Simon Mignolet (Liverpool) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the middle of the goal, but only into the gloves of a well-prepared Simon Mignolet.
Emre Can comes off the pitch to be replaced by James Milner (Liverpool).
Craig Shakespeare has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) replacing Shinji Okazaki.

Craig Shakespeare decides to make a substitution. Marc Albrighton will be replaced by Islam Slimani (Leicester).
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

The referee has issued a yellow card to Abdelhamid Sabiri (Huddersfield).
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Jack Cork (Burnley), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Scott Arfield (Burnley) was quite harsh and Chris Kavanagh didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

A wonderful piece of skill! Joshua King (Bournemouth) scores with a sublime individual effort. He skips past defenders, smashes the ball from the edge of the box and it goes towards the bottom left corner, bouncing in off the post. The goalkeeper dived to stop the ball, but couldn't reach it.

Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Jordan Pickford to get hold of the ball.
Ronald Koeman has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Tom Davies (Everton) replacing Davy Klaassen.
Substitution. Oumar Niasse (Everton) has come on for Wayne Rooney.
Tom Davies (Everton) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The substitution has been made. Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) has replaced Jermain Defoe.
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. Cuco Martina will be replaced by Jonjoe Kenny (Everton).
Goal! Oumar Niasse (Everton) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Tom Davies, then sends the ball inside the right post. 1:1.
Joshua King comes off the pitch to be replaced by Steve Cook (Bournemouth).
What was Oumar Niasse (Everton) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
What a great touch by Tom Davies (Everton) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
After some poor defending, Oumar Niasse (Everton) gets to a rebound and plants a header towards the left side of the goal, but Asmir Begovic dives to stop the effort. Brilliant goalkeeping!
Goal! Oumar Niasse (Everton) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:1.
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Nathan Ake and he is replaced by Lys Mousset (Bournemouth).
Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) watches the ball all the way and fires a first-time shot goalwards from inside the box, but the effort flies just over the bar.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Martin Atkinson's book.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Fernandinho (Manchester City) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the middle of the goal, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Wayne Hennessey. What a save!

Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Ederson pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.
A yellow card for a tackle by Benjamin Mendy (Manchester City). Neil Swarbrick doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Close! Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Benjamin Mendy limps off the pitch to be replaced by Danilo (Manchester City).
CHANCE! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) fires just over the crossbar from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Leroy Sane.

David Silva produces a sweet pass and picks out Leroy Sane (Manchester City) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:0!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal - 2:0! Leroy Sane laid the ball off to Raheem Sterling (Manchester City), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Close! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Danilo (Manchester City), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) in, Yohan Cabaye out.
Goal! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 3:0. He was ably assisted there by Sergio Aguero.
Here is a change. Raheem Sterling is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Bernardo Silva (Manchester City).
The substitution has been made. Fabian Delph (Manchester City) has replaced John Stones.
Roy Hodgson is forced to make a change. Christian Benteke is unable to continue due to injury, Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) comes on.
Leroy Sane (Manchester City) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Goal! Leroy Sane picks out Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) in the box with a decent cross, and he scores in the middle of the goal with a header from close range. 4:0.
Fabian Delph (Manchester City) collects a good pass and slams the ball from mid-range into the top right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Neil Swarbrick is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Goal! Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) executes a long-range free kick. His well-taken effort flies only inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
Shane Long (Southampton) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Ashley Young (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.

Ander Herrera (Manchester United) is put clean through inside the box by Romelu Lukaku, but he gets right under the ball and sends it just over the bar. Should have been a goal!
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) receives a yellow card!
Shane Long goes off the pitch and Charlie Austin (Southampton) comes on.
Mauricio Pellegrino decides to make a substitution. Cedric Soares will be replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Marcus Rashford will be replaced by Daley Blind (Manchester United).
The match has just finished.

Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) meets a perfect cross from Cesar Azpilicueta on the edge of the penalty area and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike straight into the bottom right corner. It's 0:1.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Pedro (Chelsea) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
The referee Michael Dean awards Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) a yellow card.
The whistle blows and Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) is booked for an infringement.
It's a yellow card for N'Golo Kante (Chelsea).
Substitution. Marcos Alonso leaves the pitch and is replaced by Gary Cahill (Chelsea).
Mark Hughes decides to make a substitution. Jese will be replaced by Peter Crouch (Stoke City).
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Pedro.
Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Willian is replaced by Eden Hazard (Chelsea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bruno Martins Indi leaves the pitch and Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) comes on.
Goal! Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) dribbles into the box then perfectly lifts the ball over the goalkeeper and into the net. He couldn't do anything to stop that cheeky lob. 0:3.
Goal! Cesar Azpilicueta puts the ball on a plate for Alvaro Morata (Chelsea), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:4.
Good chance! Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored!
Caution goes to Peter Crouch (Stoke City).

The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Marco Silva gives a chance to Molla Wague (Watford) and Etienne Capoue is off.

GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Richarlison (Watford) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 1:2.

Goal! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Joe Hart is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 0:3.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Serge Aurier (Tottenham).
GOAL! The corner comes over and Jose Fonte wins a simple header before Chicharito (West Ham) nods the ball into the back of the net. 1:3.

Ashley Williams (Everton) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game. Manchester Utd will look to take advantage of a free kick in a promising position in the middle of the field.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) unleashed a brilliant free kick from the edge of the box and hits the left post of the goal.
It's time for a substitution. Sandro Ramirez (Everton) comes on in place of Tom Davies.

Eric Bailly (Manchester United) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Wayne Rooney.

Goal Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United)! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) was put through by Romelu Lukaku and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. 2:0.
Here comes a substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan is given a rest as he is replaced by Anthony Martial (Manchester United).
Gooal! Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Jesse Lingard. He makes it 3:0.

The referee blows his whistle after Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) does a good impression of a basketball player and handles the ball. The referee points to the penalty spot. Manchester Utd are awarded a penalty kick!

The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) pings a header narrowly wide of the left post from around the penalty spot following a decent cross.

Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot low towards the middle of the goal. However, Thibaut Courtois anticipates the shot and makes an easy save.
Pedro (Chelsea) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Petr Cech is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.

Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the right post. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the right post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) is left with the simplest of tasks from close in after a lucky rebound off one of his own teammates, but somehow he skies his shot high over the bar.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Pedro comes off for Tiemoue Bakayoko (Chelsea).
David Luiz (Chelsea) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.
Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) was probably a bit loose with his words to Michael Oliver, who decides to show him a yellow.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) will replace Alexandre Lacazette.
Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Eden Hazard (Chelsea) replacing Willian.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) comes onto the pitch after Danny Welbeck signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alex Iwobi trots off the pitch and is replaced by Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal).
Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
David Luiz (Chelsea) knows that the game is over for him after receiving a red card from the referee for fouling his opponent!
A substitution has been made. Alvaro Morata is replaced by Andreas Christensen (Chelsea).
Sead Kolasinac (Arsenal) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Oliver ignores the protests.
Michael Oliver is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom right corner only for Lukasz Fabianski to dive and make a save. Tottenham have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Great save! Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the left side of the goal was brilliantly saved by Lukasz Fabianski. Tottenham will take a corner kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a great save to deny Heung-Min Son (Tottenham), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Paul Clement has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Leroy Fer (Swansea) replacing Renato Sanches.
The foul by Mike van der Hoorn (Swansea) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.
Mauricio Pochettino prepares a substitution. Moussa Sissoko is replaced by Serge Aurier (Tottenham).

Harry Kane (Tottenham) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. The referee blows his whistle, Tottenham are awarded a corner kick.

Mauricio Pochettino decides to make a substitution. Heung-Min Son will be replaced by Fernando Llorente (Tottenham).

Michael Dean shows the yellow card to Thomas Carroll (Swansea) for a heavy challenge.
Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) fails to control his temper and is booked by the referee for dissent.
Kieran Trippier (Tottenham) bends the ball in from the edge of the box which worries the keeper, but it eventually sails just wide of the left post.
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Wayne Routledge (Swansea) for his harsh tackle.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The game has begun to heat up. Christopher Schindler (Huddersfield) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Laurent Depoitre (Huddersfield) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) converts the penalty with a bullet of a shot into the middle of the net.
Zanka (Huddersfield) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) on for Marc Albrighton.
Here is a change. Kelechi Iheanacho is going off and Craig Shakespeare gives the last tactical orders to Shinji Okazaki (Leicester).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Elias Kachunga will be replaced by Collin Quaner (Huddersfield).
Tom Ince (Huddersfield) strikes a shot towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it flies just wide of the left post.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Today's match ends for Abdelhamid Sabiri who will be replaced by Jonathan Hogg (Huddersfield).

David Wagner has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield) replacing Laurent Depoitre.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Goal! Robbie Brady tees up Scott Arfield (Burnley) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:1.

Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) meets a perfect cross from Emre Can deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.
What a huge chance for Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The referee Roger East awards Nick Pope (Burnley) a yellow card.

Roberto Firmino will be replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool).
Ben Mee (Burnley) meets a cross on the edge of the box and produces a header towards the middle of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.

Ben Mee (Burnley) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the bottom left corner. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.

Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Nick Pope, who pulls off a stunning save!
Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Sean Dyche has decided to substitute Steven Defour and he is replaced by Ashley Westwood (Burnley).

That's it for today, Roger East has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd) meets a perfect cross from Matt Ritchie deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.

Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Joselu (Newcastle Utd) sprints into the box to get on the end of a cross and directs a shot goalwards that flies a whisker wide of the right post. Unlucky!
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Kevin Wimmer (Stoke City), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!

Joselu (Newcastle Utd) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball low towards the middle of the goal. However, he couldn't beat Jack Butland, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
The match has reached half-time.

Joselu (Newcastle Utd) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.

Joe Allen slides a pass towards Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) who unleashes a fabulous shot from long range. The ball goes behind the surprised goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner. The score is now 1:1.
A goal, which was scored by Ayoze Perez (Newcastle Utd), was disallowed due to offside.

Rob Elliot pulls off a fantastic save! Mame Diouf (Stoke City) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out. Good work from Stoke as they win a corner.

Heurelho Gomes stretches to his right and makes a brilliant save! Fernandinho (Manchester City) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the bottom left corner.

Perfectly taken free kick! Kevin De Bruyne sends a cross in and Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the bottom left corner and the score changes to 0:1.

Anthony Taylor blows his whistle and signals a foul after Christian Kabasele (Watford) brought his opponent down. Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Manchester City!

Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) for his blatant foul.

Problems for Slaven Bilic as James Collins is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) replaces him.
Ben Foster (West Brom) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
