Steven Davis (Southampton) picks up a rebound just outside the box, steadies himself and unleashes a shot that deflects off the post into the bottom left corner, beating the helpless goalkeeper.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Fraser Forster is alert and denies him.
Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post.

Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Crystal Palace) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Crystal Palace have a corner.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

The game restarts for the second half.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) did his best to latch onto a through ball, but it was too strong.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Fraser Forster pulls off a comfortable save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Crystal Palace are going to take it.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) for a tough tackle.
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Madley ignores the protests.

Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the middle of the target, but Mathew Ryan easily deals with the threat. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Brighton.

Dale Stephens (Brighton) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Pascal Gross shows his great technique and produces a beautiful cross into the box. Solomon March (Brighton) gets on the scoresheet by heading the ball precisely inside the right post. It's now 0:1.
It's time for a substitution. Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) comes on in place of Ryan Fraser.
Goal - 1:1! Jordon Ibe tees up Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Mathew Ryan.
It's 2:1! Jordon Ibe feeds Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the left side of the net.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Chicharito (West Ham) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Mathias Jorgensen (Huddersfield) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
James Collins (West Ham) connects with the free kick and produces a header goalwards which is well blocked. The goalkeeper doesn't have to worry about that one.

A rebound bounces out to Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) on the edge of the box, but he can't control his shot and it slips well wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Huddersfield.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Philip Billing (Huddersfield) for his blatant foul.

Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) has tested the patience of referee Kevin Friend and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Philip Billing (Huddersfield) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 30 metres out, but Joe Hart thwarts the effort which is headed to the bottom right corner.

Nice move, nice attempt! Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) is teed up with a simple pass after a nice flowing move. His first time shot from mid-range looks like it's going in but curls just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Huddersfield.

Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Alfie Mawson (Swansea) finds space in the box and tries a looping header at goal from the corner, but the ball goes just wide of the left post. Unlucky!

Kyle Naughton (Swansea) sees a yellow card from Mike Jones after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Thomas Carroll (Swansea) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Rob Elliot is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Jacob Murphy goes off the pitch and Christian Atsu (Newcastle Utd) comes on.

Tammy Abraham (Swansea) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Tammy Abraham (Swansea) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. Swansea are awarded a corner kick.

Rafael Benitez has decided to make a change. Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) replaces Isaac Hayden.

Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Chris Wood (Burnley) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 1:0.

Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) finds some space inside the box to connect with the resulting corner kick. He wallops the ball close to the left post, but it's finally blocked by one of the defenders. Maybe next time.

Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the right side of the goal. However, Jack Butland anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
Goal! 1:2. Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.

CHANCE! Jese (Stoke City) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a sublime shot towards David de Gea, but the goalkeeper stands tall and produces an excellent save. It will be a corner kick for Stoke.
Xherdan Shaqiri takes over corner duties and expertly finds Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 2:2.
Jose Mourinho decides to make a substitution. Ander Herrera will be replaced by Anthony Martial (Manchester United).
That's the end of the game for Marcus Rashford, who is replaced by Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United).
Here is a change. Jese is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort flies narrowly over the bar.
Substitution. Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) on for Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Goal! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Sead Kolasinac and easily beat the keeper with a header into the left side of the goal from close range. 1:0.

Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bournemouth.
Goal! Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) is teed up on the edge of the box by Danny Welbeck, and his howitzer of a shot into the top right corner gives the keeper no chance. 2:0.
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) fails to score from the rebound as the goalkeeper stops his effort from hitting the net.
Ryan Fraser is substituted due to injury. Eddie Howe gives a chance to Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).

Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) takes a first-time shot inside the box after latching onto a nice lofted pass, but the effort is blocked and spins away to safety. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Arsenal.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Anthony Taylor starts the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Tyrone Mings comes off for Simon Francis (Bournemouth).

Post! Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the centre of the box wasn't accurate enough and the ball crashed against the right post!
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.

Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Asmir Begovic to get hold of the ball.
Substitution. Aaron Ramsey will be replaced by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) is coming onto the pitch as Jermain Defoe cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) replacing Alexandre Lacazette.
Danny Welbeck goes off the pitch and Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) comes on.
Simon Francis (Bournemouth) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. Arsenal will take a corner kick.

Joshua King (Bournemouth) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball towards the roof of the net. Petr Cech shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Bournemouth will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

A big opportunity is wasted by Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the bottom left corner. Unfortunately for him, Asmir Begovic pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort. Arsenal will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Anthony Taylor is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Gareth Barry (West Brom) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.

Gareth Barry (West Brom) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time strike from just outside the penalty area. The ball was aimed towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt. The referee signals a corner kick to West Brom.
A shot from the edge of the box by Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) is close, but lifts narrowly over the bar at the last second.
Pascal Gross (Brighton) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Chris Kavanagh blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Pascal Gross (Brighton) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute Ahmed Hegazy and he is replaced by Kieran Gibbs (West Brom).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jose Rondon walks off the pitch to be replaced by Oliver Burke (West Brom).
Chris Hughton is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Bruno Saltor suffers an injury and Liam Rosenior (Brighton) comes on.
Goal! Pascal Gross plays a neat lofted pass into the box for Tomer Hemed (Brighton), who beats the defender in the air and plants a header into the bottom right corner from close range. 3:0.
That's the end of the game for Jake Livermore, who is replaced by James Morrison (West Brom).

It's in! Oliver Burke spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. James Morrison (West Brom) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. The score is now 3:1.
Substitution. Tomer Hemed makes his way off the pitch and Glenn Murray (Brighton) comes on as his replacement.
Chris Kavanagh rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Solomon March (Brighton).
Today's referee Chris Kavanagh rightly decides to book Glenn Murray (Brighton) for his harsh tackle.
Chris Kavanagh is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Today's referee Graham Scott rightly decides to book Ashley Williams (Everton) for his harsh tackle.
The foul by Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Graham Scott.
Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Nice piece of skill by Harry Kane (Tottenham). He perfectly collected a pass from Kieran Trippier, then unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went inside the left post. The score is 0:1.

Jordan Pickford gets a well deserved ovation! Ben Davies (Tottenham) produces a decent first-time strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Goal! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 0:2.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Ronald Koeman has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) comes on the pitch for Sandro Ramirez.
The game is over for Davy Klaassen. Tom Davies (Everton) comes on for the second half.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) meets a perfect cross from Ben Davies deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the right post. The score is 0:3.

Jordan Pickford pulls off a great save to deny Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

What a wasted opportunity by Harry Kane (Tottenham)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the middle of the net, but Jordan Pickford makes a comfortable save to thwart him.
Idrissa Gueye (Everton) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) for Christian Eriksen.
Moussa Sissoko is substituted due to injury. Mauricio Pochettino gives a chance to Harry Winks (Tottenham).
Ronald Koeman has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nikola Vlasic (Everton) replacing Idrissa Gueye.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) meets a cross from Leighton Baines, but he cannot keep his header on target. It goes high over the crossbar.
Today's match ends for Harry Kane who will be replaced by Heung-Min Son (Tottenham).
Graham Scott shows a yellow card to Wayne Rooney (Everton) for a tough tackle.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Islam Slimani (Leicester) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads inside the left post, but Thibaut Courtois shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.

Goal! Cesar Azpilicueta hands Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Lee Mason blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Craig Shakespeare makes a half-time substitution. Andy King (Leicester) comes on in place of Marc Albrighton.
That will be all from Islam Slimani who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Demarai Gray (Leicester).
N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) scores an incredible goal! He receives a pass, makes some space for himself and unleashes a long-range thunderbolt of a shot past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner.
Lee Mason blows his whistle after Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Leicester!
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Thibaut Courtois to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pedro departs the field of play to be replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Victor Moses is replaced by Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea).
Craig Shakespeare has decided to make a change. Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) replaces Matthew James.
Here is a change. Cesc Fabregas is going off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical orders to Eden Hazard (Chelsea).
Eden Hazard plays a lovely pass into Davide Zappacosta (Chelsea), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Nice move, nice attempt! Willian (Chelsea) is teed up with a simple pass after a nice flowing move. His first time shot from mid-range looks like it's going in but curls just wide of the right post.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes inside the right post. It's 0:1.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Mauricio Pellegrino makes a half-time substitution. Dusan Tadic (Southampton) comes on in place of James Ward-Prowse.
Here is a change. Younes Kaboul is going off and Marco Silva gives the last tactical orders to Adrian Mariappa (Watford).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daryl Janmaat (Watford) replaces Kiko.

What a beautiful moment! Daryl Janmaat (Watford) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the bottom left corner. Fraser Forster just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:2.
Mauricio Pellegrino has decided to make a change. Shane Long (Southampton) replaces Manolo Gabbiadini.
Substitution. Charlie Austin (Southampton) has come on for Sofiane Boufal.
Marco da Silva has decided to substitute Andre Gray and he is replaced by Troy Deeney (Watford).
That's it for today, Lee Probert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) for a tough tackle.
A yellow card for a tackle by Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool). Jonathan Moss doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is released by Kevin De Bruyne, he surges into the box and smashes a great shot into the top corner after a one-on-one with the goalkeeper.
Jonathan Moss shows the yellow card to Fernandinho (Manchester City) for a heavy challenge.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Simon Mignolet makes a decent save to deny his effort directed low to the middle of the target. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Manchester City.

John Stones (Manchester City) reacted quickly inside the box and got on the end of the resulting corner. He drilled a low shot towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulled off an astonishing save to deny him.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and the referee shows him a deserved red card!
Pep Guardiola is forced to make a change. Ederson is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Claudio Bravo (Manchester City).
A goal, which was scored by Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City), was disallowed due to offside.
Goal! Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Kevin De Bruyne and easily beat the keeper with a header into the middle of the goal from close range. 2:0.
Jonathan Moss has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Jurgen Klopp has made a change at the break. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Liverpool) has come on in place of Mohamed Salah.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Goal! Sergio Aguero puts the ball on a plate for Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leroy Sane (Manchester City) comes onto the pitch so that Gabriel Jesus can be given a rest.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. James Milner (Liverpool) replaces Georginio Wijnaldum.
The game has come to an end for Roberto Firmino. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Dominic Solanke (Liverpool).
The manager makes a subsitution with Eliaquim Mangala (Manchester City) coming on for Nicolas Otamendi.

GOAL! Superb work from Benjamin Mendy, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Leroy Sane (Manchester City), who beats Simon Mignolet with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 4:0.
Emre Can (Liverpool) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) gets on the end of a defence splitting pass inside the box and immediately directs a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Simon Mignolet makes a great save.

Kyle Walker passes to Leroy Sane (Manchester City), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 5:0.
That's it for today, Jonathan Moss has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Chance! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Alexis Sanchez, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.

A perfect lofted pass from Joe Gomez finds Roberto Firmino (Liverpool), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom left corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Petr Cech had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
The foul by Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Craig Pawson.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Joe Gomez (Liverpool) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Roberto Firmino slips it to Sadio Mane (Liverpool) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 2:0.
Today's referee Craig Pawson rightly decides to book Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) for his harsh tackle.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Arsene Wenger decided to make a change. Aaron Ramsey is replaced by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) was quite harsh and Craig Pawson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Petr Cech pulls off a great save to deny Mohamed Salah (Liverpool), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
Goal! The ball breaks to Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) after some poor defending, he finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and calmly puts the ball into the back of the net! He makes it 3:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) replaces Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.
Arsene Wenger has decided to substitute Alexis Sanchez and he is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) misses a great opportunity from inside the penalty area after blasting the ball towards goal and it goes wide of the left post.

Sadio Mane (Liverpool) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
Craig Pawson shows the yellow card to Rob Holding (Arsenal) for a heavy challenge.
Sadio Mane comes off the pitch to be replaced by Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool).
Goal! Mohamed Salah puts the ball on the head of Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool), who has the easy task to score into an empty net. 4:0.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to introduce fresh legs, with James Milner (Liverpool) replacing Roberto Firmino.
Emre Can goes off the pitch and Marko Grujic (Liverpool) comes on.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
That didn't go as planned! Robbie Brady (Burnley) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the top right corner was too weak to get past Hugo Lloris, who easily kept it out.
Lee Mason has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort.
After the keeper softly punches the ball away, it lands at the feet of Dele Alli (Tottenham) who knows what to do with it and sends it into the bottom right corner.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) received a precise pass and hammers the ball at goal from close range. Unfortunately for him, his aim was a bit off and it flies just wide of the right post.
Sean Dyche has decided to make a change. Chris Wood (Burnley) replaces Johann Gudmundsson.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Sam Vokes walks off the pitch to be replaced by Ashley Barnes (Burnley).
Heung-Min Son comes off the pitch to be replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).

Robbie Brady (Burnley) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads inside the right post, but Hugo Lloris shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him. Burnley win a corner.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Tom Heaton. It will be a corner kick for Tottenham.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Tom Heaton to get hold of the ball.

Dele Alli (Tottenham) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Tom Heaton shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Substitution. Steven Defour is replaced by Ashley Westwood (Burnley).
Hugo Lloris displays his ability to read the game and clears the danger after Chris Wood (Burnley) threatened to latch onto a through ball from just outside the box.
It will be a substitution. Harry Winks (Tottenham) is ready to enter the pitch as Christian Eriksen walks off.
Chris Wood (Burnley) changes the scoreline after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and firing a precise shot that goes inside the right post!
The substitution is prepared. Davinson Sanchez (Tottenham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mousa Dembele.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

The foul by Idrissa Gueye (Everton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.
Gooal! Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) scores with a shot from inside the box after latching onto a headed pass from Alvaro Morata. He makes it 1:0.
It's a goal! Cesar Azpilicueta sends a long raking pass onto the head of Alvaro Morata (Chelsea), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball into the top left corner. 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ronald Koeman gives a chance to Muhamed Besic (Everton) and Tom Davies is off.

Sandro Ramirez (Everton) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Sandro Ramirez (Everton) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. It will be a corner kick for Everton.
Ooh that was close! Pedro (Chelsea) collects a pass and runs with pace goalwards before unleashing a great drive from the edge of the box, but it goes inches wide of the right post.
Sandro Ramirez will be replaced by Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton).
Wayne Rooney (Everton) attempts to discuss the decision with Jonathan Moss, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.

Jonathan Moss shows the yellow card to Victor Moses (Chelsea) for a heavy challenge.
Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) replacing Alvaro Morata.
Substitution. Aaron Lennon (Everton) has come on for Phil Jagielka.
Ashley Williams (Everton) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends his bullet header just wide of the right post.
Today's referee Jonathan Moss rightly decides to book Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) for his harsh tackle.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Victor Moses walks off the pitch to be replaced by Andreas Christensen (Chelsea).
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Kurt Zouma (Stoke City) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but Ben Foster makes a brilliant save! The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Stoke.
Erik Pieters (Stoke City) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Allan Nyom showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:0.
The substitution has been made. Peter Crouch (Stoke City) has replaced Jese.

Matt Phillips (West Brom) sets the ball up and is ready to take the free kick from a promising distance. Many goals have been scored from this distance. Let's see what happens. Ahmed Hegazy (West Brom) latches onto a precise cross from the free kick and produces a header at goal from the penalty spot, but his attempt towards the roof of the net fails to beat Jack Butland, who makes a fine save. West Brom will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
The referee signals a substitution. Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) is brought on as a substitute for Geoff Cameron.
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. Claudio Yacob (West Brom) replaces James Morrison.
It's time for a substitution. James McClean (West Brom) comes on in place of Matt Phillips.

Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.
Goal! A defensive error presents Peter Crouch (Stoke City) with a great chance and he takes advantage of it by heading the ball into the back of the net. 1:1.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Joe Allen (Stoke City) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Oliver Burke (West Brom) comes onto the pitch so that Jay Rodriguez can be given a rest.
That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) does well to reach an overhit cross into the box from Anthony Martial, but his first-time effort flashes just wide of the left post.

What a sweet touch by Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) as he collects a pass. From near the edge of the box he produces a shot which goes towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a decent save to thwart him! Manchester Utd get a corner.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) makes a yard for himself and attempts to endanger the goalkeeper with a long-range shot. His great effort, however, goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 25 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.
Danny Simpson (Leicester) probably handled the ball. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Manchester Utd.

Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the left post. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Kasper Schmeichel to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save. Corner kick. Manchester Utd will have an opportunity.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) picks up a yellow card.

David de Gea makes a brilliant save! Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the bottom right corner but is saved by the keeper!
Substitution. Marc Albrighton leaves the pitch and is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Here is a change. Shinji Okazaki is going off and Craig Shakespeare gives the last tactical orders to Andy King (Leicester).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) comes onto the pitch so that Juan Manuel Mata can be given a rest.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal to make the score 1:0.
Here's the change. Henrikh Mkhitaryan leaves the pitch and Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) comes on as a substitute.
Jose Mourinho has decided to make a change. Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) replaces Anthony Martial.
It's time for a substitution. Islam Slimani (Leicester) comes on in place of Jamie Vardy.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Matthew James (Leicester) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

David de Gea was forced into action to thwart Andy King (Leicester). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Leicester.

Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) neatly controls a driven pass on the edge of the box, glances up and cracks a beautiful drive goalwards that sails just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Leicester will have a goal kick.
Kasper Schmeichel (Leicester) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) gets a yellow card.
Alfie Mawson (Swansea) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the right post.
Frank de Boer is forced to make a change. James Tomkins is unable to continue due to injury, Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) comes on.
It's a goal! Tammy Abraham (Swansea) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Leroy Fer. The score is now 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Andre Marriner has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Patrick van Aanholt is replaced by Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace).
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) collects a killer pass and fires a low shot into the middle of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luka Milivojevic departs the field of play to be replaced by Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace).
Paul Clement has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Wayne Routledge (Swansea) replacing Mike van der Hoorn.
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
That will be all from Tammy Abraham who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Oliver McBurnie (Swansea).
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Leroy Fer (Swansea) picks up a yellow card.
The game has come to an end for Kyle Naughton. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Angel Rangel (Swansea).
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card for infringement.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Elias Kachunga (Huddersfield) meets a cross inside the box, but Fraser Forster wins the battle for the ball and the chance is gone.
Tom Ince (Huddersfield) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Tom Ince (Huddersfield) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.

The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save as he denies the first-time effort by Elias Kachunga (Huddersfield) from the edge of the box. The ball goes out of play. Huddersfield are awarded a corner kick.
The foul by Oriol Romeu (Southampton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Stuart Attwell.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Stuart Attwell blows his whistle to start the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kasey Palmer (Huddersfield) comes onto the pitch so that Rajiv van La Parra can be given a rest.
Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) latches on to a sweet cross inside the box and misses with a header high above the bar.
David Wagner has decided to make a change. Daniel Williams (Huddersfield) replaces Philip Billing.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Mario Lemina will be replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
It will be a substitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is ready to enter the pitch as Manolo Gabbiadini walks off.
Here is a change. Dusan Tadic is going off and Mauricio Pellegrino gives the last tactical orders to Sam McQueen (Southampton).
Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit.
Nathan Redmond (Southampton) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the right side of the goal, but Jonas Lossl is well positioned to make a comfortable save.
Here's the change. Elias Kachunga leaves the pitch and Collin Quaner (Huddersfield) comes on as a substitute.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him.

The first half of this match is about to start.
A yellow card for a tackle by Chicharito (West Ham). Neil Swarbrick doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Joselu (Newcastle Utd) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and sends a low drive past the goalkeeper.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change. Declan Rice is going off and Slaven Bilic gives the last tactical orders to Manuel Lanzini (West Ham).

Joe Hart can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net. The ball is out of play. Newcastle win a corner kick.
Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
It is time for a substitution. Diafra Sakho (West Ham) is on for Andre Ayew.
Slaven Bilic prepares a substitution. Mark Noble is replaced by Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham).
Substitution. Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) replaces Joselu.
Ciaran Clark (Newcastle Utd) leaps to connect with a delightful cross and places his sweet header inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance to make a save.
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.
Substitution. Isaac Hayden makes his way off the pitch and Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) comes on as his replacement.
Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Neil Swarbrick didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Aleksandar Mitrovic (Newcastle Utd) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
The substitution has been made. Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd) has replaced Matt Ritchie.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Anthony Knockaert (Brighton) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Bruno Saltor (Brighton) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) can have an early bath after being sent off by the referee for a tackle that simply has no place in football!
The manager has decided to make a tactical substitution following the red card and Nordin Amrabat can take a rest because Craig Cathcart (Watford) is coming onto the pitch to strengthen the defence.
Tomer Hemed (Brighton) wasted a clear opportunity. He fired a first-time shot from point-blank range, but it rattled the left post!
Nathaniel Chalobah (Watford) beats an opponent and drives towards the edge of the penalty area. He steadies himself and hits a tremendous shot that flashes a whisker past the left post.
Graham Scott has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Chris Hughton probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Bruno Saltor. He is replaced by Liam Rosenior (Brighton).
Marco Silva is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Craig Cathcart suffers an injury and Andre Carrillo (Watford) comes on.
Lewis Dunk (Brighton) receives a short pass from the indirect free kick and immediately fires a strong shot towards the goal, but the defender makes a brave block. Brighton have a corner.
It's time for a substitution. Jose Izquierdo (Brighton) comes on in place of Anthony Knockaert.
Marco da Silva has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Troy Deeney (Watford) replacing Andre Gray.
Substitution. Jamie Murphy (Brighton) on for Pascal Gross.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
What a spectacular goal. Absolutely fantastic. Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) unleashed a stunning volley from the edge of the box and the ball went in off the crossbar. The score is 1:0.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. What a clinical finish!
Yellow card. Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Michael Dean has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Caution goes to Harry Arter (Bournemouth).
It will be a substitution. John Stones (Manchester City) is ready to enter the pitch as David Silva walks off.
David Silva (Manchester City) criticises the decision of the referee and immediately receives a yellow card.
Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Here's the change. Bernardo Silva leaves the pitch and Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.
Booking. Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) receives a caution from the referee.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) is coming onto the pitch as Jermain Defoe cannot continue after picking up an injury.
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the left post!
What was Steve Cook (Bournemouth) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Benjamin Mendy (Manchester City) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Substitution. Gabriel Jesus is replaced by Leroy Sane (Manchester City).
Tyrone Mings (Bournemouth) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 20 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended up inside the right post.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Substitution. Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Benik Afobe walks off.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Adam Smith (Bournemouth).
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Danilo plays it to Raheem Sterling (Manchester City), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Asmir Begovic. 1:2.
An infringement by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) results in a yellow card and as it's the second time today, he also sees a red and is dismissed by Michael Dean.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. John Stones replaces David Silva (Manchester City).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Madley didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Tom Davies (Everton) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.

Jordan Pickford hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) shoots from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked. The referee points to the corner flag and Manchester City will take a corner.
David Silva (Manchester City) attempts to test the goalkeeper after collecting a cross inside the penalty area. Luck doesn't appear to be on his side today as his attempt rattles the left post.
Goal! Dominic Calvert-Lewin plays a simple square pass into the feet of Wayne Rooney (Everton) in the box, who composes himself and lashes the ball low into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Kyle Walker (Manchester City) for a tough tackle.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Jordan Pickford, who pulls off a stunning save!
Kyle Walker (Manchester City) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Pep Guardiola has made a change at the break. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) has come on in place of Gabriel Jesus.
Ronald Koeman has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Davy Klaassen (Everton) replacing Ashley Williams.
Substitution. Tom Davies makes way for Gylfi Sigurdsson (Everton).
Substitution. John Stones is replaced by Danilo (Manchester City).
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) replaces Leroy Sane.
Sergio Aguero picks out Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) unmarked inside the box, but he blazes the ball well over the bar.
Great save! Danilo (Manchester City) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the bottom left corner was brilliantly saved by Jordan Pickford.
Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Madley ignores the protests.
What a hit! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Wayne Rooney (Everton) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Robert Madley blows his whistle and Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Muhamed Besic (Everton) will replace Wayne Rooney.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Tottenham.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) smashes the ball from the resulting free kick and it sails into the top right corner. The goalkeeper merely turned his head. Absolutely amazing.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Thibaut Courtois makes a great save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal.
Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) gets booked for the first time in this match.
David Luiz (Chelsea) is booked by the referee.
Post! Harry Kane (Tottenham) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Anthony Taylor has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Wow, what an escape. Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Tottenham will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Jan Vertonghen (Tottenham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch for Eric Dier.

Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Chelsea force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Willian (Chelsea) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the left post! A few inches to the right and it could have been a sweet goal!
Pedro (Chelsea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Willian.
Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Alvaro Morata is replaced by Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea).
That's the end of the game for Ben Davies, who is replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 1:1.
Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) gets a yellow card.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Marcos Alonso (Chelsea).
Goal! Pedro plays in Marcos Alonso (Chelsea), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom left corner 1:2.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Harry Kane (Tottenham) receives a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) will replace Kieran Trippier.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Craig Pawson starts the second half.
Brilliant finish! Aaron Mooy (Huddersfield) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Elias Kachunga, then produced a nice strike into the top right corner. The score is 1:0.
Substitution. Dwight Gayle makes way for Joselu (Newcastle Utd).
Craig Pawson shows a yellow card to Isaac Hayden (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.
Yellow card. Joselu (Newcastle Utd) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Craig Pawson shows the yellow card to Philip Billing (Huddersfield) for a heavy challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Rajiv van La Parra trots off the pitch and is replaced by Collin Quaner (Huddersfield).
David Wagner has decided to substitute Elias Kachunga and he is replaced by Kasey Palmer (Huddersfield).
We are about to witness a substitution. Mohamed Diame (Newcastle Utd) is replacing Isaac Hayden.
Kasey Palmer (Huddersfield) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Here is a change. Ayoze Perez is going off and Rafael Benitez gives the last tactical orders to Jacob Murphy (Newcastle Utd).
Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Craig Pawson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Substitution. Michael Hefele (Huddersfield) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Tom Ince walks off.
Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Xherdan Shaqiri is being substituted because of an injury. Mark Hughes sends Saido Berahino (Stoke City) on the pitch.
Andre Marriner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal - 1:0! Jese (Stoke City) receives a precise pass inside the box from Saido Berahino and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.

Saido Berahino (Stoke City) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Petr Cech, who pulls off a stunning save! The referee points to the corner flag and Stoke will take a corner.
A substitution has been made. Sead Kolasinac is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Mark Hughes prepares a substitution. Jese is replaced by Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City).
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Alexandre Lacazette.
