Substitution. Erik Pieters is replaced by Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City).
That's it for today, Andre Marriner has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) has tested the patience of referee Roger East and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Andre Gray (Watford) takes a short pass in his stride inside the box, but hits a poor shot at goal that goes high over the bar.
Roger East has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Nathaniel Chalobah (Watford) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Asmir Begovic anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target.
Andre Gray (Watford) is booked for saying more than Roger East was willing to tolerate.
We are about to witness a substitution. Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) is replacing Benik Afobe.
Eddie Howe has decided to make a change. Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) replaces Jordon Ibe.
Steve Cook (Bournemouth) attempts to discuss the decision with Roger East, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Nathaniel Chalobah (Watford) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Roger East had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Richarlison (Watford) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) replaces Ryan Fraser.
Here is a change. Richarlison is going off and Marco Silva gives the last tactical orders to Etienne Capoue (Watford).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Kabasele (Watford) comes onto the pitch for Nordin Amrabat.
Goal! Etienne Capoue (Watford) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes inside the left post. It's 0:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nathaniel Chalobah leaves the pitch and Ben Watson (Watford) comes on.
That's it for today, Roger East has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
James McClean (West Brom) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him.
Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post.
Ben Mee (Burnley) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Martin Atkinson blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) on for James McClean.

An amazing individual effort from Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the right side of the goal and makes it 0:1. Tom Heaton was helpless.
We are about to witness a substitution. Jonathan Walters (Burnley) is replacing Robbie Brady.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ashley Barnes (Burnley) replacing Johann Gudmundsson.
Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) is sent off after deserving nothing other than a red card from a referee for clattering into his opponent!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jose Rondon (West Brom) comes onto the pitch so that Sam Field can be given a rest.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
That's it for today, Martin Atkinson has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

Nice individual effort by Riyad Mahrez (Leicester). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the middle of the goal, but Mathew Ryan does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Goal! 1:0. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.
CHANCE! Jamie Vardy finds Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the right post!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Wes Morgan (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Lee Probert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The resulting corner is whipped in by Riyad Mahrez and Harry Maguire (Leicester) is left unmarked to plant a precise header into the top left corner. The score is 2:0.
Chris Hughton decides to make a substitution. Pascal Gross will be replaced by Anthony Knockaert (Brighton).
Substitution. Glenn Murray makes his way off the pitch and Tomer Hemed (Brighton) comes on as his replacement.

Tomer Hemed (Brighton) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but is stopped by a great save from Kasper Schmeichel and the score remains the same.
It is time for a substitution. Islam Slimani (Leicester) is on for Shinji Okazaki.
Craig Shakespeare has decided to make a change. Demarai Gray (Leicester) replaces Jamie Vardy.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) has tested the patience of referee Kevin Friend and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Kevin Friend has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) for Daniel Sturridge.
The yellow card is received by Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace).
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Dominic Solanke (Liverpool) on for Georginio Wijnaldum.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Sadio Mane (Liverpool), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 1:0.
Here is a change. Jason Puncheon is going off and Frank de Boer gives the last tactical orders to James McArthur (Crystal Palace).
The referee signals a substitution. Sullay Kaikai (Crystal Palace) is brought on as a substitute for Luka Milivojevic.
Substitution. Patrick van Aanholt makes way for Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) replaces Roberto Firmino.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) was quite harsh and Kevin Friend didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.

It's a goal! Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the bottom right corner. The assist goes to Nathan Redmond and the score changes to 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Dusan Tadic (Southampton). Lee Mason doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) makes an ugly tackle on his opponent and is sent off by the referee!
Jose Fonte (West Ham) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Lee Mason blows his whistle for a foul. The referee blows the whistle and gives a penalty to Southampton!!
Goal! Joe Hart gets a hand on the penalty from Dusan Tadic (Southampton), but can't stop it from flying low into the middle of the goal.

A sweet pass finds Michail Antonio (West Ham) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the bottom right corner. Fraser Forster is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.
Goal 2:1! Chicharito (West Ham) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) makes some space for a shot from 25 metres and sends the ball goalwards. Unfortunately for him, it crashes against the crossbar. It would have been a sublime goal.
The manager makes a subsitution with James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) coming on for Mario Lemina.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Diafra Sakho (West Ham) will replace Michail Antonio.
Slaven Bilic has decided to make a change. Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) replaces Andre Ayew.
Diafra Sakho (West Ham) meets a lofted pass into the box to plant a strong header goalwards from near the penalty spot. The keeper makes a decent save to deflect the ball onto the crossbar.
Goal! Chicharito (West Ham) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:2.
Substitution. Pedro Obiang (West Ham) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Declan Rice walks off.
Mauricio Pellegrino prepares a substitution. Manolo Gabbiadini is replaced by Charlie Austin (Southampton).
Here is a change. Steven Davis is going off and Mauricio Pellegrino gives the last tactical orders to Shane Long (Southampton).
Goal! No, wait. It's disallowed for a foul by Cedric Soares (Southampton).

Nathan Redmond (Southampton) received an accurate pass just outside the penalty area and produced a quick strike. It would have probably ended behind the goalkeeper, but one of the defenders managed to deflect it onto the post. Southampton have been awarded a corner kick.
Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) commits a rough foul. Lee Mason stops the game and makes a call. Southampton are given a huge opportunity to score - it's a penalty kick!
Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) is punished with the yellow card.
Goal! Charlie Austin (Southampton) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty low past Joe Hart into the middle of the goal.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Jordan Ayew (Swansea) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes against the crossbar!

Phil Jones (Manchester United) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross from the free kick into the box and attempts to score with a header. His effort is not accurate enough and bounces away off the bar.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Paul Pogba (Manchester United) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Lukasz Fabianski.

Lukasz Fabianski makes a beautiful save from Paul Pogba (Manchester United), who latched on to an accurate lofted pass and produced a timely header. The goalkeeper was able to tip the ball onto the bar and away.
Goal! Eric Bailly (Manchester United) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Jonathan Moss starts the second half.
It is time for a substitution. Wayne Routledge (Swansea) is on for Kyle Bartley.
Paul Clement has decided to substitute Roque Mesa and he is replaced by Luciano Narsingh (Swansea).
The game is interrupted. Leroy Fer (Swansea) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now. Manchester Utd are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marcus Rashford.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Juan Manuel Mata is replaced by Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).

Goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan manages to prod the ball to Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) after a melee inside the box, and he needs no second invitation to slot the ball into the middle of the goal. 0:2.
GOAL - 0:3! Henrikh Mkhitaryan found Paul Pogba (Manchester United) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Lukasz Fabianski off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Oliver McBurnie (Swansea) replaces Tammy Abraham.
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Lukasz Fabianski with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:4.
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ander Herrera (Manchester United) replacing Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Marcus Rashford plays a neat ball into the path of Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United), who makes room for a shot and sends in a low drive which bounces in off the left post! 1:0.
Eric Bailly (Manchester United) earns the yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Pablo Zabaleta (West Ham) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.

Perfectly taken free kick! Henrikh Mkhitaryan sends the ball in, Romelu Lukaku (Manchester United) manages to jump highest near the penalty spot and plants a cracking header low inside the right post. It's 2:0.
Marko Arnautovic (West Ham) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the crossbar!
Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) is booked.
The substitution is prepared. Diafra Sakho (West Ham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Edimilson Fernandes.
Here is a change. Mark Noble is going off and Slaven Bilic gives the last tactical orders to Declan Rice (West Ham).
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the right post!
Booking. Angelo Ogbonna (West Ham) receives a caution from the referee.
Daley Blind (Manchester United) does well to meet a cross from Antonio Valencia, but he directs his shot just over the crossbar.
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) replacing Juan Manuel Mata.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Martial (Manchester United) comes onto the pitch for Marcus Rashford.
Slaven Bilic has decided to make a change. Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) replaces Arthur Masuaku.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Anthony Martial (Manchester United). Henrikh Mkhitaryan plays a fantastic through ball and finds Anthony Martial (Manchester United), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 3:0.
Substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan makes way for Jesse Lingard (Manchester United).

Anthony Martial passes to Paul Pogba (Manchester United), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 4:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Paul Dummett walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jamaal Lascelles (Newcastle Utd).
Harry Kane (Tottenham) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
A substitution has been made. Florian Lejeune is replaced by Chancel Mbemba (Newcastle Utd).
Andre Marriner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
The referee blows his whistle and raises a red card. Jonjo Shelvey (Newcastle Utd) is the one who has to leave the pitch immediately.

Rob Elliot pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Harry Kane (Tottenham) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the middle of the goal, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.
The game is interrupted. Matt Ritchie (Newcastle Utd) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Moussa Sissoko comes off the pitch to be replaced by Heung-Min Son (Tottenham).
It's in the back of the net! Christian Eriksen plays it into the box, and Dele Alli (Tottenham) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Goal - 0:2! Christian Eriksen tees up Ben Davies (Tottenham) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Rob Elliot.
The referee signals a substitution. Mikel Merino (Newcastle Utd) is brought on as a substitute for Dwight Gayle.
Here comes a substitution. Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Dele Alli.
Ben Davies (Tottenham) picks up a caution.
The game has come to an end for Mousa Dembele. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Harry Winks (Tottenham).

OFF THE POST! Harry Kane (Tottenham) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jamie Murphy (Brighton) is coming onto the pitch as Isaiah Brown cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Goal, no wait. Michael Oliver blows his whistle for handball and Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.
The referee Michael Oliver awards Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) a yellow card.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Mathew Ryan shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) fails to keep his cool and squanders a golden chance to score from inside the penalty area after firing the ball over the crossbar.
Lewis Dunk (Brighton) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort.
Substitution. Glenn Murray (Brighton) on for Tomer Hemed.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Danilo departs the field of play to be replaced by Leroy Sane (Manchester City).
Goal! A great through ball by David Silva sets up Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the left side of the goal. 0:1.
It's an own goal! An unlucky moment for Lewis Dunk (Brighton), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but heads the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 0:2.
Chris Hughton prepares a substitution. Solomon March is replaced by Anthony Knockaert (Brighton).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) will replace Gabriel Jesus.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Oliver ignores the protests.
Pep Guardiola has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bernardo Silva (Manchester City) replacing Sergio Aguero.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Craig Pawson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

It's a foul from Gary Cahill (Chelsea). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and Gary Cahill (Chelsea) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.
The foul by Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Craig Pawson.
The manager is forced to make a substitution due to a red card. Antonio Conte issues instructions to Andreas Christensen (Chelsea), who will replace Jeremie Boga.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) has a goal ruled out for offside!
It's a goal! Sam Vokes (Burnley) scores with a brilliant shot into the left side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Matthew Lowton. The score is now 0:1.
Goal! Jack Cork provides Stephen Ward (Burnley) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the right post. 0:2.

It's a goal! Sam Vokes (Burnley) makes it 0:3. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Steven Defour and planted his close-range header into the middle of the goal. Thibaut Courtois was helpless.
Craig Pawson has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Substitution. Michy Batshuayi makes way for Alvaro Morata (Chelsea).
A yellow card for a tackle by Robbie Brady (Burnley). Craig Pawson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top right corner only for Tom Heaton to dive and make a save. The ball is out of play. Chelsea will have a chance to score from a corner.
Today's referee Craig Pawson rightly decides to book Ben Mee (Burnley) for his harsh tackle.
Robbie Brady (Burnley) crashes a header just wide of the left post from close range after a searching cross. He should have scored!
Goal! Willian swings the ball deep into the box and finds Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the left side of the goal. 1:3.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Alvaro Morata (Chelsea) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Substitution. Scott Arfield (Burnley) on for Johann Gudmundsson.
Sean Dyche decides to make a substitution. Steven Defour will be replaced by Jonathan Walters (Burnley).
Scott Arfield (Burnley) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Craig Pawson ignores the protests.
David Luiz (Chelsea) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.
RED CARD! Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Craig Pawson. He can have an early bath.
GOAL! Alvaro Morata meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where David Luiz (Chelsea) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 2:3.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Antonio Rudiger (Chelsea).
Robbie Brady (Burnley) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the left post!
Substitution. Andreas Christensen is replaced by Charly Junior Musonda (Chelsea).
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) got to the ball inside the six-yard box all of a sudden and slammed it towards the goal, but unfortunately hits one of his teammates instead of scoring.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for Joel Ward (Crystal Palace), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box from the corner but instead sends the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 0:2.
Goal! Aaron Mooy plays the ball into the area and Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) gets on the end of it to glance a header into the back of the net. He makes it 0:2.
Tom Smith (Huddersfield) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jonathan Moss didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Aaron Mooy floats the corner into the six-yard box, but the ball spins off the head of Mathias Jorgensen (Huddersfield) and falls to safety well wide of the left post.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the left of the target.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Jonas Lossl.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Luka Milivojevic comes off for Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace).

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the left post, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop the effort. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Crystal Palace.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Tom Smith as he is replaced by Daniel Williams (Huddersfield).
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the left side of the goal, but Jonas Lossl pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Kasey Palmer (Huddersfield) for a tough tackle.
David Wagner has decided to substitute Kasey Palmer and he is replaced by Collin Quaner (Huddersfield).
The foul by Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) wins the ball from the resulting corner but blazes it well over the bar.
Substitution. Timothy Fosu-Mensah is replaced by James Tomkins (Crystal Palace).
It's 0:3! Collin Quaner feeds Steve Mounie (Huddersfield) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom right corner.
That's the end of the game for Steve Mounie, who is replaced by Rajiv van La Parra (Huddersfield).
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
That's it for today, Jonathan Moss has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Joe Allen (Stoke City), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

A perfect lofted pass from Dominic Calvert-Lewin finds Wayne Rooney (Everton), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the roof of the net. His effort was both strong and precise, and Jack Butland had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Neil Swarbrick starts the second half.
Ronald Koeman makes a half-time substitution. Cuco Martina (Everton) comes on in place of Ashley Williams.
That will be all from Davy Klaassen who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Tom Davies (Everton).

Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the left side of the goal. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save! The ball is out of play. Everton will have a chance to score from a corner.
The substitution has been made. Peter Crouch (Stoke City) has replaced Saido Berahino.
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Bojan Krkic and he is replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Stoke City).
Substitution. Sandro Ramirez leaves the pitch and is replaced by Kevin Mirallas (Everton).
Cuco Martina (Everton) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.
That's it for today, Neil Swarbrick has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Tammy Abraham (Swansea) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nathan Redmond (Southampton) was quite harsh and Mike Jones didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Southampton.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mike Jones had an easy-decision to make.
Close! Maya Yoshida (Southampton) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Mike Jones blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Manolo Gabbiadini leaves the pitch and is replaced by Charlie Austin (Southampton).
Mauricio Pellegrino prepares a substitution. James Ward-Prowse is replaced by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jay Fulton (Swansea) replaces Leon Britton.
Maya Yoshida (Southampton) latches onto a lofted pass on the edge of the six-yard box, but powers a header just over the bar.
That will be all from Tammy Abraham who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Kyle Bartley (Swansea).
Paul Clement decides to make a substitution. Wayne Routledge will be replaced by Oliver McBurnie (Swansea).
The referee signals a substitution. Sam McQueen (Southampton) is brought on as a substitute for Ryan Bertrand.
Mike Jones shows a yellow card to Jay Fulton (Swansea) for his blatant foul.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom left corner, but Asmir Begovic has other ideas and makes a brilliant save.

Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) races through the centre to the edge of the box then lets fly with a rocket of a shot that flies a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bournemouth.
Ahmed Hegazy (West Brom) rises high above the defence to connect with the free kick and his picture-perfect header goes low inside the left post.
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) meets a fine cross on the edge of the box from the resulting corner kick and shoots. His shot flies just wide of the left post.
Robert Madley has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Marc Pugh will be replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).
Substitution. Jermain Defoe (Bournemouth) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Benik Afobe walks off.
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. Rekeem Harper (West Brom) replaces Sam Field.
Substitution. Matt Phillips makes his way off the pitch and Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) comes on as his replacement.
That's the end of the game for Simon Francis, who is replaced by Adam Smith (Bournemouth).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jay Rodriguez (West Brom) was quite harsh and Robert Madley didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Tony Pulis prepares a substitution. Jay Rodriguez is replaced by Salomon Rondon (West Brom).
Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Madley had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

What a chance! Roberto Pereyra (Watford) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance. The ball goes behind for a corner. Watford will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Jose Holebas takes over corner duties and expertly finds Stefano Okaka (Watford), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the back of the net. The score is now 1:0.
Marco Silva is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Daryl Janmaat suffers an injury and Kiko (Watford) comes on.
Goal! Emre Can plays a simple square pass into the feet of Sadio Mane (Liverpool) in the box, who composes himself and lashes the ball inside the right post. 1:1.
Tom Cleverley (Watford) passes the ball into the box but an opposing player clears.
A rebound finds its way to Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) and he scores with a powerful strike, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The foul by Sadio Mane (Liverpool) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Anthony Taylor.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) finds himself in a promising position to finish! He unleashes a poor shot which flies into the stands. What a poor effort that was!
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) outbattles the defender to win the ball from the corner, but he can't quite control his header and sends it just wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post!
Roberto Pereyra is being substituted because of an injury. Marco Silva sends Richarlison (Watford) on the pitch.
Liverpool are awarded a penalty kick! Heurelho Gomes (Watford) brings an opponent down and Anthony Taylor interrupts the game.
Goal! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Heurelho Gomes into the bottom left corner.
Goal! Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Roberto Firmino. The score is 2:3.
Today's referee Anthony Taylor rightly decides to book Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) for his harsh tackle.
Marco Silva decides to make a substitution. Stefano Okaka will be replaced by Andre Gray (Watford).

Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) hammers the ball towards the top left corner, but it's not so easy to put it beyond Heurelho Gomes, who denies him with a terrific save. Liverpool force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
CHANCE! Joel Matip (Liverpool) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!

Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than into the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
Sadio Mane slides a brilliant pass into Mohamed Salah (Liverpool), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Roberto Firmino is replaced by Divock Origi (Liverpool).
Sadio Mane plays a beautiful lofted pass to Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool), who somehow crashes the ball miles over the bar from a promising position.
Here comes a substitution. James Milner (Liverpool) is brought on as a substitute for Mohamed Salah.
The referee Anthony Taylor awards Simon Mignolet (Liverpool) a yellow card.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Trent Alexander-Arnold and he is replaced by Joe Gomez (Liverpool).

Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Simon Mignolet stops the ball from going inside right post. There's an opportunity for Jose Holebas (Watford) to deliver the ball into the box from a corner.

Richarlison (Watford) latched onto the corner kick inside the box and unleashed a dangerous attempt. The ball went towards the top of the net, but Simon Mignolet anticipated his intention and deflected it onto the bar.
Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Mohamed Elneny sends a superb cross into the box. Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Kasper Schmeichel beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
GOAL! Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) scores with a header from close range after Harry Maguire headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 1:1.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
It's in the back of the net! Marc Albrighton plays it into the box, and Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the middle of the net. 1:2.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) plants his close-range header just wide of the left post after a cross into the box.
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Sead Kolasinac finds Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball into the middle of the goal. 2:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the left side of the goal. The score is 2:3.

What a wasted opportunity by Hector Bellerin (Arsenal)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the right side of the goal, but Kasper Schmeichel makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
Mohamed Elneny will be replaced by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Rob Holding will be replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
A lofted pass to the edge of the six-yard box is won in the air by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal), but his tame header goes well wide of the left post.
Daniel Amartey (Leicester) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Shinji Okazaki.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) pounces on a great cross inside the box, but lashes his powerful first-time shot a whisker past the left post.
Here is a change. Danny Welbeck is going off and Arsene Wenger gives the last tactical orders to Theo Walcott (Arsenal).
The substitution has been made. Kelechi Iheanacho (Leicester) has replaced Matthew James.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and slams the ball inside the left post. What a wonderful strike!
Alexandre Lacazette (Arsenal) unleashes a bullet of a shot that is blocked by a defender. The ball goes out of play. Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) rises highest to meet a perfect corner kick deep into the box and strikes with a bullet header to beat the helpless goalkeeper! His header went in off the post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marc Albrighton as he is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Wes Morgan (Leicester) for his harsh tackle.
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
